Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Françoise est âgée de 44 ans et vit au Bénin. Françoise est mariée à un certain Germain. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Françoise vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Françoise a très peu fréquenté l’école. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Françoise mène comme activité depuis huit ans environs, la vente du maïs, de la farine de blé et du sucre. Françoise s'approvisionne dans l'un des plus grands marchés du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Françoise et les autres membres du groupe MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY sollicitent un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY is composed of five members who attend the same church. The group representative is named Françoise and she is raising her hand in the photo.  In order to grow the level of their activity and better respond to the demand of their clientele, this group is requesting their first loan from  ALIDé. 

Françoise, 44, lives in Bénin. She is married to Germain. The couple have four children, all enrolled in school and all under their roof. Françoise lives with her husband and children. She attended school only for a short while. To support herself and her children, Françoise has been selling maize, wheat flour and sugar for about eight years. She buys her supplies at one of the biggest markets in Bénin. 

In order to expand their businesses and better satisfy their clientele, Françoise and the other members of the MAHUTIN COCOTOMEY group are requesting a loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to grow the level of their business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of maize, wheat flour, and sugar.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
This is Nida, 43, a resident of Pasay City, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a street vendor, and a mother to her four children. The oldest is in college while the youngest is staying at home. Together with her husband and children, she manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Nida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nida earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nida hopes to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carlos Eduardo

texts.es:
Carlos Eduardo tiene 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive con el hijo de trece años de edad  en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVOS UNIDOS, se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

Carlos Eduardo se dedica al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café, etc. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.
 
Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño de aquí a cinco años es poderse comprar una casa para poderle dejar a su hijo.

Le gusta escuchar música, salir y compartir momentos amenos junto a su hijo y  amigos.
texts.en:
Carlos Eduardo is 33 years old, single and living with his 13-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nuevos Unidos” (New United Ones) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, banana, oranges and coffee.

Carlos Eduardo farms corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas, coffee, etc.  He makes his purchases and sells his products at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure for his crops.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  The challenges he faces are drops in prices of the products he sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  His five-year plan is to be able to buy a house to leave to his son.

He enjoys listening to music, going out and sharing pleasant moments with his son and friends.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Genny Amparo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Genny, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6 hijos, tres de ellos  ya son mayores de edad y los tres menores que estudian en colegio y escuela, cuatro de ellos aun viven con ella. Su marido es comerciante y agricultor.

Ella realiza el crédito para el negocio del esposo el cual se dedican a  la venta de frutas y legumbres, para lo cual se desplaza hasta la ciudad de Manta donde vende sus productos por las calles en un triciclo, él vende productos que el mismo cultiva y también compra en el mercado de Manta los productos que le hacen falta, trabaja los días martes, jueves y sábados ya que los otros días se dedica a la agricultura. Lleva realizando esto por más de 15 años y esta es la fuente del sustento de la familia.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres. Es fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener una casa bien construida.
texts.en:
The  members of the "María Auxiliadora" communal bank meet in Sequita parish, which is part of Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí province. It is full of hard-working, committed people, who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish where the residents are decent people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families. 

This is where we met Genny, who is 45, married, with 6 children. Three of her children are adults, and the three youngest go to school; 4 of them still live with her.  Her husband is a merchant and farmer.  She is undertaking the loan for her husband's business.  He sells fruits and vegetables. For this, he travels to the city of Manta, where he sells his products in the street from a tricycle.

He sells products that he himself grows, and also buys products he needs in the Manta market. He works Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays, since on the other days he farms. He's been doing this for more than 15 years, and this is the main source of livelihood for the family. This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.  

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and likes the easier terms for getting loans. Her dream is to have a well-constructed house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Joseline Jeannette

texts.es:
La joven Joseline tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con su mamá y sus hermanas.

La clienta se dedica a cuidar niños desde hace 10 años con su mamá, quien le ha enseñado el oficio y le ayuda desarrollar esta actividad.

Ella esta solicitando un préstamo a Fundacion Campo para ampliar su casa ya que quiere construir una habitación mas. Actualemnte, Joseline y su familia viven en una casa de una sola habitación la cual fue construida por su padre hace ya muchos años. Hace mucho tiempo que Joseline y su mamá han querido hacer mejoras a la casa, pero han invertido lo que ganan el la educación de una de las hermanas de Joseline. 

Con el préstamo, Joseline espera pagar por el techo, paredes repelladas, y piso de cemento para la nueva habitación. Al mejorar su casa Joseline y su familia estará más cómoda, ya que en la actualidad una sola habitación la comparten 4 personas.

En un futuro Joseline espera poder seguir mejorando su casa poco a poco.
texts.en:
Joseline, 20, is a single young lady living with her mother and sisters.  She has been working caring for children with her mother for the last ten years.  Her mother has taught her this occupation and helps her carry out this activity.

She is asking Fundación Campo for a loan to enlarge her house because she wants to add another room.  Currently, Joseline and her family live in a one room house that was built by her father many years ago.  Joseline and her mother have wanted to do these home improvements for a long time now but have invested their earnings in the education of one of Joseline’s sisters.

With the loan, Joseline hopes to pay for the roof, plastered walls and cement floor of the new room.  By improving her house, Joseline and her family will be more comfortable because currently the one room is shared by four people.  In the future, Joseline hopes to continue to improve her house little by little.

loans.use: to add a room to the house.

loans.name: Laura Alejandrina

texts.es:
La Señora. Laura es socia del banco comunal La Esquina, vive por la parroquia de Sinincay, esta parroquia tiene hermoso lugares en donde se puede observar la naturaleza, una gran variedad de platos típicos, su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones, se caracterizan por ser personas amables y gentiles.

Doña Laura tiene 34 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 14, 13, 10 y 2 años de edad, 2 estudian en el colegio y 1 en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo  labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Laura se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, ella tiene cuyes, pollos y en especial ganado, ella arrienda potreros para alimentar su ganado. Trabaja en esta labor ya que le da el tiempo para cuidar de sus hijos.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir para la compra de alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es comprar potreros para criar mas ganado.
texts.en:
Laura is a member of the communal bank "La Esquina."  She lives in the Sinincay parish.  Here one can find beautiful places to observe nature, a great variety of traditional dishes, and people who maintain their culture and traditions.  The people here are known for their kindness and friendliness.

Laura is 34 years old and married.  Her marriage has produced 4 children who are now aged 14, 13, 10 and 2.  Two of the children are in school, and one is in an elementary school in the city.  Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer.  They own the home that they live in.

Laura has a business raising and selling animals.  She raises guinea pigs, chickens, and especially cattle.  She rents pasture lands to feed her livestock.  She does this type of work because it gives her time to care for her children.

She has been a member of her communal bank for 5 years, and she will invest this new loan in the purchase of feed for her animals.

Her goal is to buy pasture land so that she can raise more livestock.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Mahmadi

texts.en: Mahmadi is dedicated to agriculture and the sale of cultivated vegetables. This means that he can be around his family, helping to raise their quality of life and educate all his six children. Mahmadi has been characterized as a person who is hard working, since he has been working in agriculture for seven years. This kind of work requires effort, dedication and, above all, strength; it can include heavy work, meaning that people get tired quickly. In spite of this, Mahmadi is determined to raise the level of living in his family and to improve the quality of the seeds he cultivates. For this reason, he is asking for help in order to be able to receive more credit from IMON International.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru: Мархабо замужем имеет детей невесток и внуков. Муж работает таксистом. Она предприниматель разного профиля. Занимается откормом скота, выращиванием помидоров, продажей неочищенного риса. Семья у них большая и содержать семью в достатке удается не всем. Мархабо хочет получить займ  для строительства дома и улучшения благосостояния семьи. Она надеется на одобрение займа.
texts.en: Marhabo is married and has children, daughters-in-law and grandchildren.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Marhabo is a multidisciplinary entrepreneur.  She is involved in fattening up livestock, growing tomatoes and selling unprocessed rice.  She has a large family, and it is not always possible to provide abundance for them.  Marhabo wants to obtain a loan to build a house and improve her family's well-being.  She hopes that her loan will be approved.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y 3 hijos de 14 años, 12 años y un bebe de 4 meses.

El señor José, se dedica a prestar sus servicios de motorista  y al comercio de ropa de vestir, lociones y cosméticos en junto con su compañera de vida, quines tienen  más de 6 años de dedicarse ha esta actividad, la cual la aprendió de un familiar que se dedicaba al comercio de ropa. 

Actualmente cuentan con  4 docenas de prendas de vestir como: blusa para damas, camisas para caballero y ropa de bebe. El señor José siempre se ha dedicado a prestar sus servios como motorista, hoy en día en apoyo de su compañera de vida a la venta de ropa.

La mercadería la compra en un departamento de la zona oriental del país, que se encuentra ha 26 kilómetros de la ciudad de donde el vive, en esta cuidad se pueden comprar la ropa ha precio cómodos para su comercialización y también donde él vive en el día del comercio que son los domingos, cuando llegan comerciantes de otras zonas ha vender ropa. 

José invertirá el préstamo en la compra de ropa, para su comercialización: como lo son, 5 docenas de blusas para damas, 5 docenas de faldas,  5 docenas de camisas para caballeros, 5 docenas de pantalones y  para bebe: pañales, mantillas cuturinas calcetines, gorros, entre otros más.

Al comprar toda esta ropa contara con mercadería de moda y abastecerá la demanda que tiene en este momento, ya que llegan clientes a su vivienda donde comercializa y les dice que no tiene hasta la próxima semana. Realizando la inversión él podrá satisfacer la demanda existente y de esta manera venderá más y por ende sus niveles de ingresos o ganancias incrementaran. Con estos ingresos tiene planeado adquirir vitrinas donde pueda mostrar sus prendas de vestir, adquiriendo mobiliario para establecer un mini bazar, mejorar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en:
José, 33, lives with his partner and three children aged 14, 12, and 4 months. He works providing his services as a driver and selling clothing, lotions, and cosmetics together with his partner. They have more than six years of experience in this line of work and learned it from a family member who worked in the clothing industry.They currently have 4 dozen garments including women's blouses, men's shirts, and baby clothing. José has always worked as a driver but today he supports his partner in selling clothing.

José will use the loan to buy clothing for his business including: 5 dozen women's blouses, 5 dozen skirts, 5 dozen men's shirts, 5 dozen pairs of pants, and diapers, socks, caps, etc. for babies. He purchases the merchandise from an area in the eastern zone of the country, 26 miles outside of the city where he lives. In this city one can buy clothing at an affordable price. Also where he lives Sundays are the days for other storekeepers to come from other places to sell clothing.

By buying this clothing, he will be able to have fashionable merchandise and meet the demand that he has at this time, as he currently has clients coming to his home and he has to tell them they have to wait until next week. With this loan he will be able to meet existing demand and thus sell more and increase his income and earning levels. With this income he is planning to purchase windows that can display his clothing, buying furniture to establish a mini bazaar, and improving the roof to his home.

loans.use: to buy women's blouses, skirts, men's shirts, pants, diapers, and socks and caps for babies

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last two years.  He is 26 years old, married to Penina and they have one child.  

Peter was introduced to KADET by one of our existing clients and this will be his first loan.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs.

In the future, Peter hopes to expand his farming business and get more income, thereby improving his family's living.

loans.use: buy farm inputs

loans.name: Monzer

texts.en:
Monzer is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children, one of whom is working. Despite his older age, he is still courageous and brave, searching for a better life for his family.

He has owned a mini market in his town for the past 28 years. He has a good reputation and a fair number of loyal clients.

Today, he is asking for a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one. He notes that this Kiva loan will help him increase his business sales thus his income. 

In the future, he plans to further expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory to add to his existing one.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 53 years old and married with 2 children.

Aida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling feed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Aida has previously borrowed and paid back 15 loans from NWTF. She has been running the business for 10 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Aida aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La  sra. Maria tiene 50 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de naranjas, su negocio lo  tiene ubicado  en el caserio Somotillo,. todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para comprar sus naranjas al por mayor y luego salir a venderlas, la  sra Maria cuenta  con  el apoyo  de  sus  hijos para la venta de las naranjas, el credito lo utilizara para la compra de naranjas al por mayor, sus ventas han aumentado y en ocasiones se queda sin producto. 
Maria en sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia y tambien se dedica a criar gallinas.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is 50 years old and sells oranges. Her business is located in the village of Somotillo. Every day she wakes up early so that she can buy oranges in bulk and sell them later. Sra. Maria has the help of her children with selling oranges.

This loan will be used to buy oranges in bulk. Her sales have increased and sometimes she runs out of product. In her free time, Maria goes to church and also raises chickens.

loans.use: to buy oranges in bulk.

loans.name: Karamatkan

texts.en:
The first Kiva loan helped Karamatkan to purchase cattle. Today she has a farm with six cows, six heifers, two bull-calves, and one horse, which allows her to earn about 5,000 KGS in a month. 

Now, Karamatkan plans to broaden her business activities by land-cultivating. For this reason she is applying for her second Kiva loan of 60,000 KGS to  purchase seeds of tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Maria Limbany

texts.es: La señora Maria Limbany desde la muerte de su hermano se ha convertido en el apoyo económico para su madre. Además de sus 5 hijos, Maria Limbany ha tenido que luchar fuertemente para sacar toda su familia adelante, pues hace aproximadamente 9 meses murió su hermano, quién con su fábrica de arepas era el sostenimiento para su familia. Es por esto que junto con su madre, Maria Limbany quiere reabrir la fábrica de arepas que tenía su hermano que funcionaba desde su casa, pero para ello, requiere de la compra de algunos equipos necesarios para la producción de las arepas. Maria Limbany y su madre, sueñan con tener un gran negocio con bastante clientela, y que sean reconocidos por la calidad de sus productos.
texts.en: Since her brother's death, Maria Limbany has become her mother's source of financial support. Maria Limbany has five children and she has had to work hard to provide for her whole family because, approximately 9 months ago, her brother died. He had an 'arepa' factory and provided for the family. Together with her mother, Maria Limbany would like to re-open the arepa factory that her brother had at home. However, in order to do this, she needs to buy some necessary equipment for making arepas. Maria Limbany and her mother dream of having a large business with a lot of customers. They would like to be well known for the quality of their products.

loans.use: to buy production equipment

loans.name: Djiguène Bakhna 42 Group

texts.fr:
L e  groupe de crédit  Djiguène  Bakhna 42 regroupe cinq femmes qui font de la vente de fruits et légumes.
La  présidente madame Ngoné  exerce le commerce depuis 10 ans et son activité consiste à vendre des fruits et des légumes dans le marché local. Ngoné  arrive à subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille. Dans l’avenir elle voudra avoir son propre magasin et être autonome.
texts.en: The group Djiguène Bakhna 42 is made up of five women who sell fruit and vegetables. The head of the group, Ngoné, has been in business for 10 years and she sells fruit and vegetables at the local market. She manages to provide for her family's needs. In the future, she would like to have her own shop and be independent.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Anthony.  He is married and has 1 child. She is 12 years old and goes to school. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him because they are going to school and they help him with domestic affairs.  

In 2002, Anthony established his cosmetics, provisions and drinks business. He got his High School Diploma and was looking forward to going to college, but due to a lack of financial support, he had to set up a petty trade through the help of a distant relative. His business was growing gradually when a friend advised him to learn a trade out of the little he saved. He paid his fees towards a technical vocation. With the help of his younger brother, he was able to handle the business and also learn a trade. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,157,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Anthony has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase Body Spray – 50- pieces @ Le30, Body Cream - 50 pieces @ Le20,000, Ovaltine - 40 pieces @ Le20,000, Mayonnaise - 50 pieces @ Le20,000 Soft Drinks - 10 crates @ Le30,000 and Star Beer - 8 crates @ Le50,000. 

In the future, Anthony plans to open another outlet. The loan will help as it will enable him buy more stock and make profit. Changes in cost of commodities are his main challenge.  It results to decreases on sales.  He wants more financing and he is looking forward to this subsequent loan. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy provisions and cosmetics for his business

loans.name: Gnanbossou Gbeta Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GNANBOSSOU GBETA est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Jacqueline, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 40 ans est mariée à un agent de sécurité du nom de Daniel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Jacqueline vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Jacqueline et son mari. Jacqueline n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour ce faire, depuis vingt  ans, Jacqueline vend des vivres à son domicile. Jacqueline s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Jacqueline sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GNANBOSSOU GBETA un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter ses vivres.

loans.name: Mahugnon 10 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUGNON 10 est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Sourou Justine, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 32 ans est mariée à un certain Georges. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Sourou Justine vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par le couple. Sourou Justine n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour cette raison, Sourou Justine vend des cubes (aliment pour assaisonnement) depuis trois ans. Sourou Justine s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Sourou Justine sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHUGNON 10 un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des cubes.

loans.name: Lucia Eladia

texts.es: Lucía es una mujer de 55 años que vive junto a su esposo en la localidad rural de Segundia, que está ubicada en Moquegua. Ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la cría de ganado vacuno orgánico, poniendo siempre mucha atención en el cuidado y en la alimentación que les brinda, que está constituida por la alfalfa orgánica que cultiva; además de ello, tiene un negocio de venta de abarrotes. Solicita el micro crédito para poder comprar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa orgánica para la alimentación de su ganado vacuno orgánico. En el futuro espera poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y seguir contando con buena salud, razón por la cual apuesta por lo orgánico.

loans.use: Para comprar un terreno agrícola sembrado con alfalfa orgánica para alimentar a su ganado vacuno orgánico

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a thriving, driven smallholder farmer, a force to be reckoned with. She is a proud smallholder woman who started practicing farming out of economic necessity. She learned the trade from her parents, and now she honors them by continuing it. She farms a small plot of land in the green, lush hills of Kakwet, Nandihills, which is in the North rift region of Kenya. Joan is happily married and is blessed with a lovely family. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming. She grows maize and vegetables, and she also keeps dairy cows. Joan has been able to provide nutritious food for her family. She earns profits selling a variety of food crops, but she is faced with the challenge of delivering the produce in a timely manner to the market. This challenge has not made her give up and she states "I have to do something for my three children." 

Joan joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a microfinance institution that assists aspiring women like her. She requests a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a motorbike. Joan is from a remote village that has poor roads, and transporting her produce to the market has been a challenge. She has suffered many losses of perishable products (milk, vegetables, and tomatoes) which require timely delivery to the market. This loan will help Joan to achieve her dream and reach her goals. 

For smallholder women in Nandihills, accessing a financial solution is tough, but Joan feels relieved to know that there are institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo and Kiva that help women. The benefits of this loan are many and one of them is that Joan will never suffer losses due to delay in delivering produce to the market. She will increase her sales volume because she will be able to transport more goods to the market. As a result, her income will increase. 

Joan intends to employ someone to ride the motorbike and help with farm work. Joan will use the loan to improve her living conditions and assure her children of a secure future. You can help Joan with the loan she needs and get her closer to accomplishing her dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Blanca Nelly

texts.en:
In the city of Santa Catarina in the state of Nuevo Leon lives Blanca. She sells shoes by catalogue and has been doing so for the past 8 years. She is married and has one son that is currently studying. She started with the business because she liked sales and she wanted to help her husband, as she has always been a very active and very devoted mother of her family. The project she started was of great help, and it is thanks to this that her son has been able to continue his studies.

Today Blanca requires a loan in the amount of $475 that will be used to purchase merchandise to increase her inventory and therefore increase her sales. Her clients will have a greater selection to choose from. You can help Blanca continue to grow. You only need to decide now, do not doubt any longer. Your generosity will grant this family a better wellbeing.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En la localidad de Santa Catarina, en el estado de Nuevo León vive Blanca, ella se dedica a la venta de calzado por catálogo y tiene con esta actividad una antigüedad de 8 años, es casada y tiene un hijo, el cual se encuentra estudiando. Ella inició con el negocio por que le gustan las ventas y para poder ayudar a su esposo, ya que siempre ha sido una persona muy activa y comprometida con su familia. Este proyecto que ella inició ha sido de mucha ayuda, pues gracias a esto su hijo a podido seguir estudiando.

En este momento Blanca requiere un préstamo por la cantidad de $475 DLLS , que utilizará para la compra de mercancía, incrementar sus existencia, y de esta manera poder percibir un incremento en las ventas, pues los clientes podrán tener más variedad. Tu puedes apoyar a Blanca a continuar creciendo, solo hace falta que te decidas, no lo dudes más, tu generosidad puede hacer que esta familia tenga un mejor bienestar.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Lem Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is married wit four children. She likes business but has limited capital. She applied for her first loan in 2003. She invested in pig farming. With training on business management and profit from the business, there was need for another loan to expand and also do trading (buyam-sellam). She lost all her animals but never got discouraged. She is applying for her third loan.

With this $800 she is determined to revised her business and add more articles because of demand from the community. She plans to buy in bulk dry fish, "egusi", crayfish, and beans to retail and supply to other people to sell. Also she will buy 2 piglets. With the profit from this business she is determined to buy farming land for herself.

loans.use: Buy food for distribution; piglets

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Mrs Hong is 47 and her husband is 48 years old. They have 5 children between 25 and 11. Their elder children stopped going to school and they work as daily laborers but they can’t earn enough money to support themselves. The two youngest children are going to school in grades 9 and 2. The family has only 3000 square meters of where they plant baby cashew nut trees. Mrs. Hong sells rice cakes and eggs at the small market and in addition she raises a female pig. This has increased their income about $1/person/month. Their average income is $9/person/month. Now she wants to borrow $75 to raise and sell a pig.

loans.use: Raise a pig for sale

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en:
Mavjuda has big family. She has 4 children and her husband's salary is not enough to support the family. Mavjuda has been engaged in trade for over 14 years. Her business is sewing oriental robes and selling them in the market. This is their family business, a tradition that has been transmitted from mothers to children. Since childhood, Mavjuda and her sisters helped their mother sew robes for the market.

Now her mother is an old woman and Mavjuda and her elder sister sell robes in the market. Their trade place is located in Jumabazaar, a big clothing market in Khujand. Now the turnover of her business is fast and she has many clients. She wants purchase fabric for the next batch of robes. She is requesting $500 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchase fabric to make robes

loans.name: Ni Ketut Nariwati

texts.id:
Ibu Nariwati started rearing pigs after marrying to Pak Temon. From this activity, she the mother of two manage to earn about Rp 20.000,00 per day. Every 3 months, from her sales she manage to earn about Rp 1.200.000,00. And every year she manage to earn up to Rp 4.800.000,00. Part of her capital comes from the financial assistance from Dinari. Her plan now is to increase her number of pigs. She depends very much on this business, because her husband's salary as a sand carrier is seasonal.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ibu Nariwati sudah menekuni usaha ternak babi sejak menikah dengan Pak Temon. Dari usaha ini - ibu dua orang anak ini - bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari-hari yang mencapai Rp 20.000,00 /hari. Tiap tiga bulan Ibu Nariwati memanen babinya, hasil panen terakhir ini keuntungan yang diperoleh Rp 1.200.000,00 sekali panen. Dalam satu tahun Bu Nariwati melakukan panen 4 kali sehingga keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp 4.800.000,00 /tahun. Sebagian modalnya merupakan hasil pinjaman dari Dinari. Rencananya dia akan menambah jumlah bibit babinya. Tentunya, dia sangat bergantung dengan usahanya ini. Karena usahanya ini jelas dengan pendapatan yang jelas. Sedangkan penghasilan suami yang bekerja sebagai sopir truk pengangkut batu/pasir - yang baru dapat hasil kalau ada order

loans.use: Menambah bibit babi - Buying piglets.

loans.name: Bismarck Antonio

texts.es:
Bismarck is a married man with two children in school. He is not married but lives with a woman with whom he aspires to establish a family along with his children.

Before he had his own business he was employed by a merchant. When he first started his trade he didn't have a workplace and had a very small inventory. His starting capital was $150 U.S. dollars, yet nevertheless over the years he has managed to situate his business in a fixed location and establish himself there. As of today he has had his own business for three years now.

One year ago he began his relationship with CEPRODEL and it was thanks to the loan he received that he was able to pay his debts, increase his inventory and move ahead. Before starting with CEPRODEL his only help were the moneylenders that made him pay almost 100% interest on his salary. He has obtained 5 loans.

<> Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer.

Bismarck es un hombre casado con dos hijos a su cargo en edad escolar, el no esta casado pero vive con una señora con la que pretende establecer una familia junto con sus hijos.

Antes de iniciar el era empleado de una comerciante. Cuando inicio su negocio no tenia un local y su inventario era poco. Su capital inicial fue de US$150.00, sin embargo a medida que han transcurrido los años logro encontrar un local y se establecio en el mismo. Hoy en dia ya tiene tres años de tener su propio negocio.

Hace 1 año inicio con CEPRODEL y fue gracias al credito oprtuno brindado logro pagar lo que debia de su local e incrementar su inventario, y salir adelante ya que antes de recurrir a CEPRODEL su unica ayuda eran los prestamistas que le cobraban casi el 100% de interes sobre su saldo real. Su record es de 5 creditos.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Hikmat

texts.en: This single man was born in 1980. He lives in Salyan region, in the Khaladj village. He has been in  the farming business for 7 years. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells drinks and provisions. She is from Edo State, Nigeria. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children.

Mary needs a loan of $525 to buy more drinks and provisions to sell. She studied this business for two years and started hers in 1999.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions for sale

loans.name: Wilber Alexis

texts.es:
At the age of 16, Mr. Wilbur G. started working in automotive repair shops, where he learned his current profession. He has been working in the auto body and paint business for 17 years. He is always working in this activity, which has yielded good results for him because he has been perfecting his skills over the years, turning out an excellent finished product.

His body shop, which he set up himself, is located at his house. He also provides services at his customers’ homes. He works from 6:00am to 6:00pm seven days a week. His job has allowed him to support his family and improve their standard of living. He would like to build a room for his children so that they may have more privacy and comfort.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Don Wilber a la edad de 16 años empezó a trabajar en talleres de mecánica automotriz y fue ahí donde aprendió a lo que hoy se dedica, lleva 17 años de dedicarse a enderezar y pintar vehículos, actividad a la que le dedica todo el tiempo y la cual le ha generado buenos resultados, ya que con el tiempo se ha ido perfeccionando, trabajando fino y brindando un excelente producto terminado.

En su casa tiene su pequeño taller que él mismo montó, también sale a realizar trabajos a domicilio, trabaja de 6:00 a.m. a 6:00p.m. todos los días de la semana. Su trabajo le ha permitido mantener a su familia y mejorarle la condición de vida de cada uno de sus miembros. El señor desea construir un cuarto para sus hijos en el cual puedan tener mayor independencia y así puedan estar más cómodos.

loans.use: Purchase of cinder blocks, cement, sand, and iron to build a room

loans.name: Budumbuli West A (Iv) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Muyinda N.. She is currently in the business of maize milling and is requesting a loan to buy more maize and a fridge. Muyinda is 31 years old and is married with a husband that engineer for work. She has 5 children ranging from age 5 to 2 and her children go to school. Each week, Muyinda makes approximately UGX 120000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save it for future needs Muyinda has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to buy more maize and the loan was paid back on time.

Muyinda is joined in her small group by Hadijja N., Robinah Kavuma and Sarah N.. Hadijja N. has a business in used clothing sales and wants to expand to bulk selling. Robinah Kavuma is currently operating a business in used clothing sales and wants a loan to increase cloth purchases. Sarah N. operates a business of milk selling and wants to buy a fridge.

loans.use: To boost and expand maize milling business

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: I am Nasreen A. from the small city of Mian Channu, Pakistan. I live here in a one room brick house with my husband and four kids: three boys and one girl. I used to run a grocery store but it was losing money so I had to shut it down. My husband drives a donkey cart to transport goods on order. We need to expand our income and therefore we have decided to buy an additional donkey cart, which we will rent out to supplement our income.  I have a few other women in my loan group who are also in need of loans for their businesses. Khalida B.’s husband works in a local food market, Sakina B.’s husband sells vests, Parween B. has a furniture business, and Salma B.’s husband sells rice.

loans.use: Buy an additional donkey cart

loans.name: Buluk C 2027-4 Group

texts.en: The group leader of this small group is Emma S.. She is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Emma is 50 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has 3 children ranging in age from 15 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Emma makes approximately 400 Sudanese pounds in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. Emma is joined in her small group by Rose P., Vonconca K., Grace J., and Betty K..  Rose P. has a business selling charcoal and wants to buy a car.  Vonconca K. is currently operating a business selling vegetables and wants a loan to buy a television.  Grace J. operates a business selling vegetables and wants to expand her business.  Betty K. is currently in the business of selling vegetables and is requesting a loan to open up a bar.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Hirobon

texts.ru:
Hirobon B. lives in the city of Yavan. She takes care of the household and farm animals. She has a cow and sells the cow's milk to the neighbors. Hirobon would like to begin producing yogurts. But there is not enough milk from one cow for this kind of business. This is why Hirobon would like to purchase another milk cow. Additional milk will help Hirobon start her business. She is 50 years old and has 3 children. They live together and help each other. She plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Startseva, Kiva Volunteer.

Бобомуродова Хиробон проживает в городе Яван. Домохозяйка , занимается животноводством. Имеет корову , молоко которой продает соседям. Хочет начать свой бизнес по производству кисло-молочных продуктов . Но получаемого молока не хватает для такого рода производства. Пэтому она хочет получить кредит и купить еще одну дойную корову. Дополнительное молоко поможет Хиробон начать свой бизнес. Ей 50 лет и она имеет 3 детей , и все они живут дружно и весело. Погашать кредит сможет в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase a cow

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Mrs. Thou N. is a dried fish seller in the market and she makes about $5 per day. Her husband is an ox merchant. He makes about $1.60 per day. They have five children; one of whom is married, living in Kork Daung Village, Siem Reap Province. One of their daughters is a tailor who graduated recently from professional school. She operates a tailoring business, but she doesn’t have enough capital to run the business. Mrs. N. is requesting a loan of $1000 to build a store for her daughter’s tailor business.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: To build a store for her daughter’s tailor business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 41 years old and has settled in the town of Khirdalan.  He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Kalbadjar region in Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He began his general store business 16 years ago. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy more goods to help improve his business.

loans.use: to buy goods

loans.name: Ederlinda

texts.es:
La Señora Ederlinda, socia del Banco Comunal “Las Orquídeas”, vive en la Región y Provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la confección y venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños y sábanas que después sale a vender a sus amigos, familiares y a clientes en los pueblos más cercanos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000, el cual cancelará en 06 meses, comprará hilos de diferentes colores, blondas, telas de diversas variedades, colores y acabados, elásticos, agujas, etc., y de esa manera poder contar con lo necesario para tener un buen acabado en las prendas que ella confecciona y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes.

Ederlinda tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos quienes la motivan en todo lo que ella se propone. Es una mujer positiva y emprendedora. Su meta es comprar una maquina industrial para tener su propio taller de costura y dar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ederlinda is a partner in the "Orchids" Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín region and province, in the Tarapoto district. Ederlinda is a seamstress, and she sells clothing for women, men, and children, as well as sheets. She sells these products to her friends, family, and clients in nearby towns. With a loan of 1,000 soles, Ederlinda will buy colored thread, lace, a variety of fabrics, as well as hems, elastics, needles, etc. She'll pay back the loan in six months. In this way Ederlinda can have the necessary tools to add detail to the clothes that she makes, and satisfy her clients. Ederlinda is 37 years old, and lives with her husband and children. She is an optimistic, hard-working woman, and her family is the motivation behind all that she does. Ederlinda's goal is to buy an industrial sewing machine in order to have her own sewing workshop and create jobs others.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will by thread, lace, fabric, elastics, etc.

loans.name: Egam

texts.en: J. Egam has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006 and he is serious and reliable. Thanks to the previous loans, he improved his business and increased his sales.  He started out selling small household goods, and now he has a wood material trading outlet. He has 20 years of experience in this business and has the appropriate skills. Mr. J. Egam applies to KIVA for a business development loan of 4000 STJ (USD $1200) for 4 months to import big lots. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: business development loan

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria O. lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs at Ugbiokho market in Benin City. She sells foodstuffs like beans, dried pepper, rice, tomatoes paste, etc. Gloria has lots of customers. She hopes for the loan amount of N52,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders and LAPO MICROFINANCE (Kiva's Field Partner) for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe benkadi sont des femmes mariées vivant dans des foyers polygames avec en moyenne deux enfants.
Elles se sont connues par des liens de mariage et de voisinage et résident toutes à sanankoroba.

Elles s’approvisionnent soit à Bamako soit aux marchés du village et environnants dex fois par mois.
Avec ce prêt elles désirent avoir  100  kilogrammes de condiments et  800  kilogrammes degraines d’arachide pour réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 44.000 FCFA  à fin de payer l’intérêt du prêt et participer aux dépenses de la famille.

Elles sont à leur sixième  prêt et tous les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
A travers l’association siguidja du village, elles ont intégré le programme de prêt solidaire de soro yiriwa so pour faire prospéré leurs révenus.
texts.en:
The members of this Benkadi group are married women living in polygamous households with an average of 2 children each. They met because of ties of marriage and neighborhood, and all reside in Sanankoroba.

They do their buying either in Bamako (the capital of Mali) or in the market in their vilage and neighboring ones, two times a month.

With this loan they would like to have 100 kg of condiments and 800 kg of peanuts to make an average monthly profit of 44,000 F CFA to use to make repayments on the loan and help out with family living expenses.

They are on their 6th loan, with all preceding loans correctly reimbursed. Through the village Siguidja association, they joined the solidarity loan program of Soro Yiriwaso so that they could boost their incomes.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of condiments, peanuts, and cosmetics for women

loans.name: Faysal

texts.en:
Faysal is a 26-year-old an who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon. He has been doing tattoos for five years. 

Faysal has requested a loan of $1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase a new tool for tattoos. This is his second loan cycle and he has always paid on schedule. 

Faysal is distinguished in his work because tattooing is a difficult and rare business. His clients are his friends and neighbors. The loan has influenced his life in a good way.

loans.use: Faysal needs the loan to purchase a new tattoo tool.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.es:
Durante muchos años, Loreta se ha dedicado a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo. Aunque ha ido variando la marca ella se mantuvo en su negocio y a sus clientes también. Gracias a su empeño y a su astucia ha sabido aprovechar de las promociones que las empresas de cosméticos le brindaban para poder generar mayores ganancias. 

Cuando su hijo menor creció le dio la idea de alquilar cabinas de Internet en su casa, y así lo hizo. Y es así, con la ayuda de el, que puede manejar sus dos negocios.

Loreta siempre a sido muy trabajadora, cuando era joven gracias a su trabajo como obrera en una empresa particular pudo construir su casa junto con la ayuda de su esposo. Con el paso del tiempo ese empeño no ha disminuido y aun continúa planeando como puede crecer en sus dos negocios actuales.
texts.en:
Loreta has worked for many years selling beauty products by catalogue. Although she has changed the brands that she sells, she has maintained her business and her customers. Thanks to her determination and astuteness she has taken advantage of the promotions offered by cosmetic companies to generate greater earnings. When her youngest son grew up he suggested that she open an internet cafe in her home, and so she did. With her son's help she is able to manage her two businesses. Loreta has always been a very hard-worker. When she was young, thanks to her job in a private company, she was able to build her own home together with support from her husband. Over the years this determination has not diminished, and she still continues to plan how she can grow her two current businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her cosmetics business

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann M. owns a rice field. She and her husband grow rice to support their family. She is 34 years old and has 4 children. Her life is on the farm, and almost all of their produce is reserved for their family's consumption, while the remainder is sold to the rice traders in their village. Because this is the family's only source of livelihood, Mary Ann wants to expand her farm. By doing so, she believes, she will have more harvest and income for the family.

She is requesting a loan of Php 11,000 to run her farm. She will use the loan to buy sacks of fertilizers and tanks of herbicides and insecticides to increase crop yield. She is also thinking of some other business lines to augment the family's income.

CEVI (Kiva's Field Partner) helps Mary Ann sustain her farm. She is provided with credit assistance, trainings and insurance coverage by CEVI to make her business grow.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides and herbicides for her farm.

loans.name: Efren

texts.es:
Efren se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno y a la  siembra de papa cuya producción  vende a comerciantes de la zona.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Kallutaca de la Provincia  Los Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a  dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.
Como segunda actividad se dedica al transporte publico en el vehiculo que es de su propiedad

Vive junto a su esposa y su pequeño hijo 
 
El crédito lo destinara para incrementar su capital para poder comprar una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Efren raises cattle and farms potatoes to sell the produce to local businessmen. He lives with his wife and young son in Kallutaca de la Provincia de los Andes, of the La Paz department, located two hours from the city of La Paz, Bolivia. As a second job, he uses his own automobile to provide public transportation. A loan would enable him to buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production. It is his first loan with Impro; his evaluation qualifies him to receive it.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for selling milk.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario R. is married, and a new member of Paglaum. Her husband is a carpenter. She has 3 children and her family lives in Purok, Sapang Dalaga.

She is requesting a loan as additional capital for her sari-sari store. The income of her husband is not enough for their daily needs and she is looking to increase their source of income. She decided  then to own and operate a sari-sari store and now plans is to expand her store into a convenience Store. She wishes to see her children succeed in their chosen fields of education.

loans.use: To purchase additional sari-sari store supplies

loans.name: Cecilio

texts.es:
Don Cecilio H. H. es un microempresario de 61años de edad, que vive con su esposa y tres hijos en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Su microempresa se dedica a la actividad lechera, produce leche y sus derivados, los cuales vende en la comunidad y alrededores. Sus clientes se muestran muy satisfechos al poder adquirir productos frescos y elaborados en un ambiente de confianza por una persona de la localidad. 

Afirma que siempre ha tenido vacas y terneros, por lo tanto conoce bien acerca de los cuidados y atención que se les debe dar a los animales para que produzcan en forma eficiente. Sin embargo, no fue hasta hace cinco años que tomó la actividad como una microempresa.

Toda microempresa tiene la necesidad de crecimiento, por lo que requiere invertir ¢650,000 (seiscientos cincuenta mil colones) en la compra de una vaca y un ternero, para poder incrementar su producción e ir satisfaciendo la demanda. Esto ayudará notablemente a mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia. 

Don Cecilio es cliente de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica este es su primer crédito y  espera poder concretarlo con éxito.
texts.en:
Mr. Cecilio H. H. is a 61-year-old micro-entrepreneur, who lives with his wife and three children, in a rural community in Costa Rica, called Mollejones de Platanares Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones is a community located 150 kilometers south of Costa Rica's capital, San José. It is 850 meters above sea level. They cultivate vegetables and coffee along with other kinds of activities like raising fat cattle and pigs. There are also some organic agricultural projects and vegetables in hydroponics. Besides agriculture, the community has mechanical workshops, a supermarket, small restaurants, and a furniture store. His micro-business is in the dairy field. He produces milk and its derivatives, which he then sells to the community and the surrounding towns. His clients seem very satisfied that they can get a hold of fresh products that are made in a trustworthy environment by a local person. He reports that he has always had cows and calves so he knows how to care for and how to treat the animals so they produce efficiently. However, it wasn't until five years ago that he turned it into a micro-business. All micro-businesses need to grow, which is why ¢650,000 are needed to invest in the purchase of a cow and a calf so he can increase his production and satisfy demand. This will really help him improve his and his family's living conditions. Mr. Cecilio is a client of Empresa de Crédito Comunal Bancruce one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This is his first loan and he hopes to pay it off successfully.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de una vaca lechera y un ternero

loans.name: Melchi Susana

texts.es: La Sra. Melchi R. tiene 34 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Francisco Flores, ellos tienen dos hijos que estan en el colegio, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de plastico al por mayor y al detalle, inicio su actividad hace 8 años, y en estos momentos necesita el credito para comprar mas producto ya que ella quiere salir a vender a varias comunidades cercanas de donde ella vive, y para comprar el producto necesita viajar a la frontera con el Salvador ya que ahi se compran las cosas mas baratas y de mejor calidad, es por eso que necesita el credito asi ella se va a abastecer de productos y tendra una mejor ganancia. su sueño es poder graduar sus hijos de la universidad para que puedan salir adelante en esta vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Melchi R. is 34 years old and married to Francisco Flores. They have two children that are in school. She sells plastic products wholesale and retail. She started doing this 8 years ago and currently needs a loan to purchase more products. She wants to be able to sell in various areas near where she lives and to buy merchandise she needs to travel to the El Salvador border where she can obtain it cheaper and of better quality. She needs the loan to supply her business with products and be able to make more income. Her dream is to be able to put her children through the university so that they can move ahead in their lives.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas plastics, buckets, bowls, glasses, plates, garbage cans, collanders, etc.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda tiene 22 años, es soltera y vive en su propia casa, lo que más desea es forjarse un buen porvenir. Es una muchacha muy alegre y bromista, y la encargada de cobrar los pasajes en la combi número 11 que brinda servicio urbano por las calles de Juliaca. Su día comienza muy temprano por la mañana, teniendo que permanecer en su labor hasta casi las 9 de la noche. Ya lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que puede conversar con sus pasajeros y hacer más ameno el viaje, anhela tener su propia combi. Lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es tener que permanecer todo el día parada, ya que los pasajeros ocupan todos los asientos. Nilda sabe que tiene que trabajar duro para alcanzar sus metas y está dispuesta a hacerlo con tal de mejorar su vida. Es el tercer préstamo de Nilda con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagarlo a tiempo y lo hará, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a su banco comunal, donde es una socia muy querida y admirada. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados planea apoyar en el arreglo de la combi donde trabaja, ya que si se malogra tampoco tendrá trabajo.
texts.en:
Nilda, 22, is single and lives in her own house. What she wants most of all is to forge a good future. She is a happy girl who likes to joke. Her job is to collect fares from riders of van number 11, which offers urban transportation service in the streets of Juliaca. Her day starts very early in the morning, and she has to stay at her work until almost nine at night. She has been doing this for two years. What she likes best about her work is being able to talk with the passengers to make the journey more pleasant. Her biggest wish is to have her own van. What she likes least about her work is having to stand all day, because the passengers occupy all of the seats. Nilda knows that she has to work hard to meet her goals, and she is prepared to do so in order to improve her life. This is her third loan with MFP. She knows that she has to pay on time, and she will do so. She does not want to cause problems for her community bank where she is a dear and admired member. With the 1,500 PEN she plans to help with the repairs on the van where she works. If the van breaks down, she will not have work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair the van she works with

loans.name: Santos Lino

texts.es: Don Santos Lino es casado, de 49 años de edad, trabajo como ganadero (ordeña 30 vacas en 2 fincas ubicadas en la Gateada, tiene 3 hijos los cuales estudian, 1 en la secundaria, el viane a su casa 2 veces por semana, tiene un trabajador permanente en la finca quien se encarga de las labores, su esposa tiene trabaja en un pequeño negocio en el hogar (pulperia), esta solicitando su primer credito para utilizarlo en la construccion de un muro y porche que es de suma urgencia debido a que con las lluvias  las corrientes de arriba llegan al porche de su casa y luego se inunda la vivienda, ese muro le servira para ampliar el porche ql que pondra techo, al muro le pondra tubos y mallas porque lo cerra porque quiere aprovehcar el aire que les llega.  El tiene 30 años de estar en la actividad ganadera, pues desde niño comenzo con su padre.
texts.en:
Santos Lino is married, 49 years old, and work as farm hand (he milks 30 cows on two ranches located in La Gateada). He has 3 children who all study, 1 of which is in secondary school. He leaves home 2 times a week, and has a permanent worker on his ranch that takes care of the daily chores. His wife has a small business in their home (a small grocery store). He is requesting his first loan to build a wall and porch that is of the up most urgency because with the rains, the water currents reach his porch and then flood his house. The wall will serve to expand the porch to which he will also add a roof; he will also add tubes and netting to the wall so he can enjoy the air that passes through. He has worked with cattle for 30 years, and began doing so with his dad when he was a small boy.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis K. is a cobbler by profession. He makes all kinds of footwear – shoes, slippers, sandals, etc. for men and women. His workshop is located at the roadside. He procures his working materials from Kumasi. Francis has been in business for 18 years and wants a loan to buy more goods.

Francis is 34 years old, married and has two daughters. Both are currently in primary school. His wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and daughters in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town.

loans.use: To buy leather and shoe soles

loans.name: Elvis

texts.en: Elvis is 47 years old. He is a married man with four children who currently attend school. He sells frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, meat etc. at the local market in his community. He does not have adequate funds to support his business. This has affected his operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, he wants to purchase additional cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, pork and meat. This will enable him to raise enough income to expand his business. He buys his supplies of goods from the Kumasi central market.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc.

loans.name: Zuhra Ahmad Yar Group

texts.en:
Zuhra baji is a widow and has been residing in Chichawatni, Pakistan for the last 17 years. Her husband died in an accident. His death left an unforgettable impact on her brain. She still misses him in her life. Zuhra baji runs a grocery shop in the community. She started the grocery shop from her house because the rents are too high in Chichawatni. People come to her to buy groceries because of her fine items. She has been running this shop for the last eight years. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her grocery shop and earn a good profit. 

This loan consists of four additional people: 

Shazia baji and Hanifan baji each want a loan to buy groceries for their grocery shop. 
Farhana baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. 
Razia baji wants a loan to buy mason tools.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Zuhra baji is standing second from the left in this photo”.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda I. is from the village of La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del sur. She is 59 years old. Yolanda is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Yolanda is just starting this business.

In 2007, Yolanda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the seventh loan taken out by Yolanda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

location.town: La Victoria, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Oluwakemi

texts.en: Oluwakemi is a trained nurse. She has a chemist shop where she sells medicine and groceries. She is hoping for a loan  of N140, 000 to purchase more medicines and groceries to sell. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She says "thank you."

loans.use: To purchase more medicines and groceries to sell

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth B. is from the village of Talairon. She is 42 years old. Lilibeth is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lilibeth owns & operates a "sari-sari" store business in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lilibeth has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2002, Lilibeth joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lilibeth has successfully repaid a previous loan  from PMPC. Lilibeth is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Lilibeth from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es: El señor Marcos F. de 52 años, hombre activo que desde su juventud trabajaba para ayudar a sus padres y luego que se caso, desde joven aprendió  de albañil el cual lleva 30 años de experiencia haciendo casas, en diferentes ciudades, reside en Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos que son mayores de edad, una de 14 años es la que estudia. Con este préstamo es su séptimo ciclo el cual invertirá en materiales de construcción para hacer un muro y poder tener un poco mas de seguridad para su familia. Agradece a la institución por darle la oportunidad, el cual ha mejorado su vivienda como a muchas familias Nicaragüenses.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos F. is 52 years old and has been an active man since his youth, working to help his parents. After getting married at a young age, he learned masonry and now has 30 years of experience making houses in different cities. He resides in Villa Reconciliacion in the capital of Managua. He and his wife have 4 children, all of whom are grown up. Their 14-year-old daughter is the one who studies. This loan will be his seventh, and he will invest it in construction materials in order to build a wall and be able to have a little bit more security for his family. He thanks this institution for giving him this opportunity, which has improved his home, as well as those of many other Nicaraguan families.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a wall.

loans.name: Zoila María

texts.es:
Zoila es una mujer  dinámica, vive en el distrito de Manantay región de Ucayali, tiene 42 años, es madre de seis hijos, de los cuales tres son mayores de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, chupetes, hielos, néctares y también vende productos de belleza por catálogo, ella es madre soltera, que siempre ha salido adelante con sus hijos pese a las dificultades que ha pasado. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Claritas 2” desde hace un año y ocho meses. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que le permitió invertir en productos para la venta de menús (comida).
Actualmente Zoila necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para invertir una parte en bebidas y otra parte en indumos para la venta de salchipapas. La meta de Zoila es llegar a tener un restaurante y seguir incrementado su negocio.
texts.en:
Zoila is a dynamic woman. She lives in the Manantay district in the region of Ucayali. She is 42 years old and the mother of six children, three of whom are adults. She works selling soda, juices, popsicles, and ice cream. She also sells beauty products by catalogue. She is a single mother, but has always perservered with her children despite the difficulties they have faced. She has been part of the Community Bank Las Claritas 2 for a year and eight months. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which allowed her to buy products in order to sell meals. Now, Zoila needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be used to purchase drinks and the products necessary to make salchipapas (potatoes with sausage). Zoila's goal is to eventually run a restaurant and continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks and supplies to make fast food

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is 20 years old and single without children. She is a hard working girl and she sells for long hours to ensure that there is food on her table to feed her aged parents. She sells soup ingredients at Oka Market.

This is the high season for her business and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for a year. She hopes for a loan amount of 50,000 NGN to purchase more soup ingredients to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more soup ingredients to sell

loans.name: Lidia Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Lidia G. se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de comestibles como pan, galletas y cokteles al igual que bebidas como gaseosas y jugos siendo comercializadas a diario por ella misma en su localidad.

Ella se ha destacado por ser una persona muy trabajadora y ha logrado llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. El crédito lo solicita para la compra de los comestibles y para la compra de las bebidas y de esta manera continuar en el negocio obteniendo los ingresos para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the wholesale market of the city of Nicaragua, Lidia G. attends to her food sales business. She sells bread, cookies and fruit cocktails, as well as soft drinks and juices.

Lidia is a hard worker and has managed to earn enough to maintain her house. The loan she is seeking will be used to buy food and drink products to sell. This will allow her to continue developing her business.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food and drinks for sale

loans.name: Bertha Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Bertha Esperanza, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Creativas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y 05 hijos, 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Deseando ver profesionales a sus hijos, y teniendo su propio capital para poder lograrlo, decidió emprender su propio negocio de venta comidas, ubicada en su misma casa, la cual lleva 04 años ejerciendo este tipo de actividad. Sus ventas los realiza a partir de las 11:30 am y nos cuenta que sus ventas diarias, le van muy bien.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos de papas, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Bertha Esperanza, se siente con muchas fuerzas todavía para seguir administrando y ejerciendo sus negocios. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha Esperanza belongs to the Communal Bank “Mujeres Creativas” (Creative Women), which is in the District of Moyobamba, Moyobamba Province, Department of San Martín. She is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children of whom 2 are still dependents.

Wanting to see her children become professionals and having her own capital to making this happen, Bertha Esperanza decided to start a business selling food from her home. She has been doing this now for four years. Her business opens at 11:30 am and she tells us that her daily sales have been doing well.

With this loan of 1700 soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation such as rice by the kilo, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, cases of chicken, vegetables, and supplies needed to continue her business and provide better service to her customers.

Bertha Esperanza feels like she is still capable of managing her business. She thanks Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients & supplies for food preparation

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Mary works hard to help her husband provide for the family. She is a food vendor. She prepares and sells kenkey (fermented corn and cassava dough, wrapped in corn or banana leaves) with fried fish. She sells by the roadside. She buys bags of maize from nearby farming communities. Mary has been in business for over twenty years and wants a loan to procure bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Linda Nimsi Abisag

texts.es: Linda Nimsi Abisag Ramírez C. de 21 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador, vive junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 11 meses de vida. Ella junto a su esposo poseen una panadería en la cual se encargar de elaborar y repartir el pan. Así mismo posee dos empleados, los cuales le contribuyen vendiendo el pan en bicicletas, y así mismo hay personas que llegan a comprar por mayor el pan o simplemente por unidad. Linda solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar harina, azúcar, levadura y otros productos más los cuales son la materia prima de su producto. Tanto para Linda como para su esposo este negocio es muy importante, ya que es gracias a este como cubren todos sus gastos, así mismo deben esforzarse por mejorarlo debido a que e la única fuente de ingresos que poseen.
texts.en:
Linda Nimsi Abisag Ramírez C. is 21 years old and lives in the San Marcos municipality in the San Salvador department with her life partner and 11 month old son. She and her husband own a bakery where they make and distribute their own bread. She also has two employees, who deliver the bread on bicycles. She has some clients who make wholesale purchases and others who purchase bread by the unit.
