Linda is requesting this loan so that she may buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other basic ingredients with which she can make her bread. This business is very important for both Linda and her husband as it allows them to cover all of their regular expenses. Furthermore, they are committed to improving it as it is the only source of income they have.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Huthnance, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, and yeast to make bread.

location.town: San Marcos, departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia D. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Leticia is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Leticia buys and sells coconuts in the local community. Leticia has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Leticia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leticia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Leticia from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Arnaldo

texts.es:
El Sr. Arnaldo M.  tiene 27 años de edad es soltero y vive con su madre en la ciudad de Carapeguá. 
    	Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de estudiar y ser un profesional decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país Asunción donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada. 
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta  la cual lo utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
       Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos.
texts.en:
Mr. Arnaldo is 27 years old, is single and lives with his mother in Carapegúa City. Since he comes from a humble family and he wishes to study to become a professional, he decided to start a small business. He began selling clothes and shoes in the center of his city. In a short time he has been able to gather a little bit of capital to use to buy a larger variety of articles. He is now bringing these to sell in the capital city of his country, Asunción. He has a good client base in Asunción. Thanks to his hard work and effort, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He uses this to help with his business and maintain his client base. He is asking for a loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, bedspreads and sheets) because he has had a lot of requests for these products.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 30-year-old father to a one-year-old child. He owns rental houses in Kibera slums in Nairobi and earns extra income through housing agency services. He has requested his third loan of Kes. 80,000 to renovate his rental houses. He describes himself as ambitious and thus hopes to own rental houses in high class estates of Nairobi. Since joining Faulu, Peter claims that his income has grown.

loans.use: To renovate his rental houses

loans.name: Asman's Group

texts.en:
Asman is a 32-year-old woman, married with three children currently in school. She lives in a city named Pakpattan in Pakistan and describes herself as an ambitious person. Although her husband has his own grocery store which he's been running for the previous 10 years, she handles her milk selling business independently. She does this business to improve their standard of living. They both have good knowledge about their work. They also share their working experiences with each other. Asman is requesting a loan of Pak Rs. 10,000 to add to the stock of her husband’s grocery store. 

She is the leader of a group of three other women from her locality. Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy cattle (goats and sheep) for her animal selling business. Noor ilahi baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Ubaida baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo to start a milk selling business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en: Ajoke thanks all who made her last Kiva loan possible, as having extra capital in the business gave her business a new outlook. She is a trader; she sells frozen food like turkey parts, chicken parts and foodstuffs in her shop. Ajoke has been in her business for the past 15 years and she is happy with the nature of her business. Ajoke hopes for more expansion in her business. She wants to buy one deep freezer so she can open another shop where can sell and make more profit for her business and family upkeep. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase a deep freezer to preserve her foodstuffs, frozen food like chicken, turkey and ice fish to sell. Ajoke, 45 years old, is married with four children. She says thanks to lenders for the financial empowerment.

loans.use: To purchase a deep freezer

loans.name: Proserpina

texts.en:
Proserpina D. P. is from the village of Taboc Norte Oroquieta City. She is 57 years old. Proserpina is widowed and has two grown children. To make a living, Proserpina owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of food products in the local community. Proserpina has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Proserpina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Her hope was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Proserpina is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Proserpina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improv and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business which offers a variety of food products for sale

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio forma parte del banco comunal “VALLE SAGRADO”,  tiene 70  años, tiene cuatro hijos. Su principal actividad económica es vender locería.  

Toribio es una persona, responsable y emprendedor que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su familia. Toribio requiere el préstamo para comprar productos de locería como por ejemplo platos,  tazas, ollas y muchas cosas.   

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Toribio, 70, is a member of the “VALLE SAGRADO” (Sacred Valley) communal bank. He has four children and his main commercial activity consists in dinnerware sales. Toribio is a responsible, enterprising person who is always looking for ways to get ahead in life and help his family through his own efforts. Toribio needs funds to buy dinnerware items like: dishes, cups, pots, etc. He is grateful for the opportunity offered through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted dinnerwear, pots and pans, cups, etc.

loans.name: Nazgul Mukanbetova Group

texts.en:
Sometimes people need little guidance to see the real situation and make a right decision. Unfortunately in these cases, there is nobody to guide and give us sincere and correct advice or counseling. From this point, people who make these decisions themselves, relying purely on their intuitions and estimations deserve full admiration and respect. These people do not wait for the right wind, but adjust to the existing one and act accordingly. If taking risks and making tough decisions are needed, they do it, and thus prove for themselves. These types of people make a difference and deserve a different life. 

M. Nazgul is forty eight. She and her husband have been raising four daughters. The eldest daughter has turned twenty and the little one has turned nine. To provide for the family, Nazgul’s husband works as both a cattle breeder and a farmer. Nazgul works together with her husband and helps him farm their land. They have been farming the land for the last sixteen years and have become experienced farmers. During this time they have built a home and now want to give their daughters a college education. Nazgul has applied for this loan to pay for mechanic’s services and to purchase some amount of fuel. 

Nazgul’s partners: 

S. Orozbek, 55, is married and has four children. Orozbek farms the land and breeds cattle. His sons help him on the field and provide tremendous help in looking after cattle. Orozbek crucially needs fuel to finish farming the land. Therefore he hopes that he will be able to obtain this loan. 

I. Kundusbubu, 47, is a mother of two children. To make a living she and her husband are engaged in farming and raising cattle. Now, their children are studying at school, however, Kundusbubu is already thinking about her children’s future. She needs a loan to buy fuel. 

I. Mairamkul, 34, is engaged in a guest house business. She rents a guest house and leases rooms for tourists. However, her guest houses are traditional yurts - ancient houses of nomads, not ordinary guest houses. Her monthly income is around $330. Mairamkul needs a loan to make a tent over the yurts. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To pay for mechanic's services and to purchase fuel.

loans.name: San

texts.en: Mrs. San N., age 47, operates her own small business planting various crops. She harvests and sells the crops to buyers when they come to maturity. San N. has a life partner in her husband who assists her in growing the crops and also fishes in and around the river for extra profit. The couple helps each other in order to feed their six children since they were young. Two of them now are married and the other four are single. As she hopes for a good result in this cultivation season, San N. is applying for assistance on Kiva to grow crops. With any remaining cash from the loan, she will buy more tools for fishing.

loans.use: To grow crops.

loans.name: M'foulou-Ngoulou

texts.en: M'FOULOU-NGOULOU A. is a 36-year-old mother to four children. She is married and has been able to send her children to school due to income from her business. Her oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is just turning 3. She started her business selling a variety of clothes and sandals about 15 years ago and has been able to continue to provide for her family's basic needs. With this loan, she will be able to purchase better quality sandals and grow her business. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to a better school for a better education.

loans.use: Purchase better quality sandals to add to her inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old married man and the father of three school-age children. He owns a small shop where he makes delicious fresh juices. He is an experienced vendor — and has been selling juice for almost nine years. He is his family's main provider. The availability of fresh juice all year round is one of Lebanon’s many great features. Depending on the season, it is possible to find juices such as mango, pomegranate, lemon, and blood orange. Especially during the summer, his sales and his income increase which is why he is requesting a loan of  $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve his shop and increase his inventory.

loans.use: improve his shop and increase inventory

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Saada M., age 35, is married with no children.  She lives with her younger sister's daughter who is 19 years of age and is still studying.  Saada has had a poultry business for 2 years now.  She works from 5 a.m. to 5 p.m. and is able to make a monthly profit of about $670.

This will be Saada’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to improve on her chicken coop (warehouse) and to pay school fees.  She has paid back the loan successfully.  She hopes for a new loan to buy 500 egg laying chicks.

Saada will share this loan with her Group Machimbo, which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Saada is second from the right in the front row.

loans.use: To buy 500 egg laying chicks

loans.name: Nelson

texts.es: Nelson solicito 1000 $us, para la compra de ganado, ya que aparte de la agricultura se dedica a la producción de leche, la cual la vende a Pil Andina, planta industrializadota de leche; Nelson vive con su esposa e hijos en su comunidad que se llama POKE,que se encuentra a situada  dos horas de viaje de la ciudad de La Paz. Es el primer crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Nelson requested a $1000 USD loan to buy cattle because, besides farming, he also sells milk to Pil Andina, an industrial milk processor. Nelson lives with his wife and children in a community called POKE that is located two hours away from the city of La Paz. This is his first loan with Impro and the first through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two medium quality dairy cows to increase milk production.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary S. has a shop selling a variety of goods including sugar and salt. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell.  Mary is 20 years old with a husband who is a businessman. She has two children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar and stock crates of beer to sell.

loans.use: Stock more bags of sugar and cartons of salt to sell

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: El Señor Fabián, es muy trabajador y su esposa la Señora Sonia también es muy trabajadora, ellos trabajan en una maquiladora de la localidad, como obreros, tienen dos hijos pequeños, ellos adquirieron una casa de interés social, ellos saben que ese será el patrimonio para sus hijos. El señor Fabián, quiere una mayor seguridad para su vivienda, ya que no cuenta con barda en la parte trasera de la vivienda, es para eso que solicitan este préstamo, para empezar la contracción de una barda y así sentirse mucho mas seguros el y su familia.
texts.en:
Fabian is a hard working person and his wife Sonia is also a very hard worker. They are workers in a factory in their region. They have two small children. They acquired a home from social housing and they know that this will be their children's inheritance. Fabian wishes to improve their home for greater security. The house doesn't have a back wall, for which reason he requests a loan. He would like to start building that wall, to feel greater safety and security for himself and for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Madres Trabajadoras”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Dolores; ella tiene 57 años D. edad y es casada  y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el  negocio D. venta D. comida en el terminal D. una empresa que hace servicio público llamada Sr D. Cabildo, ella trabaja desD. las 5:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, su esposo trabaja en el sector salud y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener un restaurant para poder preparar los deliciosos platos que cocina.  La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos para cocinar como arroz, azúcar, carne, fideos y utensilios. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Dolores belongs to the “Madres Trabajadoras” (Working Mothers) communal bank, which is located in Santiago district, Cusco province, in the department of Cusco. Dolores is 57 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her daily activities incluD. a business selling meals in the terminal of an enterprise called "Sr. D. Cabildo" that performs public services. She works from 5:00am until 4:00pm. Her husband works in the health sector and together, they manage to advance their children. Dolores wants to open a restaurant where she can prepare the delicious meals she cooks. Dolores is requesting a loan to buy cooking products, such as rice, sugar, meat, beans, and also cooking utensils. Dolores thanks everyone who by this means becomes part of her dream, and she promises to comply with her payments as scheduled.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRODUCTS FOR COOKING, SUCH AS RICE, SUGAR, MEAT, BEANS, AND ALSO EATING UTENSILS

loans.name: Cristobal

texts.es:
Cristóbal A. J.,  es un excelente mecánico muy reconocido en su comunidad. 
El vive en la trinchera de Alajuela, conocida especialmente por su destacada producción de piña para exportación y por el liderazgo de sus mujeres.. 
El tiene un taller Mecánico, negocio que le genera buen ingreso, sin embargo asegura que  ya la mayoría de sus herramientas se encuentran en muy mal estado. Es por eso qué el solicita un préstamo de ¢603 000 (seiscientos tres mil colones) para la compra de nuevas herramientas que le permitan mejorar su atención al cliente y por supuesto llevar su taller a otro nivel.
El tiene 54 años es socio de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Cristobal A. J. is an excellent mechanic and well known in his community. He lives in the village of Alejuela, a region known for its pineapple products and exportation and for its strong community of women leaders. 

He has a repair shop and the business is a good source of income. But the majority of his tools are in a very poor state. He requests a loan in the amount of 603 000 (six hundred and three thousand) colones to purchase new tools that will help him improve the service he provides. It will bring his repair shop to a new level. 

He is 54 years old and he is a member of the community bank Mujeres al Exito of the village of Pital. It is one of the 100 member organizations of Edesa (Kiva Field Partner) in Costa Rica.

loans.use: To purchase tools.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en: Josefa lives in her own home along with her partner and their three children. She is 29 years old. She and her family live in Santa Rosa in the province of Piura. Each Friday, Saturday, Sunday and Monday, one can find Josefa in the district of Los Lomos, approximately 20 minutes from her home, selling food and chicha (chicha is a traditional beverage in Peru made from corn and alcohol). She sells her goods to clients who pass by in the streets at the end of their daily labors or who are heading to other projects. She has requested a loan of 500 Soles in order to purchase additional products and increase her supply. She will use the loan little by little, purchasing fresh goods daily. She hopes that this purchase will allow her to increase her market share and income. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her kids. She hopes to be able to get them through school and see them become professionals.

loans.use: To purchase additional products and increase her supply

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon E. is from the village of Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He is 43 years old and single. To make a living, Ramon owns and operates a retail store selling daily use products, such as instant noodles, pancit, behon, canned goods, dried fish, shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Ramon has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Ramon joined Kiva partner, GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This loan was used as additional capital for his business. Ramon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be his third from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About GDMPC
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: San Martin De Porras Group

texts.es:
Meliz B. D. C., casada, madre D. familia con 3 hijos mayores D. edad (en la foto es la segunda D. la izquierda, esta vestida D. chompa color gris y con un pañuelo al cuello).
La Señora Meliz està casada con Don Mariano Alberto C. Zurita, quien es su empuje para seguir adelante; a Don Alberto lo operaron D. la garganta, a pesar D. ser jubilado, la pensiòn que recibe no alcanza para cubrir el costo D. los medicamentos que necesita.
La Señora Meliz con la ayuda D. su esposo venD. dulces desD. hace ya 25 años en una carretilla frente al colegio Ricardo Menendez Menendez en Huancayo; gracias a su trabajo pudo educar y alimentar a su familia.
El prèstamo lo invertirà en comprar mas mercaderia para su negocio.
texts.en:
Meliz B. D. C. is married and mother to three adult children (in the photograph she is the second from the left dressed in a gray sweater and wearing a scarf). 

Meliz is married to Mariano Alberto C. Zurita, who is her driving force to keep her moving forward. Alberto had an operation on his throat and in spite of being retired the pension he receives is not enough to cover the cost of the medicines he needs. 

Meliz, with the help of her husband, sells sweets from a cart in front of the Ricardo Menendez Menendez high school in Huancayo which she has done for 25 years. Thanks to this work she was able to educate and feed her family. 

She will invest the loan in purchasing more merchandise for her business.

loans.use: To increase capital for candy sales

loans.name: Mrs. Norng Sambou Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has fifteen members in Khnar Rung village, Takeo province. All the members have selected Mrs. Norng S. to become the village bank president. They will use their portion of this loan for different purposes to improve their family with this fund.

Mrs. Norng S. and her husband are farmers who own a small piece of land to grow rice and vegetable to sell to support their family.  She is also a pig breeder. She is concerned that her income is very low, as her business has recently suffered due to insufficient financial capital. So to improve her pig breeding business, Mrs. Norng S. is applying for a loan to have more funds to buy more piglets which will allow her to improve her profits.  With the rest of the loan, she is going to buy fertilizer to support her crops in the field. 

She is a mother of four children, two of whom are employed in garment factories while the others are attending local public school.

loans.use: To buy more piglets

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.en:
Marcelo V. is from the village of Benito Soliven, in the province of Isabela. He is 33 years old. Marcelo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelo owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Marcelo has been engaged in his business for over 10 years and earns approximately 35000 PHP per harvest season.

In 2010, Marcelo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Marcelo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. Marcelo is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marcelo from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Ikhbayar

texts.en: Ikhbayar is 30 years old, married, and the father of two children. He lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His family lives together in a small wooden house. His wife Urangua works as a warehouse keeper at a construction company. His older son goes to a local secondary school, while his younger son stays at home. Ikhbayar has been operating a taxi service in the city for the last three years. He also works for a construction company as a plumber on a part-time basis. In the mornings, he takes his wife to work and his son to school. He is a very hard-working person who is providing a good education for his children. This is his third Kiva loan through Credit Mongol. He has used his previous loans appropriately, paying them back in full on time. This time he is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to complete improvements to his house.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Uur-Tsaih

texts.en:
Uur-Tsaih is 28 years old and lives with her husband and two sons, ages 6 and 8, in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. Her two sons attend a local primary school.

Uur-Tsaih operates a consumer goods trading business out of her two work places, a shipping container and a pavilion in her town. She began her business in a rented shipping container at the local market with a working capital of 1,500,000 MNT. She has built a stable and successful operation and used her earnings to expand her business by purchasing a shipping container at 2,000,000 MNT in 2008. Today her working capital exceeds 3,500,000 MNT. With her business profits, she was able to buy another pavilion, and she now sells her products out of two spots.

Uurtsaih is a hardworking and modest person and says, "I hope to continue to build and run this business as a stable operation and increase my business profits." She is requesting a 1,800,000 MNT loan to import more products from China.

loans.use: To import more products to sell

loans.name: Jumabubu's Group

texts.en:
Jumabubu O., 62, is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near Bishkek. Unfortunately, she is a widow. She has eight children, and most of them are married and live separately with their families. In order to earn money, Jumabubu breeds livestock, and she also sells dairy products to make additional income. With the money received from the loan, she wants to purchase livestock for breeding. In the future, she wants to see her grandchildren get wed.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious, and socially focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line—People (building human capital and taking care of customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly), and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team—Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - Mol Bulak Finance—at: http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstanat http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Damaris

texts.es:
La Sra. Damaris pertenece al Banco Comunal “Los Eucaliptos” del Distrito de Tarapoto, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 29 años y es madre de 01 niño que aun depende de ella.  

Damaris es una mujer dispuesta y luchadora que dado a su espíritu alegre, lleva hoy en día varios años dedicándose al servicio de lavado de motos lineales y motokares. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, un lugar amplio y acondicionado, donde puede atender con gusto a sus clientes. Nos cuenta que a diario acuden muchos clientes, ya que la conocen y saben del buen servicio que brinda, día a día. 

Con este crédito de S/. 1,700.00 Nuevos Soles comprará un motor, que le ayuda mucho, con la presión del agua, para un lavado rápido. También invertirá comprando detergentes en cajas, escobillas en docenas y una nueva manguera para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor a sus clientes.

Damaris se siente muy contenta al pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres, que le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos. Agradece bastante al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Damaris, 29, is a member of the “Los Eucaliptos” communal bank in Tarapoto district, San Martin province.  She has a live in partner and a son who still depends on her.

Damaris is a willing, hard working woman who, thanks to her cheerful spirit, today has been providing motorcycle and mototaxi washing services for several years.  Her business is located at home in a roomy, equipped area, where she can tend to her customers comfortably.  She tells us that she has many customers daily who know her and the good service she provides day to day.

She will use this 1700 new sol loan to buy a motor which helps a lot with pressurized water to do a quick cleaning.  She will also buy boxes of detergent, dozens of brushes and a new hose to provide better service to her customers.

Damaris feels happy to belong to a group of women that have helped her become more aware of her rights.  She is quite grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her enter the business world.

loans.use: She will buy a motor, boxes of detergent, brushes by the dozen and a new hose.

loans.name: Phum

texts.en:
Mrs. Phum K. is 52 years old and her husband Mr. Ruos Sok is 53 years old. They have been married since 1979 and have seven children--six sons and one daughter. Three are married and live separately; two are construction workers and another one assists his parents in the business. The family is living in a small village on National Road Number Two about 25 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phum and her husband are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village where they live. Phum is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase a cow. She will use the cow to plow her rice farmland.  

Photo: Mrs. Phum K. is at home, was not at the farm

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing her farmland

loans.name: Rolly

texts.en:
Rolly S. is from the village of Villa Victoria Echague, Isabela. He is 54 years old. Rolly is married and has five adult children. Rolly owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Rolly has been engaged in his business for over 15 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) every harvest season. 

In 2011, Rolly joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to do business. Rolly is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rolly from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Mukisa Development Group-Kampala

texts.en:
35-year-old M. Nelson is a firewood and coffee sales businessman who has been operating his  business for the past 8 years in Gayaza-Kampala. The amiable father of two says he began this business with the persuasion of close friends who had seen success in similar businesses. 

Before that, Nelson was involved in a glass sales trade. Nelson also has a pig husbandry business on the side. Weekly he says the firewood business brings in shillings 25,000 as profits. With this loan, he says he is going to purchase more firewood and coffee to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood and coffee to resell

loans.name: Eron

texts.en:
Eron N. lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has five children, all of whom are in school.
Eron has a business selling used clothes. She has been in this business for ten years, and she works six days out of every week. Eron sells her products in a shop, by means of wholesale/retail. She also generates additional income through poultry farming. Eron has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes.
The main business challenges for Eron include seasonality and thieves. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling wholesale only. Eron lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Jackton

texts.en:
Jackton B. is a married woman with eight children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 15 years, she has operated a vegetable-selling business. She sells in a shop to her neighbors. In addition, she also operates a firewood-selling business, which contributes another source of income. 

Jackton faces a major challenge of seasonality. During rainy season, the availability of green vegetables is higher and demand is lower, while during hot summer season, availability of green vegetables is lower and demand is higher. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en: Dorice is 38 years old and married with four children.  She runs both a cosmetic shop and a general store.  She has been running the business for eight months.  Through Faulu Kenya, she has gained business ideas.  This has helped her to sustain her business.  She hopes to have a wholesale business in the future.  She has requested 20,000 KES to buy sugar, bread and soaps.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread and soaps.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 39 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. The oldest child is 18 years old.

Maribel has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 10 years. She sells items like noodles, detergent soap and soft drinks. She also makes rice cakes and other delicacies that she sells to the people in her community.

Maribel plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and canned goods. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as shampoo, soap and canned goods

loans.name: Navoidin

texts.en:
Navoidin is active, responsible and single.  He transports building materials and furniture back and forth between Vorukh and Khujand.   Navoidin would like a 13,000 TJS loan to purchase apricots.  He will use the profit he earns from processing and selling the dried fruit for his wedding.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. The country has produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. It is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Today it is home to a complex mix of Islam, Soviet culture, western culture and Central Asian traditions.

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet Republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the country's agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy apricots to process and sell.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Revendeuse de charbon de bois à son domicile, AFI  est mariée et a 02 enfants. Elle veut assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants et sollicite ce prêt pour acheter de la marchandise à ANIE. Elle a démarré en 2003 et est à son troisième  cycle de prêt. Son mari est menuisier.
texts.en: Afi is married, has 2 children, and works from home as a retailer of charcoal. She wants to provide a better future for her children and is asking for a loan to buy merchandise in Anie. She began her business in 2003, and is on her third loan cycle. her husband is a cabinet maker.

loans.use: to buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 
Rosalina has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and biscuits. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan for 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.
Rosalina has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es:
Juan  tiene 35 años de edad. El es un joven soltero y trabajador que vive con su madre y hermanos en la zona urbana del distrito de Motupe en Lambayeque.

Juan tiene su propio negocio de fabricación de adobes. Esta es una especie de ladrillo de barro, que es muy solicitada en la zona, pues la mayoría de casas están construidas con este material.

Juan es un joven trabajador y emprendedor que desea sacar adelante su negocio para poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Él solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar  los materiales necesarios para la fabricación de adobe. 

Juan es un cliente recurrente de nuestra entidad y este préstamo le sería de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Juan is 35 years old. This hardworking young man is single and lives with his mother and siblings in the urban section of the District of Motupe in Lambayeque.

Juan has his own business making adobe, a type of clay brick that is often requested in the area. Most of the houses in the area are built from this material.

Juan is a hardworking and enterprising young man who wants to succeed in his business so that he can improve his quality of life. He is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy the necessary materials for making adobe.

Juan is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa and this loan will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy materials for making adobe bricks.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Rebecca has a shop that sells snacks, canned goods & noodles. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 21,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Rebecca has been a member of HSPFI since 2008. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Juan Alberto es soltero, no tiene hijos, su principal negocio es brindar el servicio de transporte urbano por más de 4 años en toda la ciudad de Ica, el Sr. Juan es muy responsable, trabaja todos los días en su movilidad con lo que ha podido comprar un terreno donde va a construir su casa; sus ingresos son de S/ 300 nuevos soles semanales. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de electrodomésticos para iniciar otro negocio. Su principal desafío es el frio que tiene que soportar todas las noches cuando trabaja en la madrugada haciendo taxi; su sueño es poder construir su casa propia y casarse.
texts.en:
Juan Alberto is single and has no children. His main business has been to provide urban transportation services for more than 4 years throughout the whole city of Ica. Juan is very responsible and uses his vehicle for business purposes every day. With the proceeds, he has been able to buy a piece of land where he will build his house. His income is 300 PEN on a weekly basis. 

He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of electronics to start another business. His main challenge is the cold he has to endure every night when he works in the early mornings as a taxi driver. His dream is to be able to build his own house and get married.

loans.use: to buy electronics to start another business.

loans.name: María Verónica

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora María es socia fundadora del Banco comunal, es la fiscal de reglamentos y le gusta por la responsabilidad y puntualidad con los créditos. Tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y  5 años de edad los mismos que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer.

Nuestra amiga para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar hace cinco años con la ayuda de uno de los créditos que recibió de La Fundación Espoir pudo adecuar un local para poner una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, la cual mantiene hasta la actualidad y que ha ido crecido con el paso de los días, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, nos cuenta que este es un negocio que lo realiza al mismo tiempo que realiza las labores del hogar.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad.
 
Sus sueños es darle lo mejor a sus hijos y que  su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The “María Auxiliadora” communal bank meets in La Sequita Parish belonging Montecristi, a prosperous canton in Manabí, that’s full of hardworking people who are proud of their roots.  La Sequita is a parish inhabited by honest people who only know how to work and be devoted to their families.

María is a founding member of the communal bank.  She is the sergeant at arms and likes it because of the responsibility and punctuality of the loans.  She’s 30 years old, married and has two children who are 10 and 5 years old; both go to school.  Her husband’s a driver.

Five years ago with help from a loan from Fundación Espoir and wanting to help her husband meet household expenses, our friend was able to set up a grocery store at home.  She still has it and it has grown over time.  She works there daily from 6am until 8pm.  She tells us that it’s a business she runs while doing her household chores.

She will use the loan to better stock the store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergent, cured meats and other basic staples.  Her dream is that the business grows more each day and to provide her children with the best.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Kantutitas De San Simon Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTITAS DE SAN SIMON” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Martha es la tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: tejido de mantas, venta de artículos varios, elaboración de mochilas, tejidos, elaboración de enaguas, elaboración de accesorios de celular.

La señora Yolanda Martha, indica que hace un año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de accesorios de celular que viene trabajando desde hace muchos años atrás.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de de accesorios de celular) que adquirirá de la Tumusla y posteriormente lo comercializará en su sitio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y las reuniones con las compañeras.
texts.en:
The communal bank “KANTUTITAS DE SAN SIMON” will begin its third cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focus on the Pan American Highway. This bank is comprised of eight members and is governed by a board of which Martha is the president. The businesses which the communal bank members run are varied among them. There is: blanket weaving, selling miscellaneous items, making bags and tissues, making skirts, and making cell phone accessories. 

Yolanda Martha says that she's been working with Pro Mujer for one year and that she joined the institution at the invitation of a developer. At this time she has a business selling cell phone accessories that she has been running for many years. 

The loan she will take out is to increase her capital (buy cell phone accessories) that will pay for the Tumusla, and later she will sell it at her business location. This type of work permits her to generate income to help her family, since she is single and has three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she like the savings and meeting up with the other members.

loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 43 years old and lives with her spouse and daughter in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in the outer ger district /district without basic infrastructure/ of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her daughter studies at the local university.

Batsaikhan has been operating a clothing retail business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia since 2000. Expanding her business has led to increased profits which have enabled her to buy a small plot of land and a car and to start the work of building her house. Her spouse operates another small stall at the same market.

Batsaikhan is requesting a 2.000.000 MNT /Mongolian Tugriks/ loan to purchase more clothes to sell this fall, which is the high shopping season. In the future, she wants to expand her business more, increase her working capital, and finish her housing work.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell this fall.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer from the village of Bardubani, Imereti Region, West Georgia. David is 51 years old, married and lives with his family: his wife, Tea; his 12-year-old son; and his 10-year-old daughter. Both children go to school. 

David and Tea earn a living through the family agricultural business. In particular, they have a small dairy farm with two milk cows. They produce cheese and sell it on the local market. Along with the dairy, the family owns 1 hectare of land where greens and various vegetables are grown. Harvested vegetables are sold to local greengrocery retailers. Total average monthly income of the family is 550 Laris (approximately 330 USD). 

David requested credit to purchase seeds of onions and plastic for construction of a small greenhouse. He will sow the onion in the greenhouse and sell it for a high price in the winter and early spring months. It will increase the income of the family and will be used for purchasing necessary household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase plastic for greenhouse construction and onion seeds.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys has been in business in Naivasha town for the last two and a half years. She is 31 years old, married to Joseph and they have four school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock for her business.

In the future, Gladys hopes to expand her business and become one of the leading clothes dealers in the town.

loans.use: to buy more cloths for sale

loans.name: Sara Ester

texts.es:
La señora Sara tiene 22 años de edad, esta casada, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos (de 3, 4 y 7 años) en una comunidad urbano marginal de Puerto Cortes.
Ella inicio su negocio debido a la  falta de empleo tanto de ella como de su esposo. Hace 2 años inicio con la compra y venta de sandalias.
Manifiesta  que este negocio le es muy rentable, por lo que ha decido solicitar un préstamo para comprar producto nuevo y ofrecer variedad. 
Actualmente su negocio lo desarrolla de manera estacionaria en su local, pero esta considerando ofrecer el producto de manera ambulante con el apoyo de su esposo.
Sus planes a futuro es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a sus hijos cuando inicien la escuela y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Sara is 22 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and their three children (ages 3, 4, and 7).  They live in a marginally urban community in Puerto Cortes.

She started her business due to the lack of employment, as much for her as for her husband.  Two years ago she started buying and selling sandals.  She states that this business is very profitable for her.  

This is why she has decided to request a loan to buy new products and offer variety.  She currently conducts her business in a stationary way at her place.  However, she is considering offering her product in an itinerant manner with her husband’s support.

Her plans for the future are to increase sales and to grow financially with the income.  She wants to do this in order to support her children when they start school and to attain a stable business.

loans.use: to buy new products (sandals).

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese has 6 children aged 6 to 19. She has been a maize farmer for 16 years. She would like the loan to buy fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop.

She will use the Kiva loan to cover labor costs and fertilizer costs during maize production. They need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production.
 
With profits from her farming, she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La socia Juana; sigue atendiendo su tienda de abarrotes y ella en esta ocasion requiere el prestamo  para invertir en la compra de champan, vino, panetones, galletas, productos de primera necesidad como harinas, azucar, arroz, leche, chocolate entre otros productos de salida diaria y ahora que esta cerca la navidad la socia implementara sus tienda de abarrotes con panetones, vino, champan, chocolates, y otros productos. La socia desea ampliar a futuro su tienda y también vender adornos, peluches, regalos, un poco de libreria en mercaderia basica como lapiceros, papeles de escritorio entre otros. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de champan, azucar, arroz, chocolate, vino, panetones y otros.
texts.en: The member, Juana, continues operating her grocery store and on this occasion she requires a loan to invest in the purchase of champagne, wine, panettones , cookies, and staples such as flours, sugar, rice, milk and chocolate among other products of daily output. Now that Christmas is near, the member will stock her grocery store with panettones, wine, champagne, chocolates and other products. The associate wants to expand her store in the future and also to sell decorations, stuffed animals, gifts, a small library of basic goods such as pens and stationary among other things. The member requests the loan to invest in the purchase of champagne, sugar, rice, chocolate, wine, panettones and others.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of Christmas items.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel started to raise crops at the age of 18. At this early age, he used to plant and harvest rice to sell as a source of income. He was not able to go to college and did not even finish his high school education due to lack of finances. Joel is now 20 years old, single, and an industrious man. He lives with his parents at Lanna, Solana, Cagayan.

Joel is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy 5 bags of Urea (fertilizer) and rice seeds to grow.

He aims for the progression of his business that will surely lift his family out of poverty. He also aims that someday when he has children, he will strive harder to educate them.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of Urea (fertilizer) and rice seeds used for farming.

loans.name: Santiago Felipe

texts.es: Santiago está muy satisfecho porque logró con su credikiva, comprar productos como rines, neumáticos, porches, radio y todo lo relacionado con el mantenimiento de motocicletas y bicicletas. Desde que recibió su crédito sus ingresos  mejoraron,  porque consiguió tener mayor poder adquisitivo, para aumentar sus inventarios y prestar un mejor servicio.  Su mayor novedad es que con su negocio, ha logrado apoyar los estudios de su hijo que gradúa el próximo 5 de Diciembre. En la actualidad está aplicando a su segundo credikiva, con el que comprará repuestos de biciletas al por mayor, pues todos los niños quieren tener sus bicicletas en excelente estado para recorrer juntos, las vias cerradas especialmente como ciclorutas,  en las cuales se deleitaran participando con sus compañeros del barrio, el  próximo 25 de Diciembre. Su meta más adelante es  adquirir su vivienda,  pues en la que está ahora es de un familiar. Su mensaje a los fondeadores es: “Agradecimientos y que sigan apoyando a los empresarios de la microempresas.”
texts.en: Santiago is very satisfied because, with his last Kiva loan, he was able to buy products such as wheels, tires, and a radio, all related to the maintenance of motorcycles and bicycles. Since receiving that loan, his income has improved because he had better purchasing power to increase his stock and offer a better service. The main thing that is new with him is that he has been able to support his son's education and he will graduate on December 5th. He is currently applying for his second Kiva loan, which he will use to buy bicycle repair parts in bulk because all the kids want to have bikes in great condition so they can go out together, especially on the bike paths and closed roads where all the neighborhood kids will have a great time on December 25th. His long term goal is to acquire his home as he currently lives with relatives. His message to the funders is: "I am grateful and hope that you keep supporting the business owners and small businesses."

loans.use: to buy parts to repair bicycles in bulk.

loans.name: Dorcas Akoth

texts.en: Dorcas, 30 years old, is married and has two children aged of two and six years. She is an industrious woman. For the last four years, she has been involved in selling phone accessories. Her challenge is inadequate capital to enable her to expand the business by increasing the stock. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy more phone accesories. Dorcas dreams and hopes are to run a bigger phone retail store and hardware shop.

loans.use: To buy more phone accessories.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a 27 year old married woman. She has 2 children, ages ranging from 1 year to 6 years. She describes herself to be innovative and God-fearing. She operates a grocery store where she sells vegetables, such as tomatoes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located near a busy road. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of vegetables. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more vegetables, such as tomatoes. Her business goal is to run a stocked grocery store with all kinds of vegetables within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 32 años que alcanzó a terminar la primaria, está separada de su pareja y tiene un hijo con quien vive en  Otavalo un cantón de la provincia de Imbabura, una provincia que se encuentra al norte de la República del Ecuador. En Otavalo la mayoría de sus habitantes son indígenas y es el pueblo más rico en todo el país donde se fabrican gran cantidad de artesanías que son exportadas y son muy cotizadas internacionalmente y que también se venden en esta ciudad a los turistas que pasan por allí. El turismo es una fuente muy importante de ingresos ya que es visitada por personas nacionales e internacionales por sus atractivos centros turísticos en la ciudad como sus arquitectónicas calles y cascadas y ríos fuera de la ciudad. Las fiestas que se realizan allí y su gastronomía son muy concurridas, pues son típicas de la raza indígena en donde son bienvenidos visitantes de todo el país y el mundo. 
María se ha dedicado a la comercialización de textiles artesanales con estilos propios de los otavaleños como ponchos, bufandas, bolsos, actividad que aprendió de su familia desde hace 6 años y en la cual invierte 9 horas al día, por su experiencia y la de su familia se ha convertido en una excelente administradora de su negocio y ahora desea extender la oferta de mercadería a sus clientes comprando una variedad de productos que cumplan las expectativas de sus clientes, para lo cual solicitó un préstamo en Fundación Alternativa en donde también recibe capacitaciones para mejorar su servicio y entregar al cliente un valor agregado. Ella espera que sus ingresos mejoren para así estabilizarse económicamente y salir adelante con su hijo y los proyectos para su futuro.

loans.use: para comprar mercadería y surtir el negocio

loans.name: Daba's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe fait partie d'un Banc villageois a été créé le 13 décembre 2008. Il est constitué de femmes habitant le même village et qui font comme principales activités le commerce et l'embouche. Les femmes entretiennent de très bonnes relations entre elles.
Daba, debout à droite de la photo et levant la main est âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée et est mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons. Elle fait comme activité principale l'embouche ovine. Elle pratique cette activité depuis très longtemps avant même d'intégrer le BV. Avec le crédit, elle va acheter 10 moutons à 30 000 F l'un. Elle va acheter de la nourriture pour bétail à 100 000 F et les 10 000 F qui restent vont servir au transport. Elle compte élever les moutons et au bout de 05 mois les revendre à 50 000 f l'un.
Avec les bénéfices, elle va renforcer son épargne et entretenir ses petits enfants.
texts.en:
This group belongs to a Banc Villageois created on 13 December 2008. It consists of women who live in the same village and whose main activities are commerce and livestock fattening. They all get along very well. 

Daba, age 33, is the group member standing on the right and raising her hand. She is married with four children, two boys and two girls. 

Daba’s main business activity is sheep fattening, something she has been doing for a very long time, even before joining the BV. She will use her loan to buy ten sheep at 30,000 F each, and 100,000 F worth of feed. The remaining 10,000 F will be used to cover transportation costs. She plans to fatten the sheep and sell them after five months for 50,000 F each.  

She will use her profits to bolster her savings and to provide for her young children.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening.

loans.name: L’Éternel Est Mon Berger Group

texts.fr: L’ÉTERNEL EST MON BERGER est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Laylla(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 41 ans. Laylla est mariée à un conducteur du nom de Nassirou. Le couple a un enfant, scolarisé et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Laylla et son mari. Pour cette raison, Laylla vend des tissus par la technique de distribution depuis quatorze ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Laylla s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Laylla sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe L’ÉTERNEL EST MON BERGER, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçus antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des tissus.

loans.name: Charlyn

texts.en:
Charlyn engages in raising livestock like cows and pigs.  She is a mother of 3 young dependents. She is 33-year old married woman. 
Her husband’s occupation is a laborer.  

For the past 5 years, Charlyn sold livestock to locals and town dwellers in her community.
Raising livestock in her place is a lucrative business. She would like raise quality live stocks but sh has a limited capital for the maintenance.

Charlyn  requested a loan to buy pig feed, piglets and cow.  These will help boost and improve her earnings. That would help improve the number of livestock she is about to raise and it enables her to invest other means of living to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, piglets and cow

loans.name: Igor And Marina

texts.en:
Igor and Marina Kovhal’ are married with three kids ages 10, 12 and 15. It has always been hard to meet the needs of a big family in Ukraine. To provide for their family, Igor and Marina decided to start their own small business selling jean clothing for children. Loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped Igor and Marina purchase a kiosk in the market and expand their clothing sales business. Through persistence, hard work, and further loans the couple have had the opportunity to start another business selling sinks, faucets, pipes, and heaters. Igor’s natural talent as a technician make him a good entrepreneur in the area of heating system sales, installation, and warranty service. Igor and Marina would like a loan to purchase heaters, boilers, and related plumbing equipment. Most smaller towns in Ukraine have heat and hot running water only in the winter season – about a three month period. Good quality boilers, heating systems, and plastic pipes will always be in high demand. This loan will not only help Igor and Marina’s business grow, but it will also help meet the needs of their community, bringing warmth and comfort to many homes.

Ігор та Марина Коваль одружені, в них троє дітей - 10, 12 і 15 років. В Україні завжди важко було забезпечити велику родину. Для того, щоб дати своїм рідним усе необхідне, Ігор та Марина вирішили почати власну справу й продавати джинсовий одяг для дітей. Позики в „Надії України” допомогли Ігореві та Марині викупити кіоск на ринку та розширити свій бізнес з продажу одягу. Наполегливість, важка праця й кредитні послуги „Надії України” надали подружжю можливість почати ще одну справу й продавати раковини, водопровідні крани, труби та обігрівачі. Природній хист Ігоря та вміння чудово розбиратися в техніці дали йому можливість досягти успіху в бізнесі з продажу й встановлення систем обігріву приміщень та надання гарантійних послуг. Ігор та Марина хотіли б отримати вищевказану суму для того, щоб купити обігрівачі, бойлери та супроводжуюче сантехнічне обладнання. В більшості маленьких містечок України люди мають опалення та гарячу воду лише взимку – це приблизно три місяці щороку. Якісні опалювальні системи, бойлери та пластикові труби завжди користуватимуться великим попитом. Позика не тільки допоможе бізнесу Ігореві та Марині зростати, але й задовольнить потреби їхньої спільноти та принесе тепло й затишок в багато осель.

loans.use: To purchase heaters, boilers and plumbing equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Lizzy is 44 years old and a mother of 3 children. Her education ended at the basic level. She is textile dealer in the Central Business District of the city, where her shop is located. She has been in the trade for over 10 years and has a lot of experience in the business.

She wants to access the KIVA loan to reduce her level of dependence on creditors to fund the business. This would also result in a proportionate increase in her profit margins.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en: Mr. Pheng E. is a widower who lives in Kampong Cham with his 2 children.  He works in transportation, and has a motorbike with a trailer attached in order to carry large, heavy objects.  The trailer is old and in need of repair, and with this loan he will be able to do so.  In the future, he would like to buy a new trailer so he can transport more, and then he will be able to send his children to school.

loans.use: To repair trailer

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica O. is 43 years old. She is a native of Iselu-Uku in Delta State. She sells soft drinks (mineral water, Malta, etc.) and cooked food to her community. She is requesting a loan of $400 to buy more goods for sale. Veronica has 7 years' experience in her business.

loans.use: To purchase food items for sale

loans.name: Vay

texts.en: Mrs. Vay S., 43, is married to Mr. Mik Mun, 43, (pictured because Vay S. is unavailable) with five children and live in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband work together on their plot of land raising pigs, ducks, and chickens. They earn on average about $3 each day from selling the poultry they raise. The couple hopes this loan will help them to expand their livestock of pigs and chickens to enable them to generate additional profits for their household.

loans.use: To increase their livestock of pigs and chickens to generate additional profits.

loans.name: Norma Concepcion

texts.es:
This business is located in the Ivan Montenegro Market. The business began humbly with a small basket with few spices and later she began including the sale of other products which helped the business grow. The business has been in existence for more than two years. Norma continues fighting to give her two children a good education.

Her perseverence and strength has allowed her to have her own home. Her husband works and he is who helps with the expenses of the home. She has been an excellent CEPRODEL client for over a year and a half.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer Wendy Wise.

Este negocio está ubicado en el Mercado Ivan Montenegro. El negocio inicia humilde con un pequeño canasto con pocas especies, más tarde ella fue incluyendo la venta de otros productos y poco a poco fue creciendo El negocio tiene más de 2 años de existir. Ella continúa esforzándose por dar educación a sus hijos los cuales son dos, uno de ellos cursa su educación secundaria.

El esfuerzo realizado le ha permitido tener su propia vivienda. Su esposo trabaja es quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Ha sido un excelente cliente de CEPRODEL, por más de 1½ años.

loans.use: Purchase products

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Client history: Mrs. Victoria makes food in her home and sells it to the workers at construction sites. She also makes lunches and extra dishes, and her daughter helps her in her business. She lives in the Irpavi II zone of the city of La Paz, selling her food from site to site as a traveling peddler. This is the fifth time she has requested a loan, and the second time she has requested Kiva’s help. Her last payment was completed in December, so she is requesting a new loan. Her history in our institution qualifies her as a first-rate client, with good completion in the payments toward her debt. The sum she is requesting will go toward purchasing ingredients and stock such as rice, pasta, potato (fresh and freeze-dried), and pots. Her work and her prior credits with Impro allow her access to this credit. She has experience with the business, and its income will cover the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Historia del Cliente: La señora Victoria elabora comida en su domicilio y vende a los albañiles en las construcciones, también elabora almuerzos y platos extras y su hija le ayuda en el negocio. Vive en la zona de Irpavi II de la ciudad de La Paz, y su puesto es ambulante ya que vende la comida en cada construcción. Es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito, y la segunda vez que requieren la ayuda de Kiva, su última cuota ha sido cancelada en diciembre por lo que solicita un nuevo préstamo. Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de Insumos (Arroz, fideo, papa, chuño, tunta. y ollas) Su trabajo y antecedentes crediticios con Impro le permiten acceder a este crédito ya que tiene experiencia en su negocio. El cual le da ingresos para cubrir el préstamo.

loans.use:
Compra de insumos - arroz, fiedo, papa, chuño,tuntas - y ollas.
Purchase of ingredients - rice, pasta, potato foods - and pots

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a widow with a 16-year-old daughter. They live in Uzhgorod where Irina owns a business in the local market called “Belochka” (“Squirrel”). This is the only source of income for their family of two. Irina sells delicious baked cookies and cakes as well as a variety of candy and other sweets. Some of her inventory spoils quickly so Irina has to buy fresh merchandise every two days. Irina has a nice big vending spot in the market and offers a huge variety of fresh cookies, pastries, cakes and candy to please many different customers’ tastes. She has been in this food business for 4 years. Her turnover capital is about $2000. Last year Irina used profits generated from her business to remodel her entire apartment.

Irina is very cheerful and open-hearted, which always attracts many potential clients to her vending kiosk. Moreover, she knows how to make reasonable investments in her business, work 24/7 and take risks whenever a new opportunity comes along. Irina outlived her husband who was killed in an accident. However, she overcame this tragedy and went back to work. Irina is requesting a loan of $500 to increase assorted inventory, continue to grow as an entrepreneur and possibly open a new vending facility in the near future.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es:
Mrs. Maria B. is a 45-year-old married mother of 4 children, whom she must support. They live in the Villa Reconciliación area, which lacks some basic services such as potable water.

Thirteen years ago, she set up a small general store, which has been able to cover certain family expenses, in her humble house. Her husband does not have a steady job due to the lack of job opportunities. He sells medicine informally in communities far from the district of Managua, where people do not have access to pharmacies.

At home, they have a small but well-stocked inventory of medication that is consumed on a daily basis. At this time, Mrs. B. is requesting a loan in order to buy goods for her general store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Maria tiene 45 años de edad, es casada, tiene 4 hijos a los cuales debe de alimentar, habitan en el asentamiento Villa Reconciliación, con carencia de algunos servicios básicos como el agua potable.

Hace 13 años, la señora monto una pequeña pulpería en su humilde vivienda con la cual ha podido subsanar ciertos gastos familiares, el esposo de la señora no cuenta con un trabajo fijo, debido a la falta de oportunidades de empleo, el señor vende medicamentos de manera informal en comunidades lejanas del departamento de Managua, en donde no tienen acceso a farmacias.

En la casa de habitación, cuenta con un inventario mínimo pero bien surtido de medicamentos comunes que son consumidos muy cotidianamente. En este momento la señora solicita un préstamo para comprar productos alimenticios para su pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase of milk, chicken, meat, eggs, beans, and sugar

loans.name: Isabela's Faith Group

texts.en:
Isabela C. is a 26-year-old woman living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. In addition to herself, Isabela cares for two other people, ages 23 and 14. To support her houshold, she works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day selling food. Isabela earns about $90 in profit every month.

Isabela hopes to grow her business, which is why she's applied for a group loan of $275 U.S. dollars. Her loan partner is Assumpta T., who has a business selling arts and crafts. Both women are extremely responsible and determined, and Isabela is confident that they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more supplies for food vending stall

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina Q. is a chop bar operator. She is married and has 2 children. She needs financial assistance to increase her capital and expand her business.

She is asking for $625 as additional capital for the expansion of her business.

loans.use: As additional capital for the expansion of her business

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr:
Fatou G. is young, unmarried, and lives at her parents' place in the Randoulène Nord district in Thies. She sells breakfast foods near her home; developing her business is the purpose of her loan application. With this money, she wants to stock basic ingredients (milk, sugar, coffee).

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

F ATOU G. est une jeune célibataire qui habite chez ses parents au quartier Randoulène Nord à Thies .Elle vend le petit déjeuner près de chez elle ;c'est dans le but de développer son activité qu'elle sollicite un pret.
