HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of blouses, kitchen utensils and home products.

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda is 47 years old and is a married woman with three children. The oldest child is 23 years old. Her husband is a farmer.

Florenda has been in the hog-raising business for three years. She built a backyard piggery to raise pigs. She fattens the pigs and sells them at the market. She also helps her husband grow rice crops.

This loan will be used to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and farm fertilizers. She hopes for this loan to help her piggery and her husband's farm.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feeds, vitamins and farm fertilizers.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 41 years old and married.  She supports a family of three school-going children. Beatrice operates a cereals business in the Kuywa trading centre in Kitale.

She has been in business for the last six years and this has been her only source of income. From this business she gets a profit of KES 4,000 a month. She has applied for a loan of KES 5,000 from KADET LTD to buy more beans for sale.

Beatrice anticipates on using her profits to expand the business and repay the loan. Beatrice dream is to own a milling company and give her family the best life she can afford.

loans.use: To purchase stock of assorted cereals for sale

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is single and has no children, yet she takes care of the orphans of her late children. Teopista lives in a home in Kampala, Uganda which she rents. She has access to electricity but none to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

Teopista sells food from a grocery shop to both wholesale and retail customers. She has been in this business for a year and works seven days a week. Teopista has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes. The main business challenges for Teopista include seasonality and thieves.

Teopista’s goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked grocery shop and a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, and sweet and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en: Elena is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Elena has a retail shop that sells fish, like sardines. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fish to sell. Elena is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Elena hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: San Antonio De Jicamarca Group

texts.es: Viviana es integrante de la Nueva Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio de Jicamarca” donde la conforman 08 personas, en la cual ella tiene el cargo de tesorera. Viviana es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos que en la actualidad todavía dependen de ella y de conyugue, Viviana  lleva más de 12 años dedica a la crianza de cerdos, contando hasta el momento con 10 chanchos y 20 lechones, esta   actividad que nació a raíz de que su esposo no contaba con un trabajo estable ya que se dedica a la labranza, es así como Viviana toma la decisión de  ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar  y con la educación de sus menores hijos. Con el préstamo que solicito piensa comprar alimentos para sus cerdos (comida balanceada). A futuro a Viviana le gustaría comprarse un carro para que ella pueda ir a comprar los alimentos ya que el flete le sale muy caro. La Nueva Alcancía Comunal “San Antonio de Jicamarca” están agradecidos y comprometidos con el Programa-Prosperidad.
texts.en:
Viviana is a member of the Nueva Alcancía communal bank “San Antonio de Jicamarca” which is made up of eight people and where she is the treasurer.  Viviana is very friendly and has four children who all still depend on her and her husband.  Viviana has worked for more than 12 years raising pigs and at the moment has 10 pigs and 20 piglets.  This work began because her husband didn’t have a stable job as he works in agriculture.  This is why Viviana decided to help her partner with the household expenses and raising their young children.  

With the loan she is requesting she plans to buy feed for her pigs (balanced food).  In the future Viviana would like to buy herself a car so that she could go to buy the feed for her pigs as delivery is very expensive.  The Nueva Alcancía communal bank “San Antonio de Jicamarca” members are thankful and committed to the Programa-Prosperidad (Prosperity Program).

loans.use: to buy balanced feed (for pigs).

loans.name: Kuul's Group

texts.en:
Kuul is the leader of this group. She is 77 and, unfortunately, she is a widow. She has raised a son who is 49 and works as a builder. The son is married and lives separately with his family. 

In order to earn money to meet her daily needs, Kuul breeds livestock. She started this activity a long time ago. Therefore, she has good experience in this sphere. With money received from the loan, she wants to purchase two or three goats in order to increase the number of livestock. 

In the future Kuul wants to build a shed for her livestock.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase goats.

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma Elizabeth  tiene 38 años casada vive con el esposo y con dos hijos de 13 y 5 años,   vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNIONse encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

 Norma Elizabeth se dedica al cultivo de cacao, maíz, arroz y plátano. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es  tener casa propia para los hijos.

Le gusta  salir de paseo y festejar las fiestas del recinto bailando.
texts.en:
Norma Elizabeth, 38, is married living with her husband and two children who are 13 and 5 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Unión” (New Union) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

Norma Elizabeth grows cocoa beans, corn, rice and bananas.  She makes her purchases and her sales at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

She requests the loan to buy farming supplies: fertilizer and manure.  The loan will help her meet her economic needs and improve her farming activities.  She faces challenges like the fall in price of the products she sells and dealing with middlemen. 

Her dream is to have a house of her own for her children.  She enjoys going on outings and dancing during the celebration of the hamlet’s festivals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
La señora Ruperta que tiene la edad de 58 años, ella no estuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se encuentra casada con el señor Conrado que trabaja en el campo como jornalero, ellos tuvieron 4 hijos los cuales 3 trabajan y uno trabaja, ellos viven en una zona cañera dela cuenca del papaluapan.

Ella nos comenta que desde hace 3 años decidio iniciar con su negocio de venta de tortillas y masa porque quiere apoyar a sus esposo con los gastos del hogar, tambien porque dice que como esta la situacion economica el dinero ya no alcanza.

Doña Ruperta realiza su venta de tortillas todos los dias, ella un dia antes pone a herbir el  maiz y al dia siguiente se  levantan muy temprano a prender el molino de niztamal, moler el maiz y despues ponerse a hacer sus tortillas que en ocasiones ya son pedidos de sus clientes pero que en otras ocaciones pues tiene que salir a vender con sus amigos y vecinos, nos comenta  tambien que hay dias en los que le va muy bien la venta de sus tortillas pero que que otras ocasiones la venta esta bajas pero que no se desanima pues sabe que asi son los negocios y que hay que trabajar muy duro para salir adelante.


Ella necesita este credito para la compra de refacciones para su molino, maiz para su posterior realizacion de sus productos.

Doña Ruperta espera que con esta inversion su negocio prospere pues quiere tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Ruperta is 58 years old, and didn't have the opportunity to attend school.  She is married to Señor Conrado, who works in the fields as a laborer.  They have four children, of whom three work and one does not.  They live in a sugarcane area of La Cuenca del Papalaupan.

She tells us that she decided three years ago to start her business selling tortillas and dough because she wanted to help her husband with the household expenses, and also because she says that due to the economic situation, money was tight.

Doña Ruperta sells tortillas everyday.  She sets the corn to boil the day before, and the following day she gets up very early to use the corn mill to grind the corn; afterwards she gets to make the tortillas.  Occasionally, they have already been ordered by her customers, but on other occasions she has to go sell to her friends and neighbors.  She also comments that there are days when things go very well for her with selling her tortillas, but there are other occasions when sales are low.  However, she does not get discouraged as she knows that this is the way of business, and that she has to work very hard to get ahead in life.

She needs this loan for the purchase of spare parts for her mill and corn for making her products.  

Doña Ruperta hopes that with this investment her business will prosper, as she wants to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to sell tortillas.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace lives in Essiam, a village near Abura. She is a widow taking care of 5 children. Palm oil production is what she has been doing for the past 10 years. The income she makes from her sales is used to take care of her dependents. Her loan will be used to obtain palm fruits to make more volumes of oil for resale.

loans.use: to obtain palm fruits to make more volumes of oil for resale.

loans.name: Gricelda Paola

texts.es:
La señorita Gricelda, es de la Ciudad de Pilar. Se trata de una chica que vive hace mas de 18 años en la ciudad en casa de sus tíos. Ella es la encargada de esa casa y no paga alquiler solo corre con los gastos de servicios básicos. Esta cursando el primer año de la carrera de Administración en la Universidad Privada San Lorenzo. Trabaja como vendedora para la empresa Industria y Hogar, hace 1 año, y seis meses.
Ella es soltera, sin hijos es la mayor de dos hermanos. Los mismos son menores y viven con sus padres en España. Es una persona muy trabajadora amable y emprendedora con ganas de superarse cada día.
Ella solicita el crédito para el pago de las cuotas de su universidad, como así también para compra de libros y materiales didácticos. Ella está muy agradecida con la fundación por la oportunidad, ya que lo que mas desea ella es poder seguir estudiando para terminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Señorita Gricelda is from the city of Pilar. She is a young woman who has lived for more than 18 years in this city in her uncle and aunt's house. She is in charge of the house and pays no rent, only the cost of basic services. She is in her first year of an administration degree in the private University of San Lorenzo. She has worked for the last year and a half as a salesperson for the company Industria y Hogar.

She is single, without children and is the eldest sibling. Her two brothers are minors and live with her parents in Spain. She is a very hardworking, enterprising and friendly person with a desire to excel and improve every day.

She is asking for the loan to pay for her university fees as well as buy books and teaching materials. She is very grateful to the Fundacion for the opportunity as what she most wants is to be able to continue studying to complete her degree.

loans.use: to buy school supplies as well as pay for tuition and books.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a focused business woman aged 40. She is married and blessed with two children who attend school. For the last three years, she has been managing a green grocer to earn a living. She also practices poultry farming for more income. In the next 5 years she wants to expand her business. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to buy chickens for rearing.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Ronila

texts.en:
Ronila is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Ronila has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Ronila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ronila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Diana

texts.es: Diana, de 21 años, es una madre joven, tiene un niño de 4 años. Vive a lado de su pareja con quien es conviviente, tienen una casa propia en la cual trabajan ambos para poder brindan los mejor a su menor hijo. El trabajo de Diana consiste en el alquiler de mototaxi, ella tiene una mototaxi el cual alquila a un chofer que trae todos días el costo del alquiler. Ella para en su casa en donde espera todos los días a que su chofer llegue. Tiene dos años en este trabajo, y gracias a ello puede contribuir con los gastos del hogar.  Le gusta de su trabajo que puede tener un ingreso desde su hogar sin tener que descuidar a su hijo. Ella junto a su conviviente generan los ingresos suficientes para poder vivir tranquilos y espera poder mantener su negocio por mientras ya que más adelante le gustaría empezar a vender comida en su casa. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, espera poder pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y así no quedar mal con el grupo al que pertenece. Agradece mucho esta oportunidad que le dan de aumentar su capital, pues le ayudará mucho en hacer cosas para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Con el monto solicitado 500 soles, comprará materiales para empezar a vender comida, además de ingredientes e insumos, asimismo arreglará algunas piezas de su mototaxi que se deterioraron con el tiempo.
texts.en:
Diana, 21, is a young mother; she has a 4-year-old son.  She lives with her spouse in their own house; they both work to provide the best for their son.

Diana’s work consists in leasing a mototaxi.  She owns a mototaxi that she leases to a driver who pays her a daily rental fee.  She goes by his house every day to wait for him to arrive.  She’s been in this business for two years and thanks to it has been able to contribute towards household expenses.  What she likes about her work is that she’s able to earn money from home not having to neglect her son.  She and her spouse generate enough income to be able to live worry-free and she’d like to stay in business for the time being since later on she’d like to start to sell food at home.

This will be her first MFP loan.  She hopes to be able to pay all her installments on time in order not to disappoint the group she’s part of.  She is very grateful for this opportunity to increase capital because it will help her a lot to do things that will increase her working capital.  She will use the requested 500 soles to buy supplies to start selling food as well as ingredients and raw materials.  She will also repair some of her mototaxi’s parts that have worn down over time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and also to buy a spare part for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Esperanza Del Socorro de 55 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de tiste y bolsas plásticas. Es una señora muy dedicada, ella le gusta este trabajo desde que la despidieron de su empleo.  Ella quiere este crédito para la compra de maíz, azúcar, cacao y bolsa entre otro. Ella se levanta desde muy temprano para la elaboración del tiste. Pero a la señora esperanza le gustaría ampliar más su negocio para seguir manteniendo a su familia.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro is 55 years old.  She sells tiste (a popular regional drink made of toasted corn and ground cocoa) and plastic bags.  She is a very hardworking woman.  She likes this work, as she was let go from her previous job.  

She wants this loan to buy corn, sugar, cocoa, and bags, among other things.  She wakes up very early in the morning to make tiste, but Esperanza would like to further expand her business to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn, sugar, cocoa, and bags.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 32 years old, married and has one child who is 16 years old.  She runs her clothes selling business in a very competitive environment, but she has retained her business because she has good customer care skills.  She thanks Faulu Kenya for training her on good customer care.  

Sophia has been in this business for only one year and she hopes to expand her business and open a cosmetics shop.  She has requested for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to buy clothes to resell.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Maria Isabel esta solicitando un préstamo para remodelar y colocar el vitropiso en su negocio que tiene desde hace ya mas de seis años. 
Este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella su familia, quien atiende el negocio son la señora Maria Isabel y un hermano quien le ayuda. Quiere mejorar su negocio y así poder ayudar a otras personas dándoles empleo.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel is requesting a loan to remodel and put in a tile floor in the business that she has had for six years.
This business is her income for her family and she manages it along with help from her brother.  She wants to improve the business so that she can offer work to others.

loans.use: to remodel and put down a floor in her business

loans.name: Miguela

texts.es:
La Sra. Miguela es de la ciudad de Caacupé, es separada, tiene hijos, pero todos ya mayores. Ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de chipas (alimento típico paraguayo) desde hace mas de 20 años, comenta que gracias a este trabajo pudo darle todo lo que necesitaba su familia.
Siempre fue una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y pese a los años que ya lleva en el negocio, siempre disfruta de lo que hace. Desea seguir trabajando y creciendo, por lo que siempre se esfuerza al máximo por eso.
solicita a la fundación y Kiva un crédito para la compra de materia prima para chipa en cantidades,como ser almidón, manteca, huevos, condimentos y demás, y así obtiene mejores precios y le sobra más ganancias de su productos.
texts.en:
Miguela comes from the town of Caacupé. She is separated from her husband and she has adult children. She has been engaged in preparing “chipas” (a typical Paraguayan food) for more than 20 years, and she says that thanks to this activity she has been able to provide for her family giving them all they needed.
She has always been a very hard-working and resourceful woman, and in spite of the years she has dedicated to her activity, she always enjoys what she does. She wants to keep on working and improving, and for this reason she always seriously engages in it.
She is requesting a loan to the institution and to Kiva to buy big quantities of basic ingredients for the chipas such as starch, butter, eggs, flavorings among others: this way she will sell at better prices and she will earn more from the selling of her products.

loans.use: To buy starch, butter, eggs, flavorings and other ingredients to prepare "chipas".

loans.name: Elmer

texts.en:
Forty-four year- old Elmer  owns and operates a rice mill. His customers are mostly locals in his place. Aside from that, he also  toils the land and grows rice. He is married man and has four children, whom one is still attending school. He lives in the town of Sierra Bullones. 

He would like to continue operate his rice mill business, that is why he decided to join CEVI to access financial services.

Elmer has requested a loan  to  pay for  permit (rice mill) and fertilizer for the farm . Thus, he could able to continue provide services. His farm would also gain bountiful harvest, thus enabling his earnings to goes high. In that way, he could set aside and continue to work efficiently to become sustainable in the future.

 Elmer is grateful for availing the funds and in return, he is doing his  best to improve his over all livelihood.

loans.use: to  pay for  permit (rice mill) and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Akouélé

texts.en:
Ms. Akouélé M., born October 7, 1953 in Lomé, is a married mother of four children and takes care of two of her brothers. Having been born to a poor family, she left school to help her mother with the household duties. After having spent several years at home, her parents sent her on an apprenticeship to learn to sew. She then specialized in making baby clothing. At the end of her apprenticeship, she was unable to open a workshop and thus had to resort to sales. Then with the little savings she had, along with a small loan, she opened a workshop and a store that she still operates today.

The baby clothing that she sells in her store is made by Ms. M. and her apprentices. Faced with the ever-growing demand of her customers and insufficient financial means, she is requesting a loan of $1100. This loan will allow her to order cloth wholesale to make baby clothing, which will increase her production capacity, and to buy other baby articles requested by her customers, such as sheets, diapers, and other items. The success of this project will increase her income considerably, something her family needs very much.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Akouélé, née le 7 Octobre 1953 à Lomé est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants avec deux (02) frères à charge. Née d’une famille pauvre, elle abandonna les études pour aider sa maman dans les activités ménagères. Après quelques années passées à la maison, ses parents l’envoient en apprentissage pour se former en couture. Elle s’est alors spécialisée dans le trousseau bébé. A la fin de son apprentissage, elle n’eût pas la chance d’ouvrir un atelier et dût recourir au commerce. Par la suite, avec ses petites économies et un petit crédit, elle ouvrit un atelier et une boutique qu’elle tient jusqu’à ce jour.

Les trousseaux vendus dans sa boutique sont confectionnés par elle-même avec ses apprenties. Face à la demande sans cesse croissante de sa clientèle et à l’insuffisance de ses moyens financiers, elle sollicite un appui financier de $1100. Ce crédit va lui permettre de commander les tissus en gros pour la confection des trousseaux afin d’accroître sa capacité de production, d’acheter d’autres articles pour bébé demandés par ses clients tels que les draps, couches bébé et autres. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera considérablement ses revenus aux besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy cloth and make baby clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth Kamau intends to build a permanent business structure

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 35 years old, and a single mother of three. She has been selling potatoes for a living for a long time and is seeking a loan to help her expand her business to include more vegetables. This will enable her to earn a gross profit of 4 USD per day, and enable her to educate her children and live a better life.

loans.use: To diversify my business to include vegetables

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary N. is happily married with a child; she is 40 years of age. She is a native of Aba but resides in Asaba in Delta State, Nigeria. She specializes in the preparation & sale of local food & pepper soup. People living in the area like her food. Hence she is referred to as home food. She also sells drinks. She is requesting the above loan to enable her to purchase a generator & foodstuff. She has eleven years of experience in her business.

loans.use: To buy a generator & food stuff.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 60, married and father of 6 children, owns a small business making OrientA. pastries and other sweets. Mohamad has been working in this domain since the age of 16, after he learned the recipes and pastry-making secrets from his relatives.

Mohamad has been a client of A. Majmoua for the past 5 years and it is a pleasure to be in a business relation with such a hardworking and gentle man. Mohamad is the type of person who always looks at the cup that is half full (not half empty!) and tries to make his best of life every day for the sake of his large family.

Mohamad needs a loan of US$ 1,200 to buy flour, sugar, and other basic products to prepare large quantities of sweets that he will sell during the coming holiday season. Indeed, the end of the year is usually the high season for Mohamad's business.

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar and other basic products to prepare a large quantity of pastries and sweets

loans.name: Anselmio

texts.es:
Anselmo lost his job due to personnel downsizing. This caused him sadness and he was desperate to find a new job. Time went by and Anselmo still didn't find work. Therefore, he decided to start his own business with the little savings he had left. He started selling groceries. However, he couldn't handle that kind of business administration. Therefore, he started selling quilts, towels, sheets and products like that. People need these kind of products and they don't have an expiration date. He's been keeping this business running for two years and little by little has been gaining clients.

Nonetheless, these same clients have been demanding product novelties and have been making some requests that he has not been able to supply due to lack of capital. Therefore, he is requesting a US $925 loan and he is sure he'll be able to repay it in six months. With your help Anselmo could move this business and his family forward.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Anselmo, perdió su trabajo, en un recorte de personal, lo que lo llevó a la tristeza, y desesperación por encontrar un nuevo trabajo. Pasó el tiempo y Anselmo no encontraba trabajo, por lo que decidió comenzar a realizar su negocio, y con los pocos ahorros que le quedaban, empezó por vender abarrotes, pero no pudo con la administración de este tipo de negocios y decidió cambiar de giro, a la venta de colchas, toallas, sábanas y cosas por el estilo, puesto que mucha gente requiere estos productos y no tienen fecha de caudcidad. Hace 2 años que mantiene funcionando este negocio y poco a poco a ido ganando clientes.

Sin embargo, los mismos clientes son los que le están exigiendo novedades en sus productos, y ya le han hecho varios pedidos que desgraciadamente, no a podido surtir por falta de dinero, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 y está seguro que este dinero lo podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses.Con tu ayuda Anselmo podrá sacar adelante este negocio y a su familia.

loans.use: Purchase products to sell

loans.name: Kartini

texts.en: Kartini is a 37-year-old woman who has a small shop and sells beverages, snacks, food etc., and she usually earns US $12 per week. Her husband, R., has no fixed income. Kartini requests a loan to buy some goods to fill her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy some goods to fill her shop

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
What began as a craving ended up being her greatest source of income. Seven years ago, Ysabel's children gave her the idea of putting up a business to sell sandwiches and salchipapas (a dish made from hot dogs and french fries) from the front door of her house for when they felt like eating these. In spite of the fact that it went well, she had to stop because she did not have enough energy to work at her regular job.

Her grandmother´s illness resulted in Ysabel not being able to depend on her mother´s help to care for her children. For that reason, she had to give up her job and return to selling sandwiches. Now that her children are older, Ysabel would like to rent a space to put up her own sandwich shop.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Lo que comenzó como un antojo terminó siendo su mayor fuente de ingresos. Hace 7 años, los hijos de Ysabel le dieron la idea de poner un negocio de venta de sánguches y salchipapas (platillo hecho de hot dog y papas fritas) en la puerta de su casa cuando se les antojó uno de estos productos. A pesar de que le iba bien, tuvo que dejarlo por que no tenía muchas fuerzas para rendir en la consecionaria en la que trabajaba.

La enfermedad de su abuelo, hizo que Ysabel ya no cuente con la ayuda de su madre para cuidar a sus hijos. Por lo que renunció a su trabajo y retomó la venta de sanguches. Ahora que sus hijos están más grandes, a Ysabel le gustaría alquilar un local para poner una fuente de soda.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Leandro

texts.es:
Leandro is a courageous man who at his advanced age still maintains the vigor and strength to go out and work every morning in his citric fields. He fulfills every aspect of his job with the same intensity that he had when he was young. Without a doubt, the cultivation of fruit is his passion and it gives him life. Now, however, he is worried about the ill health that has begun to plague his dear wife. She has begun to have the sharp and anguished pains associated with her age. Leandro’s greatest motivation is now the desire to earn a better income in order to purchase medicines and vitamins for his beloved wife. Let’s help him with his request for a loan in order to purchase more seeds and fertilizer. His goal is to increase his production and earnings in order to improve his wife’s health.

Translated from Spanish by Debra Faszer-McMahon, Kiva Volunteer.

Leandro, es un valeroso hombre que a su edad aún mantiene vigor y fuerza para salir a trabajar todas las mañanas a su chacra de cítricos su desempeño en cada una de sus actividades las realiza con la misma intensidad de cuando era aún joven, sin duda el cultivo de frutas es lo que lo apasiona y le da vida.Pero ahora está preocupado por los malestares que manifiesta su querida esposa quien ha empezado a tener dolores muy agudos y angustiantes propios de su edad.El deseo de obtener mayores ingresos para adquirir medicinas y vitaminas para la recuperación de su adorada compañera son el motivo más grande que tiene para su diario esfuerzo.Posibilitemos su petición de un préstamo para adquirir mayor cantidad de semillas y abonos con el objetivo de la consolidación de su actividad para mejorar la salud de su esposa.

loans.use: To purchase a larger quantity of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Budumbuli West B (Vi) Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Jane N.. She currently has a local brewery business and is requesting a loan to purchase more brewing ingredients. Jane is 40 years old and married with a husband who is an engineer for work. She has 6 children ranging from ages 5 to 21 and her children go to school. Each week, Jane makes approximately UGX 130000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to save for future use. Jane has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 400000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Jane is joined in her small group by Joyce N., Mary M., and Maxensiya S.. Joyce N. has a business running a grocery store and wants to add more stock. Mary M. is currently operating a grocery store business and wants a loan to change to a business selling charcoal. Maxensiya S. operates a business selling charcoal and wants to open up another charcoal store.

loans.use: To add capital to local brewery business

loans.name: Rehema's Mwamboni B Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 25 years old and is married with 3 children, ages 13, 9, and 7. She and her husband also take care of two other children. Rehema is a clothes seller, she startedher business in 2006. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 6:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Sauda, Amina, and Mariam, who have businesses in food vending and charcoal sales.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Zaituni Nagawa’S Group

texts.en:
N. Zaituni is a widow, age 40, with four children ranging in age from 20 to 14 years old, all of them in school. she is the first one from the left in the photo. She lives in Rubaga, a neighborhood in Kampala. Her business is selling charcoal, which she has been doing for the past 18 years.

Every two weeks, she buys 20 sacks of charcoal from motorcars and then sells it from her house. Each sack costs 20,000/= (Ugandan shillings, approximately $12 US). Charcoal is sold in smaller parcels to individual buyers from the village, with a typical profit of 5,000/= per sack (about $3).

With a loan, she would like to be able to buy more than 20 sacks at a time. She would also like to have a more permanent workplace. The loan will help with all of this, also making it easier for her to pay school fees for her children. Her future goal, though, is to build houses to rent. Additional profit from her charcoal business will eventually help her reach her goal. She has successfully serviced more than 4 loans.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Agness

texts.en: Agness O. sells a local dish called boforot (similar to doughnuts) and bread. She is married, but her husband's income from carpentry is not sufficient for her and their nine children. Since demand for her goods is high, Agness is requesting a loan of $300 to expand the business and increase her profits.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Véronique

texts.fr:
Véronique G. is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of two children.She owns a loincloth store in Assahoun, a village about 50 kilometers from the Togolese capital of Lomé. This is her first loan coordinated through FECECAV. With it, she hopes to increase the scope of her business by purchasing many more loincloths, as well as thread for sewing, to satisfy her customers’ needs and draw in much more profit. In so doing, she will contribute to the improvement of her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer.

Véronique G. est âgée de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle tient une boutique de pagnes à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle souhaite par ce premier crédit de FECECAV accroître la taille de son activité, en achetant beaucoup plus de pagnes et des fils à coudre, pour satisfaire la clientèle et dégager beaucoup plus de bénéfice. Ce faisant elle contribuera à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de a famille.

loans.use: Purchase of many more loincloths

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Đào joined TYM fund in 2007. She lives in the district of Kim Động, Hưng Yên province with her husband and their 3 children. Her main occupation is raising pigs. Her husband and their oldest son are woodworkers. Currently, her family has a batch of 30 pigs. Since she has a lot of experience in this domain, this helps yielding good profit and permits her to have a stable income. They have saved 3.000.000 VND from her pig business and her husband's salary to provide good education to their other 2 children. Their living condition is good. This time Ms Đào is seeking a loan of 9.000.000 VND to invest more in her pig raising business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Đào tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2007.Chị hiện đang sống cùng chồng và 3 con tại huyện Kim Động tỉnh Hưng Yên.Hàng ngày chị chủ yếu chăn nuôi lợn còn chồng chị và người con lớn làm nghề mộc. Hiện nay gia đình chị đang chăn nuôi khoảng 30 con lợn thịt. Với những kinh nghiệm đã được tích luỹ trong nhiều năm nên công việc chăn nuôi của gia đình chị có nhiều thuận lợi và cho thu nhập ổn định. Với thu nhập 3.000.000đ từ chăn nuôi và làm mộc gia đình chị đã có điều kiện để đầu tư cho 2 con ăn học và cải thiện cuộc sống gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị xin vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Raise pigs

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is 32 years old and married with two children, aged 3 and 5 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2006. Every day, she works at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $90 from her sales. In the past, Tabu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. Tabu now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.use: Tabu would like to buy more clothes to re-sell.

loans.name: Thoeurn

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeurn N., 32, sells vegetables and lives in Archarleak Commune, Kampong Thom Province. She sells her goods at the market and earns around US$3.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Thin Pak, is a motorcycle driver, earning around US$2.50 per day. The couple has four children, all of whom live at home and are students. Thoeurn and her husband work hard every day to support their family.

Vegetable sales is the main income for the family and Thoeurn needs to increase her business by improving and offering more vegetables to sell. She would like a loan of US$500 to purchase a larger variety of vegetables to sell. The remainder of the loan will be used to pay for transporting her goods from land she bought to the village. Her future goal is to purchase a store in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of vegetables to sell at the market and to pay for transporting the goods to the market

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Sonrisa.
Paulina es casada, tiene 32 años y aun no tiene hijos, Paulina esta estudiando contabilidad en la universidad, Paulina vende ropa variada en las ferias de la región a donde viaja 1 vez por semana y de las ferias compra quesos, carne que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Además Paulina tiene un carro que alquila diariamente.
Paulina necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Paulina son ampliar su negocio, culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of the Sonrisa Community Bank. She is 32 years old, married, and doesn’t have any children yet. She is studying accounting at university, and she also sells a variety of clothing in the local markets once a week. At the markets she buys cheeses and meat that she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Paulina also has a vehicle that she rents out on a daily basis. Paulina needs a loan of 800 soles to buy children’s clothing. Her dreams are to expand her business and to finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing

loans.name: Justa

texts.es: Justa tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo e hijos. Vende los productos de su cosecha en el mercado todos los días, lo viene haciendo desde hace 20 años, ella produce principalmente cebolla, zanahoria y papa. Todos los miércoles,  que son los días de mayor venta es cuando puede obtener mayores ganancias, por ello que nunca deja de dedicarse a las arduas tareas del campo; la siembra, el cuidado de los cultivos y luego cosecha. Sus planes son producir más, a fin de incrementar sus ventas y repartir al por mayor  sus productos. Es la quinta vez que Justa solicita un préstamo en MFP, demostrando ser cumplida y puntual en sus cuotas. Este dinero lo solicita para comprar sacos de urea y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Justa is a 42-year-old woman who lives with her husband and children. She sells the crops from her fields at the market everyday, as she has been doing for 20 years. She grows mainly onions, carrots and potatoes. Every Wednesday, which is when sales increase, she can obtain greater profits. For this reason, she never stops being so dedicated to the arduous tasks of the field—planting, growing and harvesting. She plans to produce more crops so that she can boost sales and distribute her produce wholesale. This is the fifth time that she requests a loan from MFP, demonstrating that she is responsible and punctual with her payments. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase sacks of urea fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of urea fertilizer

loans.name: Farhat Abudl Rahman Group

texts.en:
I am Farhat and I’m a 44-year-old married woman. I am a citizen of Kot Radha Kishan, which is 24 km from Kasur, Pakistan. I am an uneducated woman, but I do not hesitate to mention it. But I’ll mention that education is very essential for growing up in life. My husband is also not an educated person. He is a milk-seller with 5 years of experience.

I am the mother of five children: two sons and three daughters. My eldest son manufactures cloth on a power loom machine. My younger son runs a grocery shop. My eldest daughter makes thread and sells it in the market. The other two are getting education in a local school near the house. I help my elder daughter make thread. We both go to the market to sell it.

I successfully repaid my first loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan). Now I am applying again for a loan to buy more milk to expand my husband’s milk selling business. 

I am a group leader of a group of five women. Anayat baji wants a loan to buy iron and plastic for her scrap business. Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy utensils to resell. Suraiya baji wants a loan to by an electric sewing machine to make embroidered dresses. Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy rice and wheat to resell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk-selling business

loans.name: Rajabgul

texts.ru: Бобохонова Раджабгуль жительница города Яван. Живет далеко от центра района. Основной видж деятельности в той зоне , это животноводство. Кроме того этот бизнес является единственным источником дохода ее семьи. Имеет коровник и несколько голов бычков. Узнав про возможность получения кредита , решила обратиться к нам и получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев. Таким образом она сможет купить двух молодых телят и увеличить поголовье скота и этим сможет развивать свой бизнес.Раджабгуль замужем и имеет четверых детей.Живут очень дружно и весело.
texts.en:
Rajabgul B. is a resident of Yavan. She lives far from the center of the region. The main business type in her zone is raising livestock. In addition, this business is the sole source of income for her family. Rajabgul has a cowshed and several bulls. After finding out about the possibility of getting a loan, Rajabgul decided to turn to us and to take out a 12 month loan. This way she will be able to purchase two young calves and to expand her business. Rajabgul is married and has 4 children. Her family lives together happily.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase cattle headcount

loans.name: Mẫn Thị Thanh Group

texts.vi:
Chị Mẫn Thị T. năm nay 47 tuổi chị đăng ký vay mức 2.912.000VNđ để bổ sung thêm nguồn vốn của gia đình và mua gỗ về sản xuất bàn ghế để B.n. Hàng ngày chị cùng 2 con sản xuất bàn ghế B.n ra thị trường, còn chồng chị hàng ngày đi làm thợ xây dựng và chăn nuôi lợn, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị cũng bớt đi những khó khăn mà bấy lâu nay gia đình chị đã gặp phải. Đồng thời gia đình chị lại được vay vốn trả góp, mà không phải trả một gánh nặng trong cùng một lúc, nên chị thấy phù hợp và thuận tiện với gia đình chị. Chu kỳ II này chị cùng nhóm đăng ký vay tiếp với các thành viên trong nhóm như sau: 
 Chị Trương Thị H. năm nay 54 tuổi vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi gà đẻ, lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị N. năm nay 27 tuổi vay mức 4.704.000VNđ để chăn nuôi lợn.
 Chị Nguyễn Thị
texts.en:
Mrs. Man Thi T., aged 47, would like to borrow 2.912.000 VND to purchase more wood to make desks and chairs to sell. She and her two children make home furniture from wood everyday and sell it to the market. Her husband is a construction worker and also raises pigs at home. The family’s income as a result has been improved a lot. Mrs. T. is very interested in borrowing loans and paying them back in a certain period of time because this method is suitable for the family’s business. Other members in her group include: - Mrs. Truong Thi Hoat, aged 54, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to raise poultry. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi N., aged 27, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to raise pigs. - Mrs. Nguyen Thi Dan, aged 34, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to invest in her small shop. - Mr. Man Ba Nguyet, aged 56, would like to borrow 4.704.000 VND to raise poultry.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khoa Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vay vốn  kinh doanh và chăn nuôi

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
A sus veintinueve años María ya tiene un negocio bien establecido de moto taxis junto a su esposo. Ya llevan ocho años con el alquiler de sus mototaxis, y cuando es necesario su esposo también sale a conducirlos.
Recibe préstamos de EDAPROSPO desde hace cuatro años, y así puede utilizar sus ganancias para invertir en el capital de su negocio, por ejemplo comprar más moto taxis.
Como el negocio es de los dos, María y su esposo juntos cubren los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de sus cuatro hijos, de diez, cuatro, tres años, más uno recién nacido.
Aunque su negocio va bastante bien, a María le gustaría en un futuro cambiar de profesión y abrir un restaurante, mientras su esposo se podría encargar de la empresa de moto taxis.
texts.en:
At 29 years of age, María already has a well established business of motorcycle taxis with her husband. They have rented their motorcycle taxis for eight years, and, when necessary, her husband also operates them.

She has received loans from EDAPROSPO for four years, and therefore can use the principal to invest in capital for her business, for example to buy more motorcycle taxis.

As the business belongs to both of them, María and her husband cover the household expenses and the upbringing of their four children, ages 10, 4, 3, and a newborn.

Even though her business is going fairly well, María would like in the future to change professions and open a restaurant while her husband could continue to operate the business of motorcycle taxis.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invested in various maintenance expenses for her motorcycle taxis

loans.name: Zinduka Group

texts.en:
Judith has been a clothes seller for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. She works at her business for 10 hours daily.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale in order to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Judith is 46 years old, married, and has seven children: ages 26, 25, 24, 22, 18, 16 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Helieth, who also has her own small business nearby.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Feula

texts.en:
Feula M., 28, is married with two children. She has three years of experience in the sewing business. She sells to the village people and the general public six days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (approximately $140).

Feula has four previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Feula’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine, thread, needles and cotton material

loans.name: María Dolores

texts.es:
La señora María Dolores C. está muy agradecida con su apoyo en el crédito anterior el cual le ayudo mucho en su negocio a crecido y tiene mas ventas de paltillos.
En esté momento esta solicitando su apoyo para un nuevo préstamo para comprar un vehículo para la entrega de platillos, ya que tiene pedidos en diferentes partes de la cuidad y es muy difícil entregarlos a tiempo. 
Es por eso que decido adquirir un carro para  la entrega y así también contratar a otra persona quien le pueda ayudar a repartir los platillos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Ms. María Dolores C. is very grateful for your supporting her with the previous loan, which helped her out a lot with her business. Since then, her business has grown, and her food sales have increased.

At this time, she is requesting your support in the form of a new loan so that she can purchase a vehicle for food distribution because she gets orders from different parts of the city, and it is very difficult to deliver them on time. For this reason, she has decided to obtain a delivery car, as well as hire another person who can help her deliver the meals on time.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase vehicle for food delivery

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en:
" I was working in Singapore before, and my earnings were used to construct our house all made of concrete, and to start a new business. I stopped working abroad because I wanted to see my children grow up. Now, I am engaged in a commercial business which really helps me to be able to contribute to the family income," says Marichu B., 42-year-old mother of two children.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy additional merchandise for her business. She thinks that with her loan, she could be able to grow her business even more.

CEVI is helping promote small business growth. They provide not only credit assistance but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Monica Felicita

texts.es:
Mónica  es socia del Bancomunal  Mar del Plata.
Mónica es casada tiene 24 años , sin hijos, desde los 18 años empezó a trabajar con sus padres ellos tiene puestos de ropa, hasta que junto su capital y ella abrió un puesto de ropa, al mismo tiempo   estudiaba  ingles, ya termino sus estudios ahora trabaja dictando clases de ingles por las tardes.  
Desde que esta en Finca su negocio ha crecido mas ha podido comprar exhibidores de ropa , vitrina, aprendió hacer responsable con los pagos que solicita a Finca.
Mónica necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de lanas, ponchos zapatillas,    
El sueño de Mónica cambiar de negocio y entrar en el negocio de la compra y venta de carros usados.
texts.en:
Mónica is a member of the communal bank, "Mar del Plata." She is married, is 24, and does not have children. When she was 18, she started to work with her parents, who have clothing stands. When she had enough capital, she opened a clothing stand, and at the same time, she studied English. She finished her studies, and now she works giving English classes in the afternoons. Since she has worked with Finca, her business has grown, and she has been able to buy displays and showcases for clothing. She has learned to be responsible with the payments she requests from Finca. Mónica needs a loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase wool, ponchos, and slippers. Mónica's dream is to switch businesses and buy and sell used cars.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wool, ponchos, and slippers

loans.name: Tayepsu Group

texts.en:
This is Hassan K., Kali K. and Aminata K.. They call their group Tayepsu. They are all local entrepreneurs based in Magburaka Town, northern Sierra Leone. This is the very first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make better profit and consequently improve on their standards of living.

Hassan K. (left) is the leader of this group. He was born in Magburaka Town thirty-five years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children. One is in primary school and the others are still not of school-going age.

Hassan is a motorbike rider; motorbikes are widely used in Sierra Leone as taxis. He has been in this motorbike business for seven years now, among the very first to start the business in Magburaka Town. With this loan, together with the little he has been saving, Hassan would like to buy a new motorbike.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old. She is married and the mother of three children who are currently in school. She lives with her husband and the children in a community in the western region of Ghana.

Mary is trader who trades in salt fish and onions in bulk in the community market. She gets the goods from Kumasi. It is her desire to save for her children's education. She is requesting a loan to buy goods to sell so that she can use the profit to assist her husband in taking care of the children's educational needs. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy onions and salt fish in bulk.

loans.name: Say

texts.en: Say H. is a 43-year-old woman who lives in Battambong Province. She is married and has three children: two of them are students, while the other one is a farmer. Say owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Say has been engaged in this business for over twenty-four years and earns approximately US$45 a month. In 2009, Say joined CREDIT to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Say is requesting for the first time a loan from CREDIT. She is requesting a loan of US$800 which will be used to purchase fertilizer and seeds. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About CREDIT: CREDIT's mission is to provide inclusive financial services tailored to the clients' needs through excellent service and positive relationships while maintaining organizational sustainability. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Frankilino

texts.en:
Frankilino G. is from the village of Zone 1, Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 34 years old, and is married with three school-aged children. To make a living, Frankilino owns and operates a business providing waste management services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Frankilino has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Frankilino joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Frankilino has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. He is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. This loan will be his third from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support his children's education and supplement his family's income.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

location.town: Pagatpat, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Mrs. Warlita O. is a 53 year-old married woman who has 3 school-age children. She lives in Prk. Malipayon, Bago, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. Before she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mrs. O. used to worry about the future of her children, because she knew that her husband's salary would not be enough to pay for their education and other needs.

After she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon, she decided to make use of her cooking skills and set up a "carinderia" or luncheonette in which serves affordable home-cooked meals. Her place soon became a popular eating place for the locals, and for the next 5 years, her business gradually improved through her own efforts and with the help of her subsequent loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, which she always paid back on time. Her luncheonette now nets a monthly profit of approximately PHP 8,000, which is a big help to the family.  


Warlita is now borrowing her 15th loan from NWTF. She wants to borrow Php 19,000 to use as additional capital for her "carinderia." The profits are already budgeted to be reinvested in her business after some have been set aside for the education of her children.

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her carinderia business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hog raiser in their village. She is married and they were gifted with one child. Her husband is working as a tricycle (local three-wheeled motorcycle) operator and his income is being used to support their daily needs and also for her hog-raising business.

With her business, she can assist her husband in providing the needs of their family. And to further improve her business, she is now asking to borrow PHP 17,000 that she can use for the maintenance of her hog-raising business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo, quien es agricultor, y con sus 4 hijos; siendo 2 de ellos estudiantes y 2 independientes y trabajadores. Desde hace 13 años cuenta con 10 hectáreas cultivables de palma aceitera, producto que vende a una empresa dedicada a la fabricación de aceite doméstico. Pero no sólo siembra este producto, puesto que también tiene arroz, frijol, plátanos y otros productos, que produce tanto para vender, como para su consumo diario. Lo que le gusta a María de su labor es mantenerse activa y sobre todo tener bien cuidadas sus plantas y frutas, ella considera que su negocio es rentable porque cuenta con comprador fijo y produce gran cantidad de palma cada 15 días.
Este es su 5to crédito con MFP y lo que le gusta de trabajar con su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros son muy trabajadores y puntuales con sus cuotas. El dinero que ahora solicita será invertirá íntegramente en sus campos de cultivo para incrementar su producción.

loans.use: Incremento de su producción agrícola

loans.name: Canal De Benedicion 4&5 Group

texts.en:
Solenny is the coordinator of her group, the Canal de Bendicion (Channel of Blessing). Her story is representative of both the members of her group and Esperanza's Dominican Republic and Haitian clients more generally. Her group is based the rural areas surrounding La Romana, an area where many Haitian immigrants labor in an economy based around the sugarcane harvest, and where electricity and running water (none of which is potable) are unreliable at best. Here she makes her home alone.

She is excited about requesting her third loan and expanding her business. She has repaid these loans without problems and her loan size has grown along with her business. She plans to use this loan to purchase more pants and sheets to sell in her community. By buying in bulk she can negotiate a better price and use those profits to further invest in her business. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy supplies of sheets and pants

loans.name: Khoury

texts.fr: Khoury D. est une femme de 45 ans, elle est marié et mère de 4 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis un an et demi. Avec son crédit elle vend des produits cosmétiques, des bijoux, des sacs à main pour dames et et d'autres effets pour femmes. Elle a une expérience de son activité pour l'avoir exercée depuis plusieurs années. Les bénéfices réalisés seront réinjectés pour l'achat de marchandises afin de renforcer sa boutique. Elle soutien également son mari pour la prise en charge de leur famille.
texts.en:
Khoury D. is a 45 year old woman, married, and a mother of four children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageous [village bank] for the last 1.5 years. She uses the loans she receives to sell cosmetics, jewelry, hand bags for women and other products. She has been involved in this type of activity for a number of years and is very experienced. Profits from the sales are used to purchase additional merchandise in order to improve her store. She also support her husband in taking care of their family.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her retail store

loans.name: Seynabou

texts.fr: Seynabou T. est une femme de 42 ans, elle mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Depuis 7 ans et demi elle est membre du Banc Villageois de MBOUSNAKH où a elle bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a régulièrement rembourser. Avec son crédit elle fait de l'embouche ovine et vend de l'huile. Ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer à la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Seynabou T. is a 42-year old woman who is married with four children. She has been a member of Village Bank of MBOUSNAKH for 7 1/2 years, and has already benefitted from 15 loans that she has repaid. With this loan, she will fatten sheep for sale and sell oil. The income allows her to contribute to financial support of her family.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Develop her business fattening sheep for sale and selling oil.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en: Timothy M. is 27 years old and has a fiancée. He will use the loan to purchase clothing, especially new clothes, for resale in his shop. He owns a boutique, where he sells clothes. He has been operating the business for over three years. His hope for the future is to own a larger store and he also hopes to open up other branches to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La Sra. Vicenta C. V. vive el la localidad de Santa Rita su actividad principal es de vender materiales de construcción como ser arena, ladrillos, cemento, yeso, etc. junto con su esposo ella tambien se dedica labores de la casa y ala educación de sus hijos.

El crédito solicitado es para abastecerse de material de construccion y asi incrementar su capital de trabajo para el sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
La Sra. Vicenta C. V. lives in the town of Santa Rita. Her primary work is selling construction materials such as sand, bricks, cement, plaster, etc. with her husband she does housework and educates her sons. The requested loan will be used to stock up on construction materials and, as a result, increase her working capital and support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Construction Materials

loans.name: Vafa

texts.en:
Vafa A. is 37 years old. She is widow and the mother of a son. Hard life conditions pushed Vafa to start her own business eight years ago. 

Vafa breeds cattle. She buys the calves in the market at a low price, feeds them, and then resells them in the same market at a more profitable price. Vafa works hard to make the business successful and to generate a stable income for her family. 

Vafa is requesting a loan of 1440 AZN to purchase three calves  to raise and sell and fodder to feed them. Vafa would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to manage the loan without violations or delinquency.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a 68-year-old widow from the mountainous city of Tanay, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is blessed with an only daughter, Melanie, who is 35 years old and a high school graduate. Her daughter has a family of her own. Even at her older age; Milagros still dreams of the best for her family.

In 2004, Milagros joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and Kiva partner in the Philippines. When she received her first loan, she invested the money in the selling of different small items and later expanded the business with additional products. She now also raises hogs.

Now on her eighth loan, she requested 20,000 pesos as additional capital for her business. She is optimistic that her business will grow since she already has regular customers requesting orders from her.

She dreams of having a stall in the market where she can sell her products, building a concrete house and also experiencing a life that is far away from poverty.

loans.use: Additional capital to sell different small items and the remaining money will be used for hog raising

loans.name: Orlando Alberto

texts.es: Orlando Alberto es casado con la Sra. Karla Rodriguez con quien aun no tiene hijos, labora como auxiliar de contabilidad , habita junto a sus padres en la ciudad de Juigalpa de quienes esta muy pendiente y apoya con los gastos del hogar, esta solicitando su 2do credito a AFODENIC con el proposito de mejorar su casa cambiando el techo que se encuentra en mal estado, al mismo tiempo desea construir su cuarto para tener mayor privacidad, pues cuando llegue el momento de formar su familia podra brindarle las condiciones basicas y espera contar con el apoyo de kiva para lograr este objetivo.    Orlando se caracteriza por ser muy trabajador, responsable y honesto, es muy querido por sus compañeros de trabajo.
texts.en:
Orlando Alberto, who's employed as an accountant's assistant, is married to Karla Rodriguez; they don't have any children yet. He lives with his parents in Juigalpa. He cares for them and contributes to household expenses. He is requesting his second loan from AFODENIC to do some home repair, specifically replace the roof that's in poor state. He also wants to finish building a bedroom for more privacy so that, when the moment comes to form a family, he will be able to provide basic conditions for them. He hopes to have Kiva's support to reach this goal. Orlando is very hard-working, responsible and honest; he is held in high regard by his coworkers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To replace the roof and build a bedroom.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana es una joven de 28 años de edad, madre soltera de tres hijos, vive en el barrio Memorial Sandino, su vida no ha sido nada fácil pues trabaja como domestica en una casa particular que su abuelita la recomendó ya que tiene que dar alimentación y educación  a sus hijos. Poco a poco ha ido construyendo su casa ya que aun vive con su mama, no la a terminado por falta de dinero ya que todo esta caro es por eso opto al financiamiento para poder cerrar su casa ya que falta levantar paredes, repellar, techo, puertas, pero lo esencial es el techo para pasarse ante de que comience el invierno. Para ella es difícil pero no imposible poder tener un techo digno para sus hijos. Sus planes es poder apoyar a sus hijos, terminar su casa y poder seguir trabajando para poder seguir obteniendo esta posibilidad de los créditos, el cual es una gran oportunidad para las familia de poco recursos.
texts.en:
Ana is a twenty-eight-year-old young woman. She is a single mother of three children and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood. Her life is not easy; she works as a maid in a home through the recommendation of her grandmother. She has to feed and educate her children. Though she still lives with her mother, little by little she has been building her house. She has not finished her house because she lacks money. Everything is expensive and therefore she has chosen to apply for this loan. She still needs to build walls, plaster, put on the roof and doors, but it is essential to finish the roof before winter begins. It is difficult but not impossible for her to have a decent home for her children. Her plans are to support her children, finish her house, and continue working in order to obtain this loan, which is a great opportunity for a family with few resources.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to build walls and put a roof on her house, which she expects to soon complete

loans.name: Liza Kongato

texts.en:
Liza C. is a 56-year-old lady who is married to Mr. Joseph C.. They have been blessed with nine children: Hilda (26 years), Jeptui (30 years), Kimoi (28 years), Henry (26 years), Winny (24 years; in university), Edwin (22 years; in university), Robert (20 years; in university), Kipngetich (17 years; in high school) and Gideon(12 years; in primary school).

Liza is a farmer and she has been farming for eight years now. Her farming business generates a profit of Ksh 5,000 per month. She has no other sources of income. Liza’s business is situated in Timboiywo where most of her customers are residents.

Liza has obtained a loan of Ksh 80,000 from KADET. Ksh 50,000 of this loan will be used for farming and the balance will be used to pay school fees. She has never borrowed from another financial institution. If this loan boosts her business she will use the extra profit to pay school fees for her children.

Liza dreams of having a good dairy cow and she describes herself as hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pay school fees

loans.name: Chandrani

texts.en:
Chandrani is a 34-year-old married woman living in Hikkaduwa, Sri Lanka, with her husband and two children. Chandrani's husband drove a three-wheeler taxi, but the income was not sufficient to support the family, so together they have started a new business consisting of a rental equipment shop.  Since starting this rental shop, the family income has increased but they are seeking further capital to help expand. Chandrani and her family are very caring people and always try to help others in the community when possible.

Chandrani has requested a 20,000 Sri Lankan rupee loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to purchase different types of sound equipment for the rental shop. Ultimately, with their increased income, they hope to renovate their house.  

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase sound equipment

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena D. is 28 years old and a very good member of Kiva partner, ASHI. She is also a very responsible mother to her two children, aged six and seven, both of whom are in primary school. Rowena’s husband is a hired company driver. He is sweet and loving to her and the children. Despite facing poverty and the many adversities it causes, a good relationship with her husband and children is Rowena's inspiration and motivation to pursue her dream of giving her children an improved kind of life worth living for.
Somehow, Rowena wanted to help her husband earn money for their children's future educational expenses until they receive their own bachelor degrees. She joined ASHI in 2008 and has been able to set up a hog-fattening business. She fattens hogs in four months and then sells them, either slaughtered or alive, at the market or in her village. After one year, Rowena realized that her business profits were quite good and therefore she is requesting a loan to grow her hog-fattening business into a piggery in her backyard.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening

loans.name: Un Nuevo Esfuerzo Group

texts.en:
Teresa is the coordinator of her group Un Nuevo Esfuerzo (A New Endeavour), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush, rugged isthmus with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their five children.

Teresa is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling seafood, by purchasing fish, shrimp, and crab to sell from her seafood stand in her home. She will use the profits for her children by purchasing medicine, school supplies, and clothing. Additionally, she would like to finish constructing her home while finding a separate location for her seafood stand. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy fish, shrimp, and crab.

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.pt:
Ermelinda F. V. nasceu em inhambane onde frequentou os seus estudos em inhambane ate 5 classe  e nos tempos livres ajudava a fazer os trabalhos de casa e porque os seus pais nao tinham condicoes teve de vir a Maputo para viver com seu irmao mais velho  que se encontrava a trabalhar numa instancia turistica aqui na catembe.continuou com os estudos ate 8 classe e voltou a parar porque ficou gravida isto e 1996 e teve de trabalhar para o seu sustento e da crianca.com os rendimentos que ganhava do seu trabalho fazia pequenas poupancas onde acobaou conseguindo abrir uma barraca para poder exercer on seu proprio negocio isto e 2000 teve o seu proprio estabelecimento que vem exercendo a 10 anos e prendeu a fazer  o negocio no seu local onde trabalhava como empregada de balcao numa loja.
E atraveis de vizinhos ouviu falar da hluvuku onde  benefeciou  se de 1 credito no valor de 16.000.00 estando no Segundo emprestimo e ja teve outros emprestimos na cccom onde teve 5 crditos antes de conhecer a hluvuku no valor de 2.000.00,5000.00, 10.000.00, 15000.00, e 20.000.00.
 com o creditos o seu negocio vai crescer  e tambem os melhores produtos mais procurado na sua loja sao o arroz e acucar. E as vendas diarias tem sido de 1.500.00 dependendo dos dias quer dizer que aos fins de semana tem vendido mais principalmente quando ‘e final do mes e [para aumentar o seu rendimento tem de diversificar os produtos para conseguir ter mais rendimentos.
Agora vive na casa propria e o seu negocio vai muito bem tem conseguindo poupar algum parte do valor do seu rendimento fazendo depositos para sua conta particular.
Os seus projectos pessoais e poder um dia poder abrir uma crèche e formar um grupon de dancas para passarem a dancar em eventos tais como casamentos e outros.
texts.en:
Ermelinda F. V. was born in the town of Inhambane. Her schooling was interrupted in 5th grade, when, due to her family's financial difficulties, she was sent to live with her older bother in the province of Catembe, Maputo, where he was working at a tourist resort. In Maputo she started going to school again. After finishing middle school, in 1986, she got pregnant and had to start working as a store clerk to support herself and her child. Her earnings from that job allowed her to save some money to open a little grocery store. Since 2000 she has been in the business of selling foodstuff and beverages. Her bestselling products are sugar and rice. Ermelinda learned about Hluvuku from a friend, and this is her second loan with the institution (the first was in the amount of 16,000). In the past, she's had five loans from another institution in the amounts of 2.000.00, 5.000.00, 10.000.00 and 20.000.00mt respectively. This current loan will allow her to increase and diversify her stock. Since business is doing very well, she's able to save money in the bank. She makes 1.500.00/day (more on the weekends and at the end of the month) and owns the house she lives in. She hopes to be able to open a daycare one day, and to start a dance group to perform at weddings and other social events.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, beer and beverages to sell at her store

loans.name: Enkhtuya

texts.en:
Enkhtuya is 49 years old and lives with her husband and 2 children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. They all live together in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her 2 sons, Soyol-Erdene and Munhzorig attend University. 

Enkhtuya operates a taxi service in her town. She enjoys transporting people. She says, “I must be very responsible and careful when driving my car in order to provide a safe ride for my customers.” Enkhtuya started her business in 2007 after she sold her own house. During that time she gained much experience in conducting a business. Enkhtuya is very hard working and is known for her good character. She has gained a lot of experience over the years and is a trusted driver for her many customers. She works hard to maintain her success and is hopeful about the future.
