Her family is the most important thing for her and she says, “As a mother, I would like to be financially available to provide a good education and other necessary expenses for my children until they graduate from University. I would also like to expand my business. She is requesting a loan to build a house on her own land.

loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon, living with his parents and three young siblings. In 2008, he started selling chocolates and candies in his area. He found it a good business and started covering several other areas. He is now requesting a loan of $1,000 in order to increase his merchandise and introduce new products.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise

loans.name: Bugolo Zibulaatudde Kikondo Group 1-Lugazi

texts.en:
Twenty-three years down the road operating a fishing business is quite remarkable. Longevity in this cutthroat business normally points to individual hallmarks of hard work, constant planning, resilience, determination and a creative vision. If you take the example of 44-year-old N. Tausi, then you have got a clear testimony to the above. 

This happy-go-lucky and affable married mother of six has brought profit grist to her business mill, selling fish all these years. Her business status at present reads like a rags-to-riches success story. With savings from her first farming business, which she still operates at a small scale, Tausi was able to set forth on this business. Casting her mind back, she says her farming business was not as lucrative as this one. She says she had to grapple with a lot of financial difficulty at that time. 

As of now, she is planning on building a better family house if her prospects improve with this loan. In a month, her profits total up to 240,000 shillings (about $106). With this loan, she says she wants to buy a boat.

loans.use: Purchasing a boat

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea M. is from the village of Lumbo, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old and married. To make a living, Irenea owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Irenea has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 9,600 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Irenea joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irenea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Irenea is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Alexei Odalis

texts.es:
Alexei de 24 años de edad es soltero, labora como docente de primaria desde hace 4 años en la Escuela Rafaela Herrera a 34 km de Nueva Guinea, el tiene que viajar  una hora a caballo para llegar a centro de trabajo ya que hasta la colonia la Fonseca llegan los camiones.  

Està  solicitando su 2do  crèdito para construir una  cocina con mejores condiciones en la casa de su mamá, pues aun no ha formado su propia familia y mientras esté a su alcance desea ayudarla en lo mas que pueda, pues desea compensar un poquito los sacrificios que su mamá hizo cuando el era pequeño. 

Alexei  es un joven bien querido por sus alumnos y compañeros de trabajo, caracterizandolo su responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Alexei is 24, single, and has been working as a primary school teacher for the last 4 years in the Rafaela Herrera school, 34 kilometers from Nueva Guinea. He has to travel an hour on horseback to his work since the buses only go as far as the Fonseca neighborhood. He is asking for his second loan to build a better kitchen in his mother’s house. He doesn’t yet have his own family so while he can, he wants to help her as much as possible. He would like to repay her a little for the sacrifices that she made when he was a child. Alexei is a young man who is well-liked by his students and fellow workers, all of which show how responsible he is.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
This is Linda P., 53, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Hipolito P., a goldsmith, and mother of three children, all of whom are still in high school. By the grace of God, Linda has managed to pay for her children's schooling. At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them all the way through college. This is a dream for most Filipino parents like Linda, as she herself has been a college undergraduate and believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Linda operates a jewelry business. Her husband makes the jewelry while she manages orders, finances and accounts. Gold jewelry, although not as common in the Philippines as silver jewelry, is still in demand, because of its higher value. In her business inventory are gold, silver and semi-precious and precious stones. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more supplies like silver. She also will invest a portion of the loan to pay the repair fee for the machine they use to solder the jewelry. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 
 
Linda dreams of being able to give her family a comfortable and well-off future. She also hopes that her family will soon know her personal Lord and Savior, the Lord Jesus Christ. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy supplies like silver and pay for repair for a jewelry-making machine

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE ETERNO”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria; tiene 27 años de edad y es soltera, ella estudio turismo en la universidad y paralelamente a ello ella se intereso desde muy chica en el arte, así que lo que un día fue un hobbie ahora es su principal fuente de ingreso económico.  La socia realiza manualidades y el dinero que está solicitando lo invertirá en un nuevo proyecto que para ella decirlo resulta riesgoso porque ella cree en que en secreto todo es mejor hasta que se vea tangible. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en un nuevo proyecto de arte.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y D. mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Maria, 27, is single. She majored in Tourism at the university but has also been very interested in art since she was a little girl; what was once a hobby has become her main source of income. She is a craftsperson and the money she is requesting will be invested in a new project which she says is risky to talk about because she feels that it’s best to keep it secret until it becomes tangible. She is asking for the loan to invest in this new art project. She is a member of the “PADRE ETERNO” (Eternal Father) communal bank located in Huanchac, Cusco province, Cusco department. She avails herself of this forum to express her gratitude for the loan as well as to commit to repaying in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in a new arts project.

loans.name: Marcelle Blanche

texts.fr:
Marcelle Blanche N. est une femme de 43ans célibataire et mère de deux enfants dont l’âge varie entre 14 et 22 . Elle débute son commerce de vente d’habit au marché avec un capital de 30000frs  en 1999, quand elle arrete ses etudes en  classe de 3e par manque de soutien.
Ses ventes  journalieres sont de 45000frs à 80000frs et a une forte clientele parcequ'elle vend des habits de marque et des sous vetements de qualite.
Avec ce prêt elle aimera acheter des robes pour enfants  et des sous-vêtements pour homme, femme et enfants pour renforcer son stock et satisfaire aux gouts varies de sa clientele.
Sa stratégie de vente est de réserver un bon accueil à ses clients et avoir un bon étalage qui attirrent les yeux et avoir des prix abordables.
Son ambition c’est d’être parmi la plus grande commerçante du marché specialisee en habits pour enfants et sous vetements de grande qualite. Pour ses enfants elle aimera qu’ils puissent avoir une bonne scolarisation les soutenir jusqu'a poursuivre des etudes universitaires.
Dans son quartier elle est encouragée pour ce qu’elle fait et a un bon temognage .
texts.en:
Marcelle Blanche N. is a 43 year-old woman, single and a mother of two children aged 22 and 14. She started her business selling clothes on the market with a capital of FRS300,000, after she left school in 9th grade due to a lack of support. Her daily sales vary between FRS45,000 and FRS80,000 and she has a solid client base because she sells brand name clothes and quality underwear. With this loan, she would like to purchase children's dresses, and underwear for men, women and children to rebuild her stock and cater to her clients' varying tastes. Her sales strategy is to give her customers a friendly welcome and to have a pleasant merchandise display that grabs the eye, and affordable prices. Her ambition is to become one of the main sellers on the market for children's clothes and high-quality underwear. She would like to make a good education possible for her children and support them all the way through university. In her neighborhood, she's encouraged in her endeavors and well-liked.

Translated from French by Charlotte Buecheler, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of underwear and children's dresses

loans.name: Marvin Geovanny

texts.es:
el sr. Marvin Geovanny E. N. tiene de 29 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Josefina del Carmen Baca Dominguez quien se dedica a atender la casa y a cuidar de su hija, ayudarle en sus estudios.
don Marvin vive en la aldea Corinto desde hace 9 años dedicandose al comercio, tiene su propia casa y su actividad es el servicio de moler maiz, muchas personas vienen todos los dias temprano a moler maiz, ahora esta el credito lo utilizara para la compra de unos repuestos para el mantenimiento del molino y para comprar los pescados y los camarones.
en su carro quiere salir a vender los mariscos, ya que el servicio de moler maiz es de las 5:00 am a 9:00 am.
se desplazara hasta el municipio de Langue Valle para realizar sus ventas.
Tiene como proyecto realizar el porton enfrente de su casa.
texts.en:
Señor Marvin Geovanny E. N. is 29 years old.   He is married to Señora Josefina del Carmen Baca Dominguez who stays at home to manage their household and care for their daughter and help her with her studies.  Don Marvin has been living in the Corinto community for 9 years where he owns his own house and runs his business milling corn.  Every day many people come early to mill corn.  

He will use the loan to buy parts to maintain his mill and also, to buy fish and shrimp.  He wants to use his car to drive around selling seafood since he only mills corn from 5:00 until 9:00 every morning.  He will travel to the town of Langue Valle to sell his products.  He would like install a gate in the front of his house.

loans.use: To purchase parts to maintain his mill and also to purchase fish and shrimp

loans.name: Ameeran's Group

texts.en:
Ameeran lives in a small city located in Punjab province of Pakistan called Jaranwala. She lives there in a 3 room brick house with her family. She is 52 year's old and operates a dairy business at her home. She has some buffalos at her home and gets milk from them to sell in her community.  This earns her a good income every month and she can easily manage the utilities expenses of her home. 

Her husband has a tailoring shop in the market and her son also works in that shop helping his father to complete the sewing orders on time. Her daughter is 16 years old, stays at home and helps with the household works. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her dairy business. With the loan, she will buy another buffalo to increase the milk production. This will help her serve more clients and increase her income. She has been doing this business for the last 10 years and is confident that her business will grow by investing money into it. 

Ameeran wants to marry her daughter soon and she is sure that the increased income will help her in making all the arrangements for her daughter’s marriage.  

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, Ameeran has built a good credit rating and has never missed any meeting.  

Note: “In the photo, the lady who has holds a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Ameeran”.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for her dairy business

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is widowed. She sells men’s shoes in Melitopol town. She started this business 17 years ago. Her husband died five years ago in a car accident. Since then Nataliya had to run their family business by herself. 

Nataliya was able to develop her business well and make it a stable source of income for her family. Today Nataliya rents a small store offering good quality shoes and  excellent customer service. Nataliya has opened a second location recently. 

Nataliya is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnas to increase the assortment of shoes at the second location. Nataliya lives with her son and helps him pay for his college.

loans.use: to increase the assortment of shoes she has to sell

loans.name: Francisca Sugey

texts.es:
la señora Francisca Sugey García tiene 31 años de edad, es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar.
Francisca es madre de tres hijos que depènden de ella y el papa les ayuda pero pero no vive con ellos, doña Francisca le a tocado dificil ser padre y madre a la vez pero con su valentia a podido salir adelante, ademas los fines de semana y por las noches se dedica a cortar pelo, arregla uñas, aplicar tintes y demas cosas que necesita una mujer para lucir bella.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria, granos basicos y refrescos para vender un poco mas y
lograr de esa manera mas utilidades,  sus clientes la prefieren a por su carisma, atencion y amabilidad con que trata a las personas.
 
su deseo es encontrase un buen hombre que la haga feliz a ella y a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Francisca Sugey García is 31 years old. She is a single mother and sells family grocery basket products.  

Francisca is a mother of three children who depend on her. Their father helps them but does not live with them. It has been difficult for Francisca to be both mother and father at the same time, but with her courage she has been able to get ahead. On weekends and eveneings she cuts hair, does nails, dyes hair, and other things that a woman needs to look pretty.  
 
She will use the loan to buy groceries, basic grains and beverages to sell a little more and make more profit. Her customers prefer her because of her charisma, her service and the friendliness she treats people with. 
 
She wants to find a good man who will make her and her children happy.

loans.use: To buy sugar, coffee, beans, rice, lard, oil, eggs, pasta, margarine, soup, tooth paste, toilet paper, sanitary napkins, candles, matches, pills, bug spray, batteries, beverages, and churros.

loans.name: Toan

texts.en: Toan T. N. is 33 years old and married with two children. They live in Luc Canh, Dong Anh, Ha Noi. She has a small shop in the market selling rice. She has had this job for many years. Her monthly income is about 3,000,0000 dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008 and repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,194,000 VND to buy more rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy more rice to sell

loans.name: Altynai's Group

texts.en:
Altynai T., 44, is the leader of this group. She is married, and together with her spouse grows and gives proper upbringing to three children; all of them are at school.

The family makes their livelihood by having different jobs. The head of the family is a driver, concurrently he is engaged in coal selling. Altynai with the help of her son runs her own business: she sells detergents in the local market. She has been doing it for 6 years. Her profits have made it possible to purchase a car. 

In order to develop the business and to increase the variety of goods she sells, Altynai wants to purchase new goods, for this purpose she needs to get a loan. Next year she plans to help her elder son to enter university, then to arrange his marriage.

 	--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase more detergents for sale.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret N. is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school. Margret has a business selling shoes, which she has run for four years. She also sells charcoal.
To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase charcoal and shoes. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Margret hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself. In the future, she hopes to expand her business further. Margret is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future and taught her new games.

loans.use: To purchase shoes and charcoal for resale

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie S. S. is from the village of Kapatagan, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosalie sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Rosalie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Victoria Kasaya

texts.en:
Victoria Kasaya A. is a widow, 48 years old, and the mother of five children. They live in Matunda on the outskirts of Eldoret town. She does horticulture farming and at the same time she sells cereals. She has been in these businesses for eleven years now and gets a monthly income of about $112.

This will be Victoria's 5th loan with KADET LTD. She has repaid all other loans successfully. With this loan, she plans to boost her horticulture business, and she will also use some of the money to buy cereals for resale. 

In the future she wants to educate her children to higher levels of education and also to become a better supplier of cereals in her area.

loans.use: To buy cereals like maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” ubicado en el distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao y departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,  tiene 05 hijos (3 independientes), sólo estudio hasta 2º de primaria. 
Viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace un año y medio, su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, lo invirtió en su negocio de compra y venta de animales.
Con éste préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, comprará una oveja, chancho y una vaquita.  Paralelamente la señora realiza tejidos como chompas y pantalones.
Trabaja junto con su esposo en la chacra sembrando papa, quinua, habas y cebada. 
Su sueño es tener más chanchos porque dice que es mejor venderlos, se obtiene más ganancia.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal son las reuniones porque intercambian palabras con las socias.
texts.en:
Olga, 48, is a member of the “Las Kantutitas de Camicachi II” communal bank located in Ilave district, el Collao province, Puno department.  She has a live-in partner and five children (five independent); she only finished second grade.

She’s been collaborating with the Manuela Ramos Movement for a year and a half.  She used her first, 300 new sol, loan to invest in her livestock raising business.

She will use this 1500 new sol loan to buy a lamb, a pig and a little cow.  As a parallel occupation she also weaves sweaters and pants.

She works alongside her husband in the fields farming potato, quinoa, lima beans and barley.

What she likes about the communal bank is the meetings because the members exchange words.

loans.use: She will buy a lamb, a pig and a little cow.

loans.name: Baby Jane

texts.en:
Baby Jane B. is from the village of Villaramos. She is 33 years old, married, and has seven school-aged children.

Baby Jane owns and operates a general store, selling different kinds of products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Baby Jane joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials for store renovation.

Baby Jane is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 3rd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 55 years old and is a married woman. She lives with her family in the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato.

Evelyn and her husband are both farmers. They primarily plant and harvest rice crops. Evelyn rents a stall in the market to sell their harvest. Evelyn also grows pigs in their backyard. The pigs are for fattening and sale.

Evelyn requested a loan of 15000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which she will use to to purchase pig feed, seeds and other farm inputs. Evelyn wishes for their harvest to increase.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is a 57-year-old married woman with 5 children, whose ages range from 21 to 28 years old. Juana is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She has been growing rice for 15 years and usually earns about 10,000 PHP from it. She has requested a loan that she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Juana works hard to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Blanca Isvelia

texts.es: Blanca F. P., es una mujer muy trabajadora que vive  en Carrizal, un barrio al sur de Barranquilla de gente trabajadora alegre y dinámica,  donde la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo tiene una gran acogida;  allí también funciona su  negocio de vender suero al por mayor,  producto elaborado a base de leche, con el cual ha logrado generar ingresos para el mejoramiento de su familia, conformada por ella y sus tres hijos ya en las edades de 22 a 30 años. Ella tiene clientes en la ciudad y los distribuye  en compañía de otras personas pero fracasaron en esta actividad mientras Blanca Isvelia salió adelante y aun la sostiene, en ella creyeron sus proveedores y fueron ellos  quienes principalmente la apoyaron para sostenerlo en la primera etapa; Con su negocio ha logrado  la educación de sus hijos  y la adquisición de su vivienda, ella en sus tiempos libres trabaja en un almacén ubicado cerca a su vivienda y con ello genera otros ingresos para su hogar; este es su segundo financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el primero   logró  mayor tranquilidad al poder comprar de contado y con menos afanes; su sueño es ahora  adquirir un local, porque el que actualmente tiene está ubicado en su vivienda y ocupa mucho espacio de ella. Mientras tanto Blanca continua trabajando con utilidades promedias sobre las ventas  de un 30% , que quiere seguir incrementando en la medida en que más rote su cartera.Con la aplicación de su credikiva comprará suero en mayor cantidad, porque se han incrementado sus clientes e incursionará en otros sectores donde ya tiene solicitud.
texts.en:
Blanca F. P. is a hardworking woman who lives in Carrizal, a neighborhood in southern Barranquilla full of working class people who are cheerful and dynamic. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo also has a great reception in this area. Blanca has a wholesale business selling powdered whey (a nutritional product made from milk) that has enabled her to generate income to support her family that consists of herself and three children who range in age from 22 to 30. She has customers all over the city and started distributing her products with other people who failed in this same type of business. However, Blanca has been able to succeed and maintain her business. Her suppliers trusted her and were the ones responsible for supporting her during the early stages of her business. Through her business, Blanca has been able to provide her children with an education and acquire a home.

This is her second loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her first loan provided greater peace of mind because she was able to buy inventory with cash and without any hassles. Now her dream is to acquire a storefront because she currently works at home and her business is taking up much space. Meanwhile, Blanca continues to work and generate an average of 30% profit from her sales. She wants to increase her margins by shortening her product turnover period. With this Kiva loan, Blanca will purchase powdered whey in large quantities so that she can increase her customer base and expand to other areas that are requesting her product.

loans.use: to purchase powdered whey in bulk.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth C. is 29 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him with the farm. They grow rice crops to sell.  Lilibeth manages a small backyard piggery. She grows pigs for fattening and sells them to the market.  She also runs their sari-sari store where she sells items like canned goods and soap. Lilibeth is requesting a loan for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers, and additional items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles.  In the future, Lilibeth hopes for her children to be successful.

loans.use: to purchase pig feeds, fertilizers and additional items to sell such as soft drinks and noodles

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 39 years old, single, and lives with one family member.

Wafaa has been a tailor since 2009. She makes or repairs women’s clothing. She has a good experience and a good reputation and she is becoming well known in her area.

She is requesting $1500 to buy two sewing machines. She is aiming to gain more profits so she can improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two sewing machines.

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El comite tiene por nombre "Rosa Mistica" en honor a la virgen Maria, quien es la santa patrona de este grupo.
Todas las integrantes son mujeres muy sacrificadas que desean prosperar cada día junto con sus familias, y asi poder obtener una mejor calidad de vida que les ayude a vivir dignamente.
La sra. Guillermina es una de las integrantes más activas del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas en un puesto que posee de manera alquilada, porque no puede conseguir su propio local.
Se dedica a este tipo de comercio pues le ha ayudado bastante en el sostenimiento economico de su familia y la fruta es un producto de consumo diario, por eso sus clientes van aumentando en cantidad.
El desafío que tiene ultimamente es que no puede abastecer la demanda de sus clientes, por eso solicita el credito, para poder comprar frutas a mayores escalas cuantitativas y poder venderlos a la clientela que suministra.
texts.en:
The committe named, "Rosa Mistica" (Mystic Rose), in honor of the virgen Mary who is the patron saint of the group.  All of the members are women who have had to give up a lot but wish to get ahead alongside their families and have a better quality of life that can allow them to live with dignity.  Guillermina is one of the most active members of the group; she sells fruits at a rented location because she has been unable to obtain her own spot.
She dedicates herself to this business since it has helped her economically support her family.  Fruit is a product of daily consumption which is why her customer base is increasing.  Her current challenge is that she has not been able to fulfill her client's demand which is why she is requesting the loan, in order to purchase fruit in greater quantities and sell them to the customers she supplies.

loans.use: to purchase citric fruits for resell ( grapefruit, oranjes, lemons, mandarines, etc)

loans.name: Okello

texts.en:
Okello is 45 years old. He is married and has five children, four of whom are currently in school. Okello has a hardware shop, which he has run for five years.
To help expand his business, Okello has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more hardware materials for resale. With the help of his loan from BRAC, Okello hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. In the future, he hopes to expand his business into a bigger shop.

loans.use: to purchase more hardware materials for resale.

loans.name: Pascuala

texts.es:
La señora Pascuala del Carmen es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora, humilde y entusiasta de 55 años quien desde los 16 años se dedica a la venta de manera ambulante frutas y bebidas típicas como pinolillo, pinol, pozol…etc.  
Este negocio es familiar ella trabaja con su madre y hermano e invertirá el crédito en semilla de jícaro, maíz, cacao, leña…etc.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pascuala del Carmen is a hardworking, enterprising, humble and enthusiastic woman. She is 55 years old. Since she was 16 she has been selling fruit and traditional drinks such as pinolillo (a cornmeal and cocoa drink), pinol (a ground corn, cocoa and spice drink), pozol (a  hot cornmeal drink), etc. She is a roving salesperson.
This is a family business. She works with her mother and brother. She will use the loan to buy jicaro seed (a local variety of tree), corn, cocoa, wood, etc.

loans.use: to buy jicaro seed, corn, cocoa, firewood, etc.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is a forty-three-year-old married woman with three children. She owns a house in Kasese, Uganda.

Theresa has been in the poultry business for a year. This has enabled her to provide for basic needs for her family. Her challenge is expensive chicken feed.

Theresa needs a loan to pay for her children’s school fees. Her vision is to have a flock of at least 1,000 chickens and to buy more land.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s school fees.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel Antonio es un hombre trabajor, con deseo de superacion para el bienestar de su familia. su negocio es una pulperia en donde tambien, ha invertido en verduras para aumentar su capital, beneficiandose con las ganancias, el cual son para pagos basicos de agua, luz, estudios para sus hijos.
Ha tenido muchas dificultades, una grande es la muerte de mi bebe reciennacida, el robo de su caballo que era su medio de transporte. Su familia esta logrando el equilibrio emocional y economico, asi como poder dar buena atencion  a los clientes siendo su medio de subsistir con su pequeño negocio.
Don Manuel es atraves de los pretamos en Afodenic que se ah ayudado, para aumentar sus de productos, en estos cinco ciclos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara granos basicos en quintal de arroz, azucar, maiz, frijoles, bidon de aceite, caja de jabon, papel higienico, sopas marucha, sopa maggi, ase, golosinas, gaseosas. Con el objetivo de poder mantener su clientela al ofertar una variedad de productos, siendo los de mayor consumo.
texts.en:
Manuel Antonio is a hard working man with a strong drive to improve his family’s wellbeing.  His business is a grocery store where he’s also invested in vegetables to increase capital benefitting from the profits which are used to cover basic payments like water, electricity and his children’s schooling.

He has had many difficulties a huge one being the death of his newborn daughter and the theft of a horse that was his means of transportation.  His family is reaching emotional and economic stability as well as being able to provide good service to customers since this small business is their means of support.

Manuel has helped himself to increase products through five cycles of Afodenic loans.  He will use this new loan to buy basic grains by the quintal: rice, sugar, corn and beans and large jugs of oil, a case of soap, toilet paper, Maruchan soups, Maggi soups, Ace, snacks and soft drinks with the goal in mind of keeping his clientele by offering a variety of products which are most consumed.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, snacks and soft drinks.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine, a 44-year-old widow with three school-going children, is a tailor who also sells clothing materials to her clients. Now applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more materials to add to her stock, she hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: El Edén Group

texts.es:
El Comité El Edén, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Silvina, actualmente cuenta con 10 mujeres, se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres. Ellas se reúnen con el propósito de constituirse en un comité que no solo las haga crecen económicamente, sino también como personas. Todas han demostrado unión y solidaridad las unas con las otras.
Todas ellas son mujeres, muy sacrificadas, cuentan con escasos recursos. Participan  de las ferias organizadas por Fundación Paraguaya, en donde comercializan sus productos para para seguir aumentando sus ingresos.
La señora Maria tiene un copetín (establecimiento de venta de comidas rápidas), se dedica a esto hace un tiempo. Comenta que los alimentos que elabora son muy solicitados, ya que tiene muy buena sazón. Uno de sus sueños es poder tener un restaurante donde pueda seguir con la produccion y venta de alimentos. Con lo que respecta a los clientes, dice que tiene muy buena clientela en su barrio y zonas aledañas.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de los insumos necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos, como ser carnes, condimentos, panificados, hortalizas y demás.
texts.en:
The "El Edén" committee was formed on the initiative of Señora Silvina, and currently has 10 women.  They are in their first lending cycle as part of the women's program.  They meet with the goal of becoming a commitee that does not just create growth for them economically, but also as people.  All of them have demonstrated unity and solidarity with each other.

They are all women and all very self-sacrificing with limited means.  They participate in the parties organized by Fundación Paraguaya, where they sell their products so as to be able to continue growing their incomes.

Señora Maria has a "copetín", (an establishment selling fast food), where she has worked for a while.  She comments that the food she makes is much in demand, as it tastes really good.  One of her dreams is to be able to have a restaurant where she can continue with the production and selling of food.  With regard to her customers, she says that she has a very good customer base from her neighborhood and the surrounding areas.

She is requesting the loan for the purchase of necessary supplies for making her food, such as meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and other items.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, baked goods, vegetables and other items

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita's dream is to educate her two children, for it is the only treasure she can give to them. She did not pursue her studies due to lack of financial support. At 46 years old, she continuously manages their rice farming business with the help of her husband. They want to increase their yields and income so they can support the education of their children and acquire their daily basic needs.

To generate additional income, Lita is engaged in a hog-raising business in their village. She is asking for additional capital of PHP 12,000 to buy feed and vitamins for her hog-raising business. She mentioned that she needs to work hard and strive harder to make her business grow. She is hoping that in the future, their children will finish their studies and her business will become viable and profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her hogs

loans.name: Dabo 02 Group

texts.fr:
Créer le 12 Juillet 2008 le groupe Dabo 02 a plus de cinq cycles dans le programme des bancs villageois de CAURIE-MF. Il  est composé de 21 femmes qui vivent dans le même village. Elles ont comme activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Chérif  (debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de trois  enfants. 

Elle est vendeuse de patte d’arachide et d’huile de palme au marché hebdomadaire de sa localité, activité qu’elle pratique depuis plus de cinq ans. 

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter de la patte d’arachide pour la revente.

Les profits tirés de son activité l’aiderons à acheter de chèvres ou moutons en parti et d’autre part soutenir son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
Dabo 2 Group was established on July 12, 2008 and has been through five loan cycles with the banc villageois program. It is made up of 21 women who live in the same village. It's main business is small-scale trade.

Mrs. Chérif (standing on the far right in the picture) is the group leader. She's 31 years old, married, and the mother of three children. For more than five years, she's been selling peanut paste and palm oil at the market in her town, a business has run for the past 5 years.

Her new loan will enable her to buy peanut paste for resale. The profits derived from her business will help her in part to buy goats and sheep, and in part to support her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy peanut paste for resale

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Gerlemaa is 39 years old and lives with her husband and two children, ages 10 and 19, in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, which is located in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia, in an outer ger district without basic infrastructure. Her daughter is a student at the state university, and her son attends secondary school.

Gerelmaa supports her family by operating two clothing retail stalls at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia, with the help of her spouse. She started her business in 2000, specializing in the sale of women's clothes. Today her working capital is three million Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 
 
She worked very hard the last few years, and she bought a small land plot and a car through the profit from her business. Consequently, she needs to increase her working capital and import more clothes to sell. So Gerelmaa is requesting a two-million-MNT loan to import more clothes from Ereen, a border city between Mongolia and China. With her business income, she is planning to pay her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell in order to increase her income

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en:
Apollo is a Ugandan man, age 30, who needs a loan to buy sugar for resale. He hails from Kyenjojo district and is a father of three children between 6 months and 10 years old. 

Apollo has been running a retail shop business for five years, despite challenges of price fluctuation. His dreams are to own a wholesale business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy sugar for resale.

loans.name: Hilario

texts.en: Hilario is 45 years old. He is married and has three children. Hilario has a shop in which he sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for 25,000 PHP to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages, as well as to develop his grocery store. Hilario has been a member of HSPFI since 1997. In the future, Hilario hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Fathiya

texts.en: Fathiya, a 46-year-old housewife and mother of 6 sons and daughters, helps some of the working mothers by taking care of their kids for a few hours during the day and is paid for it.  She also has a few sheep and goats to raise with her husband who has a farm of grain and animal food. What they do is raise and feed the sheep and goats for sale. Now Fathiya has applied for a loan to buy more sheep. Because Fathiya is a conservative person, she asked her son Naser to appear in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more sheep

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en:
Clementine has four children aged 7 to 21. She has been a maize farmer for 35 years. 

Clementine is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides to grow her crop. She will use the loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during maize production. With profits from her farming, Clementine will invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a fast food cart and items such as bread, meats and sauces

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi lives in the Coastal town of Likoni, Kenya. He is married and has three children. Hamisi operates a retail shop that has been open for four years. He began the business from buying and selling the products to the nearby markets from which he was able to raise capital.

Hamisi learned of Milango from his friends and joined in order to access credit. He is applying for a loan of Ksh 20,000 to buy some cereal products for resale. He plans to increase his operations and reach the level of a wholesale trader in the future. 

From the income obtained, he will be able to buy sugar and other retail stock that is scarce and expensive.

loans.use: To buy some cereal products for resale.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es: Sofía, de 51 años es una mujer muy dedicada. Vive en compañía de Daniel, su esposo desde hace 30 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero vive solo con Gisela, en su casa propia, ubicada en el anexo de Churampi. Su principal objetivo en estos momentos es solventar los gastos económicos de los estudios de “Chef” de su hija. Por ello todas las mañanas se dirige muy temprano a sus sembríos de papa, maíz y alverja, Los cuales vende en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde viaja en cada cosecha. Pero como buena mujer del campo, también se dedica a la crianza de animales, cuenta con 7 vacas, 50 ovejas y un burro que le sirve de carga. Menciona que gracias a la leche que le proporcionan sus vacas logra hacer varios moldes de queso. Los que vende a los comerciantes que visitan su zona constantemente. Además hace poco comenzó a vender comida a los obreros que trabajan en la construcción de la carretera. Con todos estos ingresos extras, puede vivir con tranquilidad y alegría. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “nueva generación” y este es el tercer crédito con MFP, por lo que se siente desarrollada, ya que recibirá la ayuda económica que necesita para lograr sus objetivos. Por ello promete ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Sofía de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra de papa.
texts.en:
Sofia, 51, is a dedicated woman. She has lived with her husband, Daniel, for 30 years, They have three children, but only Gisela lives with her in her own home located in the settlement of Churampi. Her principal objective at present is to pay the costs of her daughter’s studies to become a chef. This is the reason she goes very early every morning to her fields of potato, corn and green peas, which she sells in the city of Huancayo where she travels at each harvest. However, as a good country woman, she also raises animals and has 7 cows, 50 sheep and a burro she uses as a pack animal. She mentions that, thanks to the milk that her cows provide, she has made various cheese molds, which she sells to the merchants who constantly visit the area. As well, a short while ago she stated selling food to the highway construction workers. With all of this extra income, she is able to live happily and peacefully.

Sofía belongs to the Nueva Generación communal bank and this is her third loan with MFP. Consequently, she feels empowered since she will receive the economic help she needs to meet her goals. Thus, she promises to be punctual in making her payments. Upon receiving your support, Sofía will invest the money in the purchase of natural fertilizer for her next planting of potatoes.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge Luis tiene 49 años de edad es casado tiene 6 hijos, vive con la esposa y con los hijos de 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 11 años de edad en San Miguel Provincia de Bolívar.

La VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico tiene el nombre de la Comunidad,  se encuentra a 20 minutos del Cantón San Miguel y se dedican a la agricultura como fuente de ingresos de la familia.

Jorge se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, trigo, cebada y papas como fuente de ingresos de la familia.
Las compras lo hace en San Miguel y las ventas lo hace a cualquier comerciante.

Solicita el crédito para la agricultura y comprar  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, urea, líquidos. Con la ayuda del crédito ha podido comprar los abonos sin ningún problema.

 El sueño es poder comprar terrenos para sembrar y tener una casa para poder vivir con la familia.
Los desafíos a los que se ha enfrentado es en las temporadas de año que existe variedad del clima y esto produce la lancha a los cultivos y por eso se dañan.
En el tiempo libre le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del Divino Niño.
texts.en:
Jorge Luis is 49 years old, married, and has 6 children.  He lives with his wife and his children ages 23, 21, 19, 17, 15 and 11 in the province of San Miguel de Bolívar.

The VRC SE LLAMA Yagui Chico, having the name of the community, is found 20 minutes from the canton of San Miguel and they work in agriculture as the source of family income.

Jorge works in agriculture, planting corn, wheat, barley, and potatos as the source of income for his family.  He makes his purchases in San Miguel and his sales in various markets.

He is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and solutions for agriculture.  With the aid of the loan, he has been able to purchase the compost without any problems.

His dream is to be able to purchase fields to plant and to have a house so he can live with his family.

The challenges that he has faced come in the seasons of the year when the weather varies and this produces the late blight, thus damaging the crops.

In his free time, he enjoys the festivals of the Divine Child.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, urea, and other solutions used for farming.

loans.name: Maame Araba

texts.en: Maame Araba sells footware (sandals) and materials at Nkrontrodo, near Elmina. Maame is a single parent and has 4 children. As a single parent, she uses her income to clothe and feed her children, and to pay their school fees. Maame will use her loan to purchase sandals and materials for sale. With the new profit, Maame will acquire a shop for the sale of her goods.

loans.use: To purchase more footware (sandals) and materials for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new electric sewing machine.

loans.name: Bun

texts.en:
Bun is aged 44 years and married with five children. She lives in a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Kampong Siem district earning a living through farming rice and growing bean. Together, she and her husband can earn about KHRUS$25 per day from the current business and can save about US$12 each day for the future needs.
Bun has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. As the leader, she is going to buy fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend for labor. She hopes to make more rice and sell it for a good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and use a portion of it to spend for labor

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Jesukpego 1 Group

texts.fr: JESUKPEGO 1 est un groupe composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Titilayo Ariane (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 26 ans. Ariane a arrêté l'école au niveau primaire. Titilayo Ariane est mariée à un certain Thiburce. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Titilayo Ariane et son mari. Pour cette raison, Titilayo Ariane vend des sacs dame dans une région du Bénin depuis sept ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Titilayo Ariane s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Titilayo Ariane sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe JESUKPEGO 1, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des sacs.

loans.name: Tunas Mekar Group

texts.en:
Serofina (40), who is standing in the middle in this line, is the leader of Tunas Mekar Group. She has 4 members and all of them have run small scale businesses such as selling vegetables,selling petrol, kiosks etc. They were formed this group few weeks ago and  requested loan from Kiva through TLM of IDR 8,750,000 for their business expansion. For Serofina, this loan support would be very useful for her in adding more stocks of vegetable she sells such as water spinach, eggplant, tomatoes, chilies,carrots, cucumber,etc. Similar to Serofina, her 4 member would also get chance to increase the things that they sell. 

Serofina comes from a low-family income. She is married to Daniel who is a 46 year old man farmer. From her 4 children, two have graduated from Senior high school, while 2 are still attending school. By improving her business income, she would help her husband to deal with house holds expenses including schooling fees of their children.

loans.use: to add more vegetable stocks  such as water spinach, eggplant, tomatoes, chilies,carrots, cucumber,etc.

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.en:
Kokouvi A. was born in 1980 in Kouvé (Yoto prefecture). He is a very devoted and intelligent young man. Born of polygamy, where the women and their children are left to fend for themselves, he left school to start a business selling tomatoes at the marketplace. Two years later with a developed business, he got married and had two children, plus he is the guardian of one other child. His wife helps him at work. With an initial loan, which he has repaid, he was able to expand his business a little.

Today, Mr. A. would like to become a wholesaler. To do this, he is requesting a loan of $850 to stock up on and to sell other produce from farming villages, in addition to tomatoes. The produce will include red and green peppers, eggplant, and onions. He will thus be able to increase his income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Monsieur A. Kokouvi est né en 1980 à Kouvé dans la préfecture de Yoto. C’est un jeune homme très dévoué et très intelligent. Issu d’une famille polygame où les femmes sont laissées à elles mêmes avec leurs enfants, il abandonna ses études et se lance dans le commerce des tomates au marché. Deux ans après, vu l’évolution de son activité, il s’est marié et père de deux (02) enfants et un (01) autre enfant à charge. Sa femme l’aide dans son activité. Avec un premier crédit qui a été bien soldé, il a pu augmenter un peu la taille de son commerce.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur A. veut devenir grossiste et pour cela il sollicite un crédit de $850 pour aller s’approvisionner dans les villages de production et ajouter à la vente de tomate d’autres condiments comme piments rouges et verts, aubergines, oignons etc. Ainsi il pourra accroître son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To sell grocery produce items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Ruth would like to buy variety of beans and wheat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Add stock of shoes and bags

loans.name: Okoduwa

texts.en: Mr. G. Okoduwa is 31 years old and married with one child.  He is an industrious man who has a shop where he sells leather boxes, shoes and bags to the public.  He needs the loan for business expansion and has been in this business since 2001.

loans.use: To buy leather boxes, shoes and bags for resale

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is on her fifth loan from Esperanza. She sells chickens to entrepreneurs like herself for their businesses. People from nearby communities come to Maria to buy her chickens, and they in turn sell them in their own communities. Maria estimates that she sells an average of 300-400 pesos' worth of chicken in a day (US$ 9-12). She has three staff: her husband, herself, and her son are in charge of running the business each day. She supports six people in her household on a daily basis—herself, her husband, her son, and her 3 grandsons.

NOTE: This is a group loan. The $1,200 will fund Maria's business plus 4 others in her community. She and four other entrepreneurs have formed a solidarity group that received business training from Esperanza and guarantee each other's loan repayment. This group-lending methodology fosters accountability among the members because they all must pay in full and on time.

Maria is very thankful for the loans from Esperanza and hopes to continue taking them out as long as she can. Before she had her loans, she had to depend on her husband’s earnings, which were not stable. She is now very proud that she maintains a constant source of income, and that she has been able to expand her business with each loan. Just this week she bought a pig for 8,000 RD pesos (about US$ 240) with savings from her and her husband’s income—without the loans they would never have had the savings to invest in a pig. She hopes one day to build a home out of concrete blocks, and a cement roof; her house right now is made from wood with a corrugated zinc roof; she worries that if a hurricane comes her house will be destroyed.

Maria is a savvy micro-entrepeneur. She explains that with the income she earns from the loans, she is careful to both save and re-invest her money. Buying a pig with her savings will allow her to earn more money in the next year from the pork she is able to sell. Once she begins to earn more money from her pig, she will begin saving so that she can build a better and safer house for her family. Maria is most thankful that she has had the blessing of these loans and is grateful that she is being given the opportunity to take out another one.

loans.use: Purchase chickens for resale

loans.name: Mwanamtama

texts.en:
MWANAMTAMA is 54 years old and opened the “Killy Shop” (named after her son) in 2002. This business currently brings in about $150-170 a month.

In 2005, the shop burnt down due to an electrical short. After this tragedy, a loan was taken out to rebuild the shop and to restock its inventory. Fortunately, only the shop was burnt during the fire, although it is connected to the front of their home.

Mwanamtama lives with her husband and with six children – three of their own and three orphaned relatives. They have three other children as well, who have grown and are now independent. Their house assistant and shopkeeper, whom they pay about $18 a month each, also live with them. The husband works in a hotel.

In hopes of receiving a second loan, Mwanamtama would like to buy a refrigerator for the shop and to start selling wholesale eggs in a new location. She belongs to the group "Giraffe," which consists of 27 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and buy eggs

loans.name: Yati

texts.en: Yati is 35 years old. Before joining MBK, her husband, A., was the only person who worked in the family. But since joining MBK, she started her own business making handicraft at her house. She usually earns US $22 per month. She requests a loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Raka

texts.en:
Raka is married and has a child.

He has been running his business for 15 years, even during the war, but at a very small scale. With his previous loans from SMT, he diversified the business. He sells clothes and sandals for men, women and children. With the profit, he is able to improve his living standard and send his child to school. Raka’s customers demand new fashion in their clothes and he is therefore requesting for a loan to meet his customers demands and expand his stock.

loans.use: He would like to diversify his stock by adding in some of the latest fashions demanded by his customers.

loans.name: Yat

texts.en: Yat Y. is 25 years old, married, and the mother of two children. She and her husband (in the photo here) own a plot of land. Together they grow a variety of vegetables, and earn a total of $2 a day. Her husband, Ry Cha, is 33 years old and supplements the family profit by collecting recycled items from the community, earning a total of $5 a day. The couple would like a loan of $500 to increase the variety of vegetables and crops on Yat’s farmland, and use the rest of the money to support the family.

loans.use: Use this loan to purchase yam seed and keep as a capital to purchase recycle items.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es:
Maricela lives on the Panamerican avenue in the Mariscal Sucre zone of the city of El Alto.

She lives with her two children, 10 and 6 years old, and with her husband who works as a taxi driver.

She sells food from a small restaurant located in her home.

She would use her loan to buy ingredients at wholesale prices, in that manner reducing her expenses and purchase her supplies at better prices. Her hopes are to avoid the inflationary trends in the country.

This is her first loan with IMPRO, and the financial analysis conducted shows she qualifies for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Marcela vive en la avenida Panamerican de la zona Mariscal Sucre ubicada en la ciudad de El Alto. Vive junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 6 años respectivamente y su esposo trabaja como chofer de taxi . Ella vende comida en una pensión que se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio. El crédito lo destinara en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor, y así reducir sus gastos y abastecerse comprando a buenos precios, tratando de evitar el proceso inflacionario que vive el país. Es el primer crédito con Impro y la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase supplies at wholesale for restaurant.

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.ru:
Mamlakat M. lives in the Rudaki region with her family. She is married and has two children. She is 45 years old and has a specialized secondary education. She finished a medical school, but is earning money by sewing national Tajik dresses and selling them. She has been in this business for about ten years. She buys fabrics, sews dresses and sells them on the market "Kovron" in the city of Dushanbe. Her daughter is helping her with the business and they sew clothing together. Mamlakat wants to increase the selection of fabrics and needs a loan. It will help increase her commodity turnover and income for her family. She will pay off the loan within 9 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Махмудова Мамлакат проживает в районе Рудаки. Живет со своей семьей. Она замужем и у нее двое детей.Ей 45 лет. Мамлакат имеет средне-специальное образование .Закунчила она медицинское училище. Но зарабатывает деньги, шитьем национальных платьев и их реализацией.Занимается этим видом бизнеса около10 лет. Она закупает материал , шьет платья и продает на рынке « Корвон» города Душанбе.В ее бизнесе ей помогает ее дочь. Они вместе шьют одежду. Сейчас Мамлакат хочет увеличить ассортимент материала, поэтому хочет получить кредит. Он поможет ей увеличить товарооборот и доход семьи. А погасить кредит сможет втечении 9 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy new fabrics

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is 58 years old, married, and has 8 children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria, and earns income selling provisions and foodstuffs. Florence learnt this trade from her friends, and currently needs a loan of US$875 to buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale. She will be very glad to have the loan, as it will boost her sales and thereby help her family. Florence is thankful to Kiva and the lenders.

loans.use: Purchase of provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en: Joyce A. sells second-hand clothing. She is married, but her husband's income from his job at the Elmina Courthouse is not sufficient for Joyce and her 3 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits. She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: As additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled, 42 years old, is married with 3 children and lives in the North of Lebanon. Khaled owns a shop for gadgets and accessories.  He needs an amount of USD 1,200 to purchase more goods and diversify his inventory. He wants to expand his business in order to guarantee a better livelihood to his family. Khaled has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 5 years and always repaid his debts on time.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to diversify business inventory

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. sells fabric and clothing. She is a single parent and her income is not sufficient for Aba and her 2 children. Demand for her goods is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.
She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Braima

texts.en: Braima A. is a fisherman and a trader at Abrobiano in Elmina. Braima has received no formal education. He is married and has 8 children. His wife is a trader. Braima has been a fisherman and a trader since 2006. He is responsible for paying utility bills and school fees. His loan will be used to buy fishing nets and fishing materials. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to build a family house.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and fishing materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more inventory and expand his shop

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary E. sells food products, drinks and other household provisions in front of her house. She also sells firewood. Mary is 45-years-old, married and has five children. (Standing with her in the picture are her children.)

She is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for resale. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food products, drinks and household provisions for resale

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es: El señor Luís Alfonso R. tiene la edad de 44 años habita en San José Los Ríos, junto a su esposa  Y hijos, la esposa le apoya con los gastos del hogar ya que ella es comerciante tiene un puesto de venta en mercado oriental en la capital de Managua, don Luís trabaja en la agricultura desde hace Veinte años, el mayor problema que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, don Luís cultivas esas tierras ya que su papá se las heredo; sus planes hacia un futuro es logra establecer mas cultivos para poder ayudarles a sus hijas hacer su casa.  Con la solicitud del préstamo es para invertir en el cultivo Para establecer  manzana y media de cultivo de piña, para obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Señor Luís Alfonso R. is 44 years of age and lives in San José Los Ríos with his wife and children. His wife helps support him in the household expenses now that she is a merchant with a stall in the oriental market in the capital of Managua. Don Luís has worked in agriculture for 20 years. The biggest problem he has is a lack of funding. Don Luís cultivates the lands that he inherited from his father. His plans for the future are to succeed in establishing more farmland to be able to help his daughters build homes. He requests this loan to invest in farming to establish acreage and a means of growing pineapple to make better income.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Purchase Materials like Fertilizers and Poisons for Farming

loans.name: Rosas De Los Andes Group

texts.es: LAS SOCIAS DEL GRUPO "ROSAS D. LOS ANDES" ESTÁN REPRESENTADOS POR LA SEÑORA LOURDES Y COMPUESTA D. 13 MIEMBROS D. LOS CUALES DOS SON VARONES Y EL RESTO MUJERES TRABAJADORAS Y EMPRENDEDORAS ES D. AHÍ EL NOMBRE. LOS SOCIOS (AS) SON GENTE HUMILD. PERO CON MUCHOS DESEOS D. PROGRESAR TRABAJANDO EN SUS PUESTOS D. VENTA D. PRODUCTOS COMO LA COMIDA, RELOJES, ROPA, ZAPATOS, FRUTAS, MOCHILAS Y MANTAS TEJIDAS. EXISTE BASTANTE COMPETENCIA EN EL MERCADO SIN EMBARGO ELLAS SE VALEN D. LA EXPERIENCIA Y D. LA RAPIDEZ QUE TIENEN PARA CAMBIAR SU MERCADERÍA, SIEMPRE ESTÁN D. ACUERDO AL COMPORTAMIENTO DEL MERCADO Y D. ACUERDO A LA ÉPOCA, PERO LAMENTABLEMENTE ALGUNAS SOCIAS NO LOGRA ENTRAR DENTRO D. ESTA RENOVACIÓN Y ES LA CAUSA PRINCIPAL PARA UN INCUMPLIMIENTO A SU PLAN D. PAGOS, PERO SUS COMPAÑEROS D. GRUPO SIEMPRE ESTÁN PARA DARLES UNA MANO Y EVITAR CUALQUIER CAÍDA D. LOS MIEMBROS D. SU GRUPO COMPUESTO EN SU MAYORÍA POR AMIGOS D. MUCHOS AÑOS ATRÁS. EL DESTINO DEL FINANCIAMIENTO ES PARA EL INCREMENTO D. MERCADERÍA E INSUMOS PARA ATENDER LA DEMANDA DEL MERCADO. LOS SOCIOS (AS)  TIENEN EXPERIENCIA EN GRUPOS SOLIDARIOS POR LO QUE CONOCEN LA MODALIDAD D. PAGO, LA RESPONSABILIDAD Y CUMPLIMIENTO QUE SE REQUIERE PARA CONSERVARSE COMO UN GRUPO D. LA FUNDACIÓN AGROCAPITAL.
texts.en:
The partners of the “Rosas D. los Andés” (Roses of the Andes) group are represented by Lourdes. The group consists of 13 members, two of which are men and the rest are hardworking and enterprising women, thus the name of the group. The members are people of humble means, but with a great desire to make progress by working in sales of products such as food, watches, clothing, shoes, fruits, backpacks, and embroidered shawls. There is a lot of competition in the market, but they benefit from their experience and the quickness with which they change their merchandise. They are always prepared to deal with the behavior of the market and are prepared for the season. Unfortunately, however, some of the members are not able to enter into this new loan cycle, and this is the main reason for not complying with their payment plan. However, the other members of the group are always there to help them out and to avoid losing members of the group, which is mostly composed of friends of many years. The use of the loan is to purchase merchandise and ingredients in order to meet the demand of the market. The members have experience in loan groups, so they understand the method of payment and the level of responsibility and follow-through that is required to maintain themselves as a group with Fundación Capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Mehrinisso

texts.ru: Юсупова Мехриниссо жительница города яван. Возраст 42 года , имеет семерых детей. Занимается земледелием всю свою жизнь. Так как это помогает снабжать семью необходимыми злаковыми культурами. Муж работае  на стройке в городе Душанбе. а урожай , который зарабатывает она , она использует для своей семьи , но частично она продает  на рынке.Планируемый кредит хочет использовать для того . чтобы закупить семена. Погасить кредит сможет в течение восьми месяцев.
texts.en:
Mehrinnisso U. lives in Yavan town. She is 42 years old and has 7 children. Her husband is a construction worker in Dushanbe. All her life Mehrinnisso has worked in agriculture. This helps her provide grain to her family. She sells part of the harvest at the market and uses the rest for consumption. She plans to get a loan for buying seeds. She would pay off the loan within 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
In the village of Pilitan in Tumauini, Isabela, lives a micro-entrepreneur named Lilian C.. She believes that “if there’s a will, there’s a way”; this is her reason why her family is happy despite the obstacles they have encountered. She is already 40 years old and married to William, a farmer. They have three children: Judith, Mark, and the youngest is Willboy. All of them are in high school level. Lilian and her husband are sacrificing a lot to send them to school with the hope that they can have a better life in the future.

Lilian is operating a simple village store. Her products include: snacks, crackers, and ice candies. Her request is for a loan of PHP 4,000 which will be used to purchase additional merchandise for her store. She also plans to buy soft drinks and some native delicacies as snacks that she will sell. Lilian is looking forward to the success of her business and hoping that she can maintain it for their family's sake.

loans.use: Purchase of additional merchandise

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga tiene 46 años de edad, enviudó hace 9 años, y ahora vive con sus dos hijos y una nieta en una casa alquilada, donde tiene su negocio. Cuando estaba vivo su esposo, ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida y a la agricultura con el apoyo de peones, mientras que su pareja trabajaba de transportista de ruta interprovincial; por ello que Olga y su esposo solo iban a su chacra en los meses de la cosecha. Al fallecer su esposo dejó la agricultura y empezó a vender costales e hilos especiales para el empaque de papa, inició con este negocio debido a que en su zona hacia falta la venta de estos artículos. Olga se siente muy contenta, ya que es la pionera con su tienda y ya es muy conocida en este rubro.  Ahora se ha propuesto vender casacas y ropa gruesa para el frío, y otra de sus metas es comprar y vender artefactos eléctricos. Esta temporada escolar le es rentable, ya que de una prenda (para el uniforme escolar) que trae desde la capital la vende al crédito, lo que le permite en ganar el doble, y con estas ganancias comprará artefactos eléctricos. En cualquier tipo de negocio, Olga dice tener éxito. Es una cliente nueva de MFP, y todos están muy motivados por la conformación de este nuevo banco comunal, la han nombrado tesorera, e hizo el juramento de cumplir su cargo de acuerdo las exigencias establecidas; lo mismo que también hace el compromiso de realizar sus pagos en las fechas señaladas. Con el dinero solicitado invertirá en la compra de casacas para dama y otras prendas, el pedido le llegará en los próximos días, y ya tiene todo listo para sus próximas entregas.
texts.en:
Olga is 46 years old, was widowed 9 years ago, and now lives with her 2 children and her granddaughter in a rented house, where she has her business. When she was living with her husband, she sold food and produce with the help of workers, while her husband was working as a driver; for that reason, Olga and her husband only went to their small farm during the harvesting season. When her husband died, she stopped selling produce and began selling bags and special thread for potato sacks, which she started because no one in her area was selling these goods. Olga is very happy, as she is a pioneer with her store and is already well-known for her line of work. Now she has decided to sell coats and warm clothing for cold weather, with the goal of also buying and selling electrical devices. This school year has been profitable for her, as some articles of clothing (for a school uniform) that she brought from the capital on credit have earned her double - and with this profit, she will buy electrical devices. In whatever type of business, Olga says she is successful. She is a new MFP (Microfinanzas PRISMA) client, and everyone is very motivated by the creation of the new communal bank, where she has been named Treasurer, and where she has made an oath to successfully carry out her required duties; she is also committed to paying back her loans on time. With this money, she will purchase women's coats and other clothing. She will receive her shipment of goods in the next couple of days, and she is all ready to make her next deliveries.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Sattin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying women's coats and clothing for her store

loans.name: Makunguru B Group

texts.en:
Tabia has been selling maize and beans in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $90. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more maize and beans for resale in order to improve her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Tabia is 48 years old, married, and has 6 children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Lucy, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: Buy more maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Lolakhon

texts.ru: Лолахон – молодая женщина 28 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы растить своих сыновей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли.
texts.en:
Lolakhon is a young 28 year old woman, she is married and is a mother of two children. Her husband buys and sells cattle on the market. She raises and feeds the cattle at home. She is helping her husband in developing his business because she wants to get more profit to raise her sons. She will use the loan to increase the number of cattle and increase profit.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For raising and reselling of cattle

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Narcisa tiene 42 años y es una mujer muy alegre, vive en la casa de sus familiares con sus 3 hijos Brayan de 13, Ingrith de 10 y Anghie de 7, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. Narcisa tiene su puesto de venta de ropa en el mercado Laykakota (Mercado importante de la ciudad de Puno), su puesto es muy visitado por sus clientes, quines siempre se llevan algo para sus casas, ella trae la ropa desde La Paz (Ciudad del país de Bolivia), es por eso que siempre tiene modelos más novedoso que sus vecinas de venta.
