A Narcisa le gusta mucho conversar con sus clientes e informarles sobre los nuevos modelos que le llegaron, lleva 15 años realizando este negocio y lo más difícil para ella, es transportar las ropas desde La Paz – Bolivia, ya que es un trayecto largo y cansado, anhela más adelante tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender una mayor variedad de ropa y atender mejor a sus clientes. Este es el primer préstamo de Narcisa en MFP, está muy feliz por la oportunidad y desea pagarlo a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles de préstamo, Narcisa comprará más ropa para implementar mejor su puesto de ropa.
texts.en:
Narcisa is 42 years old and a very happy person. She lives in her family’s house with her three children Brayan 13, Ingrith 10 and Anghie 7. They are the reason for all her efforts.

Narcisa has a clothing stand in the Laykakota Market, an important market in the city of Puno. She has regular costumers, who usually buy something to take home every time they visit the stand. She gets the clothing from La Paz, Bolivia. This allows her to provide newer styles than the other merchants in the market. Narcisa enjoys talking with her costumers and letting them know about the new arrivals. She has been working on this business for 15 years. The most difficult part is transporting the goods from La Paz; it is a long and tiresome journey.

She wishes to have a large store selling a wider variety of clothing to better serve her costumers. This is Narcisa’s first loan with MFP, she is very happy for this opportunity and is committed to pay it on time. She is a very responsible member of her communal bank. She will buy more merchandise with the loan to better supply her clothing stand.

Translated from Spanish by Elsa Mejia Connelly, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase amount of merchandise

loans.name: Kodir

texts.ru: Кодир Хусанов проживает в районе Турсунзода. Возраст 35 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Кодир уже 24 года занимается земледелием. Это является основным источником дохода. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить зерно пшеницы, посеить, собрать и продать.
texts.en:
Kodir H. lives in the Tursun-zoda district. He is 35 years old, married and has 3 children. Kodir has been involved in agriculture for 24 years. This is his main income source. He wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase wheat seeds to sow, harvest and sell.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Bremda Libette

texts.es: Brenda Libette M. Martínez es una joven madre de 26 años de edad y solamente tiene 1 hijo, ella esta casada, su esposo trabaja fuera de la ciudad, en el campo, por lo que la mayor parte del tiempo sola y para ayudar a su esposo en la manutención del hogar vende mercadería en general de manera ambulante, ella fue ayudante de ventas en el mercado, por lo que cuando adquirió un poco de experiencia decidió emprender uno propio, aun que su niño tiene apenas 8 meses de nacido, Brenda alega que es un pequeño bien portado lo que le permite andar con el repartiendo su mercadería, la meta de Brenda y su esposo para este año es poder comprar su propia casa, ya que ellos se están alojando en la casa de un familiar, para esto ella requiere un financiamiento para invertir en productos como ropas, cosméticos, prendas de oro y plata, etc.,  de esta manera ahorrara las ganancias que obtendrá con la venta de estos productos e ira acumulando dinero para la compra de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Brenda Libette M. Martínez is a young, 26-year-old mother. She only has one son. She is married, and her husband works in the country, so the majority of the time she is alone. To help her husband support their home, she sells general merchandise as a street vendor. She used to be a sales assistant in the market, but when she acquired a little experience, she decided to start her own business. Her son is not yet 8 months old. Brenda is happy because her little boy is well-behaved, which lets her walk around and sell her merchandise. The goal of Brenda and her husband this year is to be able to buy their own home since they are staying in a family member's home. To do this, they will need a loan to invest in products like clothing, cosmetics, gold and silver jewelry, etc. In this way, she will save the profits she obtains from the sale of these products and will earn money to purchase their home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Kuña Kyre'y Group

texts.en:
This committee is named Kuña Kyre’y. It was formed on November 7th, 2008 thanks to the director of finances for the group, Mrs. Karina G. who works selling jewelry. After talking to a loan officer, she helped gather 19 women who work well together and are currently in their third loan with Fundación Paraguaya.

It’s a good and supportive group that continues working hard. They invest their loans in their respective businesses. They all participate in activities to raise funds as a group, and they mutually help each other achieve their common goals, both individually and as a group. They participate in weekly meetings and supportively work together. 

1. Silvia Carolina V. - - - Undergarment and Avon cosmetics sales
2. Norma G. - - - Dressmaker
3. Karina B. - - - Undergarment sales
4. Natalia G. - - - Jewelry sales
5. Feliciana L. - - - Dressmaker
6. Olga A. - - - Diner
7. Estanislaa A. - - - Clothing sales
8. Sandra M. - - - Undergarment sales
9. Jorgelina R. - - - Snack sales
10. Rosalina D. - - - Handicraft sales
11. Leticia S. - - - Fruit and vegetable sales
12. Evelin G. - - - Manicure and pedicure
13. Lorenza M. - - - Undergarment sales
14. Carolina Q. - - - Dressmaker
15. Ma. Cristina Ávalos - - - Food sales
16. Yolanda Ávalos - - - Fruit and vegetable sales
17. Karina G. - - - Jewelry sales
18. Verónica N. - - - Convenience store
19. Nélida R. - - - Dressmaker

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for sale or of raw materials

loans.name: Runty

texts.en: Runty is a very funny and very friendly woman who is determined to improve the profitability of her grocery and drink business. She has been in her business for the past 3 years. She is 36 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting a loan of N70,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks

loans.name: Jerlyn

texts.en:
Thirty-one year old Jerlyn B. is a rice farmer and is married to Carlito B.. She is worried about how to get along with the finances in their home. All she wants to do is to grow her crops and be able to send her four children to school.

She is asking for a loan of Php 13,000 from CEVI. She will use part of the loan to buy fertilizers and chemicals. She will also use some of the funds to pay her children's tuition.

Now that she has been actively involved in the CEVI cluster meetings, she has received not just loans, but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and chemicals and pay childrens' tuition

loans.name: Ilemi A Group

texts.en:
Judith is a member of the Ilemia borrower group in Mwanjelwa,Mbeya.she is 40 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 4 children.Her children are aged 20,17,14 and 10 years.

Judith started her own cafe business selling food 10 years ago,she works 11 hours a day and  earn monthly profit approximately 150,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Judith first loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to buy more commodities for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Judith hopes to expand her business and pay school fees.

Rehema is another member of the same borrower group,she also requested the amount of 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more commodities

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys A. sells electrical parts and auto parts near Shama Junction. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter. Gladys received junior high school education. She has been selling electrical parts since 2003. Gladys helps pay the school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to expand her business by buying more electrical parts for resale. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy electrical parts

loans.name: Jocelina

texts.en:
Jocelina has been in the direct selling business for 15 years.  At present, she is working as a dealer of Natasha, Boardwalk, MSE, and Avon cosmetics and apparel products. She manages the business since when she is still single. Jocelina is now married and blessed with two children and they are both in high school level.  Her business serves as her source of income while her husband is selling different detergent soaps in different villages.  The couple is working hard to meet the needs of their family and also to support the education of their children.  

Jocelina uses her income for the tuition fees of their children and for the improvement of their living condition.  She wanted to avail a loan of PHP32,000 that she can use as additional capital for her business.  This amount will help her to buy more products and have a business expansion.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe A. who lives in the village of Tabao Rizal, San Enrique, Negros Occidental, is 33 years old and married to Reynaldo A., Jr. who presently works as a furniture designer. The couple is blessed with five young children ranging in age from 4 to 16 years old. Ma. Fe dreams that when her five children are all grown up, she will have provided them with a good education that will prepare them to have a good livelihood that would enable them to live a good life. Because her children are growing up, the household's expenses are also increasing because she needs to send them to school on top of the other basic necessities. This is the reason why she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon: to get financial support in running her business. She started by selling Ready-to-Wear products which she sold just around her community. She even brought her products when she attended the Center meeting to sell to her center-mates. Her business activities earns her an average monthly income of PHP 7,000. Because of her good performance at NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Fe is allowed to obtain a bigger loan. For her 14th loan she borrowed Php 29,500 as additional working capital for her business. The amount was repaid in weekly installments and was fully paid on time without any delays. For her 15th loan Ma. Fe is borrowing Php 19,500 to purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital. Whatever income she earns will be used for the improvement and expansion of the business. She is borrowing a smaller amount this time because she is anticipating a slower business turnover because it is now the rainy season, an off-season for the sugar plantations which directly affects her sales. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the call of not just a few, but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: Mercedes es una mujer emprendedora y activa, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 59 años, es madre de dos hijos mayores de edad, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y alquiler de motocarro, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mujeres del 2000” desde hace nueve años, siempre es considerada socia puntual y optimista. El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en colonias, talco y lápiz labial, en la actualidad Mercedes necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado para comprar productos de belleza y otra parte será para comprar repuestos para el mantenimiento de su motocarro. La meta de Mercedes es llegar a tener una tienda de lubricante y repuestos de motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Mercedes is an entrepreneuring and active woman who lives in the city Pucallpa, region of Ucayali. She is 59 years old, mother of two children already of age. She works selling beauty products and renting a motorcar, which she does together with her husband. She has been part of the communal bank "Mujeres del 2000" (Women of 2000) for nine years, and has always been a punctual and optimistic member. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles which allowed her to invest in cologne, perfumed talcum, and lipstick. Currently, Mercedes needs a loan for 1000 soles which she will use to buy beauty products and another part to buy spare parts for her motorcar's maintenance. Mercedes' goal is to have a store of spare parts and oil for motorcycles and motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying beauty products and spare parts for her motorcar's upkeep

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: El grupo “Renacer” esta representada por la señora Yolanda y conformada por 12 miembros muy trabajadores los cuales van cursando juntos ya un tercer ciclo en el cual tuvieron algunos problemas con socias las cuales no pudieron cancelar su cuota por problemas familiares, grupo supo llevar la situación ayudando a la socias a cancelar sus cuotas mientras se volvía a recuperar y volver a juntar su capital D. trabajo demostrando la unidad y solidaridad del grupo. Las socias tienen diferentes actividades comerciales como la venta D. comida, venta D. cosméticos, venta D. abarrotes en tiendas D. barrio, venta D. insumos médicos, servicios D. enfermería y limpieza. En cuanto al entorno competitivo es alta pero las socias saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia en su trabajo y también a sus ganas D. sacar a flote sus negocios ya que D. ello depenD. el sustento diario D. su familia. El destino del crédito es para la compra D. mercadería e insumos que ayudaran a generar un mejor ingreso para que las socias puedan dar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida.
texts.en:
Yolanda represents the Renacer Group, which is comprised of 12 hard-working members. They are in their third cycle. They did have some problems with members who could not make their payments due to family problems. The group knew how to handle the situation by helping the members to make their payments while they were recuperating. Then they could return to getting together their working capital, thus demonstrating the unity and solidarity of the group. The group has different commercial activities like selling food, cosmetics, groceries in neighborhood stores, and medical supplies. Some offer nursing and cleaning services. As far as the competition goes, it is high. But, the members know how to get ahead thanks to their work experience and their desire to keep their business afloat. They do this because they depend upon their businesses for their families’ daily support. The loan is to buy merchandise and supplies that will help generate better income so that the members can give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Ana Mercedes tiene la edad de 39 años, habita en el barrio la Francia numero dos , ubicado en el municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a sus tres hijos , la mayor de ellos le apoya con los gastos del hogar , los dos menores estudian y en tiempos libres el ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda propia , actualmente habita en la casa de su mamá , junto a sus hijos a raíz del divorcio con su esposo , doña Ana es madre soltera , desde hace siete años se dedica a la agricultura ya que sus padres le apoyaron con un terreno para que saliera hacia delante con sus hijos , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta en el cultivo de piña es que carecen de fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para obtener una mejor producción , con el primer préstamo logro recuperar parte de la plantación la cual estaba invadida de plagas , agradece a afodenic por el apoyo que le brinda ; ya que con este segundo préstamo lo va a invertir  en insumos agrícolas para poder vender en un mejor precio el cultivo y poder pagar en tiempo y forma su desembolso , a la vez esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que le brinda por que así como se le apoya a ella son muchos los agricultores que se benefician con estos programas de desarrollo a los pequeños empresario .
texts.en:
Sra. Ana Mercedes is 39 years old. She lives in the neighborhood of La Francia No. 2, located in the town of Ticuantepe, with her three children. Her oldest child contributes toward the household expenses, while the two younger children are students who help on the farm during their free time. Ana’s plans include building her own home since she and her children currently live at her mother’s house. She became a single mother after divorcing her husband.

Ana has been farming for seven years. Her parents provided her with a plot of land so that she and her children could get ahead. Ana’s greatest difficulty in growing pineapple is the lack of resources to acquire fertilizers and other supplies to improve her production. Her first loan was used to help part of her plantation recover from an invasion of pests. She thanks AFODENIC for the support that was provided to her.

Her second loan will be invested in agricultural supplies so that she will be able to sell her crops at a better price and make her payments on time. She is grateful for this opportunity and appreciates that these development programs are available to help many farmers and small business owners.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & supplies for improving pineapple production

loans.name: Vennicah Kerubo

texts.en:
Vennicah Kerubo O. has had a food stall for two years where she sells carrots, tomatoes, potatoes, and fruit. She is located in Juja, outside of Thika, right near Jomo Kenyatta University of Agriculture & Technology. 

Her business challenge is lack of funds. She is using her loan of KES 15,000 to buy more potatoes, fruit, tomatoes, and carrots. Her goal in life is to build a house for her family and expand her business.  

Vennicah is married and has two children. She describes herself as hardworking, caring and friendly.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes, carrots, potatoes and fruits.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
María de Jesús O. P. es una señora  de 39 años de edad, quien vive con su  esposo y sus dos hijas en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada San Gabriel, localizada en Yolillal, Upala en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica. Sus actividades principales son  la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería

Desde hace poco más de tres años doña María se ha dedicado se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa en general. Dice que su negocio la ha ayudado mucho ya que gracias a esto ha podido cubrir ciertos  gastos de su hogar y ha podido sacar adelante a  sus  hijas. 

Actualmente doña María está solicitando un microcrédito por un monto de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar y vender mercadería en su pueblo. Su negocio va bien pero por falta de dinero no ha podido hacerlo crecer más. Con el préstamo que está solicitando ella espera aumentar las ventas y así mejorar la condición económica de su familia y poder brindarle mayores oportunidades a sus hijas.

Doña María forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de San Gabriel, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  tercer crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo como microempresario y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
María de Jesús O. P. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and their two children in a rural community called San Gabriel, located in Yolillal, Upala, Province of Alajuela. This is a large extension community, with a semi mountainous terrain in Costa Rica, Central America. Their main activities are basic grain agriculture and small farming. A little more than three years ago, Maria began selling apparel items. She tells us that her business has been of great help, and that thanks to it she has been able to cover household expenses and raise her daughters. This time, María is requesting for a ¢500.000 loan (five hundred colones) to purchase and resell apparel items around her town. She’s been able to maintain a profitable business, but due to lack of money, she hasn’t been able to expand. With this loan, she expects to increase her sales and improve her family monetary situation, so her daughters can have better opportunities in the future. María is a member of San Gabriel Community Loan Company, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her third loan. She hopes to continue growing as an entrepreneur and expand her business. She also thinks it’s important to mention that thanks to these type of organizations and loan lenders she is able to devote more time to productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase apparel items

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Nuestra socia es la Sra. Ruth. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “KUKILI”, la socia es natural de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestra socia tiene 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 4 hijos de 13, 6, 3, 1 años de edad, la socia es comerciante y empresaria, ella junto a su esposo tiene un stand de venta de computadoras y todo tipo de accesorios de computo, la socia particularmente alterna sus labores de la casa con el apoyo casi permanente con su esposo.

Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar accesorios para computadoras.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos establecidos en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
Our member is Senora Ruth. She belongs to the communal bank 'Kukili', and is from the city of Cusco. Our member is 35 years old, is married, and has 4 children of 13, 6, 3 and 1 years of age. She is a storekeeper and business woman. Together with her husband she has a stand that sells computers and all types of computing accessories. She alternates her housework with the nearly permanent support of her husband. Our member is seeking a loan to be able to purchase computer accessories. Ruth values and is thankful for the loan granted and promises to adhere to the established repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase computer accessories and improve her stand

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: N. Jeanne est née en 1958 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Jeanne s'est installée depuis 30 ans à Adjarra Sota à quelques kilomètres de Porto-Novo. Mariée à HONFO Kinvoedo, un marchand, Jeanne est mère de quatre enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Jeanne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari à Adjarra. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Jeanne n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Jeanne mène comme activité, la vente d'oignons et d'igname au marché d'Adjarra. Jeanne vend également ses produits à son domicile, et s'approvisionne à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. C'est depuis 10 ans que Jeanne exerce cette activité, une activité qui lui génère de revenu qu'elle utilise pour subvenir à ses différents besoins. Jeanne a déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés. Jeanne souhaite augmenter davantage le stock de ses produits et mieux répondre aux différents besoins de ses clients. Cependant, Jeanne ne réunit pas assez de fonds pour renforcer son activité. C’est pourquoi Jeanne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Jeanne N. was born in 1958 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She settled some thirty years ago in Adjarra Sota, a few kilometres from Porto-Novo. Married to Kinvoedo HONFO, a merchant, Jeanne is mother to four children, all attending school. She lives together with her children and husband in Adjarra. The couple share the household expenses. Jeanne has not been to school. To meet her various expenses, Jeanne sells onions and yams in the Adjarra market. She also sells these products from her home, and gets her supplies from Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Jeanne has been performing this activity for the past ten years, which generates the income she uses to cover her various expenses. Jeanne has already been granted two loans from ALIDé, both of which were fully reimbursed. She would like to increase her stock of supplies and respond better to the diverse needs of her customers. However, she is unable to gather sufficient funds to reinforce her business. This is why she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy baskets of onions and yams

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks

loans.name: Marlon Alexander

texts.es:
El Joven Marlon Alexander M. R., es casado tiene dos hijos a su cargo trabaja en la alcaldía de Chinandega desempeñándose como vigilante en el mercado, ha demostrado ser un joven responsables ya que son cinco años de trabajar con nosotros el cual ha trabajado muy bien.

El señor Marlon M. utilizara el crédito para realizar reparaciones en  su casa, ya que la tiene forrada de plástico y lo tiene un poco viejo y el techo se le pasa cuando llueve, además comprara unas cosas que utilizara en su hogar, como alimentos para su familia.
texts.en:
The young Marlon Alexander M. Rodriguez is married and has two children. He works in the Chinandega mayor's office as a guard in the market. He has demonstrated himself to be a responsible young man in the five years that he has worked with us. Mr. Marlon M. will use this loan to make repairs to his house, since it is lined with plastic and a little bit old, and the roof leaks when it rains. Furthermore, he will purchase a few things that will be utilized in his home, such as food for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 43 years old years and married with 5 children. Her husband is a civil servant and he also supports their home. She is a hard-working woman who sells melon retail and wholesale. Melon in Nigeria is used to prepare egusi soup. This soup is delicious and can be eaten with cassava dough. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more melons to sell. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more melons to sell

loans.name: Deysi Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz tiene 30 años y tiene una hija llamada Micaela que tiene 6 años, ella es una madre responsable que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a su hija. 

Beatriz tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes que esta ubica en la av.  Mainique de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella empieza su actividad del hogar a las 6 de la mañana cuando por ejemplo preparara desayuno para su hija y para su esposo, ella después se va a trabajar al negocio y ella también alquila carros. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.

Beatriz pertenece al banco comunal “TERCER MILENIO” de la Asociación Arariwa. Su primer crédito de la socia fue de 100 dólares de las cuales invirtió en su negocio. Actualmente, la socia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimientos de los carros. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 30, has a 6-year-old daughter named, Micaela. Beatriz is a responsible mother who always seeks ways to get ahead through her own efforts and provide her daughter with a better future. Beatriz has a small grocery store located on Mainique Avenue in Urubamba. She starts her household chores at 6am preparing breakfast for her daughter and husband. She then goes to work at her store. She also leases cars. She has been in this line of work for several years now and does well thanks to the efforts she puts into her work. Beatriz is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "TERCER MILENIO" (Third Millenium) communal bank. Her first, 100 dollar, loan was invested in her business. Currently, she needs funding to service her vehicles. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Siyawan Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siyawan de l’association Parisi est composé 6 de femmes   mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali qui  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 25 ans et au moins 5 enfants. 
Elles se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font le commerce d’articles divers tels, les habillements, les condiments alimentaires et les céréales qui  est le domaine de Didia D., très sollicitée et appréciée à Tominian par sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses articles.
Le prêt de Didia sera utilisé pour acheter,  20 sacs d’arachide par semaine dans les foires environnantes de Seoulasso et  de San. Elle effectue sa vente, en gros, au comptant, en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs.
Les membres du groupe Siyawan comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Parisi association's Siyawan group is made up of six married women from the town of Tominian, in the Ségou region, the fourth administrative district in the Republic of Mali. All six women live in traditional families and are on average 25 years old, with at least 5 children. They met through neighborhood and family connections and sell various goods such as clothing, spices and grains, which is the domain of Didia D., very sought after and appreciated by her customers in Tominian for the quality of her goods. Didia's loan will be used to buy 20 sacks of peanuts each week in the markets around Seoulasso and San. She makes her sales wholesale, in cash, retail and credit to a customer base made up of retailers and consumers. The members of the Siyawan group calculate that they will each turn a monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs, which will be used for the repayment of the loan's interest and daily family expenses.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying peanuts

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa M. es socia del bankito La Paz, vive en la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca; ésta ciudad se encuentra escondida en el valle del sur donde una vez fue el  asentamiento de los Tomebamba.  Conocida  también como el camino real que unía al  Cuzco con Quito durante el imperio Pre-colombino es la capital de la provincia del  Azuay. 

 Nuestra socia tiene 66 años de edad,  enviudó hace nueve  años porque  su esposo tenía  cirrosis ya que bebía mucho, concibió siete hijos, cinco  hijos  son casados  y una de  ellos  vive en su casa de forma  independiente, comparte su techo con  un hijo invalido porque fue arrollado por un carro y a raíz de su lesión su esposa le abandono, su hijo soltero se encuentra enfermo a casusa de la bebida de alcohol,  su vivienda es herencia de su difunta suegra.

Rosa se dedica a la venta de ropa usada  en los mercados de Azogues y Gualaceo  sólo los días sábados el resto de la semana realiza los quehaceres de su hogar y cuidado de sus hijos enfermos.  Se encuentra en su sexto ciclo integrando el banco comunal La Paz, los créditos le han beneficiado para adquirir ropa para su negocio  y para comprar medicamentos para tratar el cáncer  del  que felizmente está curada, con su nuevo crédito va a comprar camisas, blusas, faldas, pantalones, etc.  para damas y caballeros para abastecer su negocio y tener un stock surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes.

 Su sueño es llegar hacer un cuarto en un terreno que tiene para entregarle a su hija.
texts.en:
Rosa M., 66, is a member of the La Paz communal bank. She lives in greater Cuenca which is located in a southern valley that was once the Tomebamba (a former city-state in the Inca federation) settlement. It is also known as the royal road that connected Cuzco to Quito during the Pre-Columbian era; it is the capital of Azuay province. Rosa was widowed nine years ago because her husband had cirrhosis due to excessive drinking. She has 7 children, five are married and one lives independently in her own home. She shares her home with a disabled son who was hit by a car; due to his disability his wife left him. Her unmarried son suffers from the disease of alcoholism. Her home was inherited from her deceased mother-in-law. Rosa is a used clothing merchant in Azogues and Gualaceo markets on Saturdays. The rest of the week she tends to her household chores and to care for her ill sons. She is in her 6th cycle as a member of the La Paz communal bank. Her previous loans have been used to buy clothing for her business and to buy medicine to treat her cancer which she is happily cured of. She will use the requested funds to buy assorted articles of clothing like: shirts, skirts, blouses, pants, etc. for women and men to have a varied stock available for her customers. Her dream is to have a room built on a lot she owns to give to her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted women's and men's clothing.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en:
Mariana is divorced and lives with her parents. She runs a small business selling food items at a kiosk, located near the railway station in Beregovo town. Mariana has been in this business for 13 years. There is very low competition and high demand, which makes this business a success. Mariana's monthly income is 5,000 UAH. 

Mariana would like to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase more inventory. She hopes to increase her sales and to earn additional income.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira S. P. is from the village of Marabulig 1, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 51 years old. Elvira is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elvira sells home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling door mats, pillow cases, and bedding supplies in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Elvira from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Honeylee

texts.en:
Honeylee C. is from the village of Eastern Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 22 years old. Honeylee is married and has 1 infant-aged child. To make a living, Honeylee owns & operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing transportation services to local community members. Honeylee has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Honeylee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honeylee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to repair the motorcycle used in the business, by installing an extension back seat. Honeylee is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase repair materials and tools like tire tubes, screwdrivers, and pliers. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Honeylee from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Sheet metal, wood, nails

loans.name: Arwen

texts.en:
Arwen L. is from the village of Mibantang, Quezon, Bukidnon. He is 33 years old and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Arwen owns and operates a service-based business providing motorcycle services used to transport passengers in the village and nearby areas. Arwen has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Arwen joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Arwen is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Falepau

texts.en:
Falepau S. is 62 and married with five children (ages 17 - 37).  She owns a business selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Falepau has three years of experience in this business.  Falepau needs a loan of WST $1,200 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 450 talas or US $188 per week) to improve/expand her business.

In 2009, Falepau joined SPBD. This is her second loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Falepau's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

About  SPBD: 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.  Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Yeimy Yhonatan

texts.es:
El señor es casado, tiene dos hijos menores, vive en el barrio Conavi de esta ciudad, posee una microempresa de producciones, donde comercializa espacios publicitarios, tiene casa propia y su pareja posee una cantina en una escuela muy conocida de la ciudad.
 Son una familia es muy trabajadora y con ganas de superarce cada dia y con miras en agrandar cada vez mas su actividad actual, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por los buenos servicios que le ha brindado como asi tambien el queda comprometida en cumplir en tiempo y forma el compromiso adquirido con la empresa para así en un determinado tiempo poder contar nuevamente con el apoyo de la Institucion para cualquier emprendimiento dentro de su empresa.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de equipos informáticos para la empresa.
texts.en:
The gentleman is married and has two minor children. He lives in this city’s Conavi neighborhood and has a small production company where he sells ad space. He owns his own home and his wife has a snack bar in one of the city’s well known schools. They are a very hard working family who wants to improve daily in order to grow each time in their current work. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the good services rendered and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion so that he might be eligible for future assistance if needed. He is asking for funds to buy computer equipment for the firm.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy computer equipment for the firm.

loans.name: Bertha Adilia

texts.es: La señora Bertha Adilia, ella tiene 54 años es casada  y tres hijos los cuales ya todos son mayores de edad con sus familias aparte. Bertha se dedica a la venta de refrescos, carnes y golosinas, los cuales distribuye en su casa de habitación, Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 5 años, el cual dio inicio debido a que fueron sus hijos la que la empujaron a poner el negocio. Luego ella observo que el mismo era rentable, por lo que lo ha mantenido subsistiendo ahora con ingresos de ella. Ella solicita este crédito con el objetivo de invertirlo en la compra de mercadería para el negocio. Su sueño es llegar a tener un negocio grande, que sea de capital propio para obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera poder subsistir ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertha Adilia, 54, is married and has three children, all of whom are adults, married and living separately with their families. Bertha sells soft drinks, meat and candies from her house. She began the business 5 years ago, and it was her children who encouraged her to start it. She then saw that it was profitable and it has been supporting her. She is requesting this loan to buy merchandise for the business. Her dream is to end up with a big business with her own capital to get better income and thus support herself and her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Lucie Yvette

texts.fr:
Femme célibataire de 41ans et mère de 3 enfants dont l’âge varie de 4ans à 15ans. Elle est dans la vente des poissons de mer depuis 2001 et à débuter son commerce avec un capital de 150000frs. Par jour elle vend 120000 à 210000.

Avec le prêt actuel, elle va renforcer son commerce en faisant beaucoup de réserve tel que carton de 2 carton de poisson girel,1 carton sole, 1 carton de bar, 1 carton de barbillon


Elle voudrait un jour  avoir 2 ou 3 autres étalage et devenir femme d’affaire dans ce domaine.
Avec les revenus  qu’elle va générée, elle va s’occupée de la scolarité des ses 3 enfants et vivre dans des bonnes conditions.
Elle est prise comme exemple dans  son quartier
texts.en:
Lucie Yvette T. is 41 years old, unmarried and the mother of three children whose ages range from 4 to 15 years. She has been selling sea fish since 2001 and began her business with a capital sum of 150,000 francs. She sells her fish for 120,000 to 210,000 francs per day. With her current loan, she is going to bolster her business by stocking up substantially with 2 cases of rainbow wrasse, 1 case of sole, 1 case of sea bass and 1 case of barbel. In the future she would like to have 2 or 3 other stalls and become a businesswoman in this field. With the income that she will generate, she is going to take care of the education of her 3 children and ensure a good standard of living. She is considered a role model in her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rainbow wrasse, sole, sea bass and barbel.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David tiene 35 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre en el sector Caminos del Inca, una comunidad rural pequeña del distrito de Zaña, conocido por sus tradiciones y costumbres afro – peruanas, se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace seis meses a brindar el servicio de transporte en una mototaxi (vehículo consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte), el adquirió el vehículo gracias a sus ahorros y desde entonces brinda su servicio en la ciudad de Cayalti y sus anexos, los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su madre con el sostenimiento del hogar.

David desea realizar algunas mejoras en casa de su madre, ya que su mayor anhelo es  mejorar gradualmente su calidad de vida, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su objetivo.

David es un hombre trabajador y que siempre da lo mejor de si para sacar a su familia adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
David is 35, single with no children and lives with his mother in the small rural community  of Caminos del Inca in the Zaña district. This area is known for it's Afro-Peruvian traditions and is located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

For the past 6 months he has made a living with his motorcycle taxi (a motorcycle with an attached covered cabin used for transportation). He purchased the vehicle with his savings and since then has been offering his services in and around the city of Cayalti. He uses the income from this activity to cover his personal expenses and help his mother with the household expenses. 

David wants to make some improvements to his mother's home since his wish is to gradually improve her quality of life. For that reason he has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa  in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles to help him meet his goals. David is a hardworking man that always gives his best to help his family. Those who know him consider him to be easy-going and responsible.

loans.use: Purchase materials for improvements to his mother's home

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
For the last 20 years Nasreen has been living in a three-room brick house with her family in Jaranwala, a small city in Punjab famous for its agricultural industry. She is a housewife and spends most of her time performing her household responsibilities, while her husband, G. H., works in a sugar mill earning a meager income.

Nasreen is the mother of four sons, three of whom are illiterate, and a daughter. Her eldest son drives a rented rickshaw, while the second eldest works in a private company on a monthly wage, and the youngest to them has a carpet weaving business. Her remaining two children are enrolled in school.

Nasreen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son. With the loan, he will buy a rickshaw because the rented rickshaw doesn’t allow him to work for more hours and he has to pay a portion of the earned amount to the rickshaw owner at the day's end. Nasreen is hopeful that by purchasing a rickshaw, her son will be able to work as long as he wants and can earn good income by serving more passengers.

Nasreen is a regular borrower from Asasah, and this is her fourth loan application. In previous loan years, she responsibly paid her installments and never missed any meetings.

. Note: In the photo, the lady shown holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) in her hands is Nasreen.

loans.use: To buy a rickshaw for the business

loans.name: Jena

texts.en: Jena E. is currently in the business of selling maize flour and simsim and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice and beans to sell.  Jena is 40 years old and is widowed.   She has 3 children and only 1 child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Marjorie Del Rocio

texts.es:
Marjorie de 42 años, tiene dos hijos y su esposo trabaja en una central de llamadas. Vende productos Yambal y Esika (empresa que ofrece a mujeres emprendedoras comenzar con sus ventas independientes) y ropa. 
 
Para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ella empezó a trabajar vendiendo productos Yambal y Esika. Poco a poco incremento su cartera de clientes porque trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos a sus vecinos y amigos, vende perfumes desde $ 20.00 hasta $ 50.00 c/u, cremas, ropa Esika. Una de las preocupaciones que tiene es la delincuencia ya que comprar mercadería y la deja en stop. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos Yambal como perfumes, cremas, ropa. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y que su mercadería aumente para vender más.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years of age. She has two children and her husband works in a call center. She sells Yambal and Esika brand products (business which offers enterprising women a chance to get started in independent sales) and clothing. 

In order to help her husband with the household expenses she began working selling Yambal and Esika brand products. Little by little she built her customer base. She begins work very early in the day offering the products to her neighbors and friends. She sells perfumes from $20 to $50 per unit, creams, and Esika clothing. One of her concerns is criminal activity since to buy merchandise it is left at a "stop". 

With the loan she wants to buy Yambal products such as perfumes, creams and clothing. In the future she wants to finish building her house and to have more merchandise in order to sell more.

loans.use: Perfumes, creams, costume jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is the father of 3 young children. He is the main income provider for his family. He has twelve years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2000. He cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. Today, he is requesting a loan of $700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.

loans.use: To purchase needed supplies for his agricultural work

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
In 2006, Pacita found an opportunity to obtain secured business capital. She joined ASHI, a first kiva field partner, and she was encouraged by the stories of poor women of ASHI. She wanted to become successful like them and has used the loans she had since then, for her business. 

Because of the opportunity of receiving loan, Pacita was able to start a  plastic wares business.  She was courageous enough to take all the risk of running a business  because her husband was there to support her. She kept a dream in her mind of having all grandchildren finish their schooling and they complete college. She won’t let her grandchildren attain a low level of education like her six children, whom all are under high school graduates and don’t have stable jobs. 

Pacita had never hoped for anything but her family. She hopes her children  will not have to experience a hard life like the one she and her husband have experienced. She dreams of expanded  her business. She sees herself venturing into the wholesale business in the future.  
 
Now she is requesting new loan amounting 24,000 Php. The loan fund will be used to pay for increased inventories of plastic wares to sell. She believes with more stocks will attract more customer in their village. 

Pacita’s one hope and dream is to alleviate her family from poverty. Pacita is very pleased to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for helping fund her business efforst.

loans.use: will be used to buy supplies of plastic wares to sell

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nansana just outside of Kampala. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. Jenifer has a motorcycle(motor bike for transporting people) business, which she has run for three years. She also has a second business in selling clothes.

To help expand her business, Jenifer has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase motorcycle machines and clothes. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Jenifer hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees. In the future, she hopes to own a retail shop. Jenifer is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by assisting her in improving her business.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle machines and clothes

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Having attained high school education, Ma. Elena E., 47, is a single mother who wants to achieve more in life, not just for herself but for her family as well. Ma. Elena lives in Baseco Port Area, Manila, along with her one healthy daughter who is currently attending preparatory school.

Ma. Elena presently owns and manages a business selling branded apparel, fashion jewelry and accessories, household items, footwear and the like.  She basically buys these items in bulk quantities and sell them piecemeal with minimum mark-up.  Her customers are her neighbors and the community. Ma. Elena earns at least Php 8,000 net income for the month.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 10,000 loan.  She plans to use this loan to purchase additional stock to sell and also to buy those items ordered in advance by her customers.  Ma. Elena believes that through this loan, she will be able to expand her inventory and thereby increase her earning capacity as micro-entrepreneur.

At present, Ma. Elena faces difficulty in collecting accounts from her customers. Still, she is determined not to be swayed by these struggles and aims to make her business grow. She prays that her business will continue so that she can earn more savings for her child's future.  As CCT community partner, she faithfully attends their weekly fellowship* meetings where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives as a mother and as a micro-entrepreneur.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Jagath Maya

texts.en:
This is Jagath Maya M.. She is married and has four children: three daughters aged 25, 20, and 17, and a son aged nine. Working seven days per week and often more than 12 hours per day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from BPW Patan and will use her most recent loan to buy additional grocery goods for her family business, which she operates with her husband. She thanks you for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a 'pasal', is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical 'pasal' might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women.

loans.use: Stock for grocery store

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is a 49-year-old married who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  buying and selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes and buying and selling bananas. She lives in Toboso, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1995 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly net income of PHP 1,200. Susana is borrowing PHP 14,000 to purchase more stocks to sell. This will be her 21st loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Susana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dum

texts.en: Dum P. is a 33 year-old woman who is employed as a sewing worker in the garment industry. She has been working in her job since 2006 and has a  monthly salary.  Her husband works in construction. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their two kids. Both of the kids attend school. Dum P. is concerned that the fence at her house is getting old and some parts are broken. Because her savings are not enough to repair her fence, Dum P. would like to apply for loan to install a new fence and to mend some parts which are broken.

loans.use: To install a new fence and to mend some parts which are broken.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with four school-going children. Her husband is a primary school teacher and he contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Josephine has operated a water-selling business for the past two years, selling from her home to her neighbors and to passersby. She faces the challenge of water shortages during the dry, hot season. Josephine dreams of establishing a food vending business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase four handcarts for water distribution and 50 water cans. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase four handcarts for water distribution and 50 water cans.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena M. is from the village of Mabuhay, Valencia City. She is 41 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Magdalena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap, breads, biscuits and candies in the local community. Magdalena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Magdalena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Magdalena is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk food. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Magdalena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and junk food

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor, de 23 años, vive en concubinato desde hace 2 años con Angélica; con quien tuvo 2 hijos: Roli y Abel, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada, ubicada en Vista Hermosa-Tarma. Como joven trabajador y responsable, se dedica a varias actividades. Una de ellas es la agricultura, donde siembra papa, en su terreno agrícola del caserío de San Antonio. Asimismo se dedica al negocio de venta de verduras y hortalizas en el mercado de San Ramón (selva central peruana), donde obtiene buenas ganancias, ya que por esa zona es muy escaso el producto. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es el apoyo que recibe de parte de su familia, quien le ayuda en la venta diaria de las verduras, ya que también se dedica al trabajo de alcantarillado del gobierno local de Tarma, donde recibe un dinero extra por parte del estado. Por ello cada noche, como menciona; se siente agotado por los múltiples trabajos que realiza, pero con el fin de ver a sus hijos cómodos y brindándole lo necesario; le estimula para seguir adelante. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Santa Rosa”, y este es el sexto crédito con MFP, donde es el más joven de los miembros por lo que agrade los consejos que recibe de parte de ellos. Héctor, constantemente necesita capital de trabajo para su negocio, por ello invertirá el crédito solicitado en la compra de varios kilos de verduras y hortalizas.
texts.en:
Héctor, 23, and Angélica have lived together unmarried for the last two years. They have two children: Roli and Abel that they care for in a rented house located in Vista Hermosa-Tarma.  Being a hard working, responsible young man he has several jobs.  One of them is farming.  He grows potatoes on his land in the hamlet of San Antonio.  He also sells vegetables in the San Ramón market (Peruvian central jungle) where he earn good profits because it’s area where these products are scarce.

What he most enjoys about his work is the support he gets from his family that helps him with his daily vegetable sales because he also works for the local Tarma government earning a salary working in drainage.

As he mentions, therefore, every night he’s exhausted because of the various jobs he does but wanting to see his children comfortable and with everything they need he’s motivated to continue forward.

He’s a member of the “Santa Rosa” communal bank and this is his 6th loan with MFP where he’s the youngest member.  He enjoys the advice he gets from them.  Héctor constantly needs working capital for his business so will use the requested loan to buy several kilograms of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy several kilograms of vegetables.

loans.name: White Group

texts.en:
M. A., is in his early forties and married with two children. He has been operating a general store for 13 years.  He works from 7.00am to 10.00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be M.'s 2nd "motisha" loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  A "Motisha" loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended.  He used the previous loan to increase the general store inventory and has paid back his loan successfully.  He hopes for a loan to buy a plot of land. His dream is to one day start travelling upcountry and collect his shop inventory.

M. will share this loan with his loan group "White" which has a total of 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture,  M. is the 1st on the left, back row, in a blue shirt. (The photo might not be very clear because it was raining that day.)

loans.use: To buy a plot of land.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She has been growing rice for 15 years. Rosalia earns by selling her harvest to rice traders. Rosalia also started raising pigs to augment her income. She built a small backyard piggery that she hopes to expand soon. Rosalia has requested a loan that she will use to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed.

Rosalia is 50 years old and is a married woman with 9 children.  She hopes to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pig feed

loans.name: 05.04.03-Phong Mỹ- Hoằng  Phong Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuyết operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business. Tuyết supports no dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. The main hardship that Tuyết faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is 36 years old and she is married with two children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 05.04.03-Phong Mỹ-Hoằng Phong solidarity group. 

This is Tuyết's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. With her business profits, she hopes to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, to remodel her house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase fishes and shrimps.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Saraphine is 32 years old and a single mother of two children ages seven and five years. She has been running a hair salon for the past ten years, earning herself a monthly income of 6,000 KES. With this she supports her two children.

Saraphine is applying for her fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase more beauty products, e.g., a blow-dryer, shampoo, a hair dryer, etc.

Saraphine will use the anticipated profits to expand her hair salon. Her hopes and dreams are to own a big salon and venture more into farming crops.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon products.

loans.name: Rita Esmeralda

texts.es: La señora Rita, es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposo e hijos, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida y brindarle apoyo  en cuanto a sus estudios a su pequeños , doña Rita desde hace varios años labora en una empresa privada , la mayor afectación que se le presenta es que su salario no le ajusta para realizar de una sola vez la compra de materiales de construcción , lo cual agradece Afodenic  atrávez de fondo Kiva la confianza y la oportunidad de crecer como personas ya que sin estos programas de apoyo no  hubiese un financiamiento para personas de bajos recursos.
texts.en: Rita lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe together with her husband and children. Her plan with respect to her family is to improve their quality of life and to send her little ones to school. Rita has had a private business for several years. The greatest challenge that she faces is that her salary is not enough to make a one-time purchase of construction materials. She is thankful to Afodenic (Kiva Field Partner) funded through Kiva for the trust and opportunity to grow as individuals. Without these support programs there would be no loans accessible to individuals of limited resources.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Neltetian

texts.en:
Neltetian is a very hardworking woman. She has been farming for over three years and earns a monthly profit of 3,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is 24 years old and married; they have one child. She is applying for her first loan. She plans to use part of the loan amount to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

She intends to use the additional income from the proceeds of this loan to buy cattle for fattening and to pay her children's school fees.

She hopes to develop her business and to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like seeds and fertilizer and to pay for labor.

loans.name: José Guadalupe

texts.es:
El señor José Guadalupe tiene ya más de ocho años dedicándose a la venta de abarrotes. 
Al negocio le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía, como son la venta de lácteos, carnes frías, verduras y fruta, ya que sus clientes le están solicitando que tenga estos productos para a la venta. 
Solicita el préstamo para la inversión, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y sigan consumiendo los productos que el vende. 
Con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas pagara el crédito, ya que le negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia y así poder darles los estudios necesario a sus hijos para que tenga un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. José Guadalupe has been selling groceries for 8 years.
He needs to offer a larger variety of merchandise such as dairy, cold cuts, vegetables, and fruits since that is what his clients are asking him to sell. 
He is requesting the loan to invest in more merchandise to satisfy his clients needs and they continue buying his products. He will use a portion of his profits to pay off his loan. Since his business provides the family's entire income he will be able to use the rest of the profits to offer his children the education needed for them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: buy merchandise for his grocery store.

loans.name: Mubinakhon

texts.ru:
Мубинахон честная и любящая мать 3 детей.  Она замужем и её муж является бизнесменом. Более 5 лет она занимается сушкой фруктов, и у неё достаточный опыт, чтобы развивать данный бизнес. С прибылью, которая она получила, она обеспечивала свою семью, а часть прибыли использовала на покупку радиоаппаратуры и мебель для своего дома.  Мубинахон хотела бы получить кредит в размере 1200$ США для переработки сухофруктов, чтобы продавать их за прибыльную цену и зарабатывать больше денег. Она хочет заранее поблагодарить всех кредиторов за их поддержку и поощрение.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
texts.en:
Mubinakhon is the honest and loving mother of three children. She is married and her husband is a businessman. For more than five years she has working drying fruit, and she has sufficient experience to develop this business. With profits she has received, she has provided for her family.  Part of the profits she used to buy a radio and furniture for her home. Mubinakhon would like to receive a loan of $1200 to process dried fruits to sell them at a profitable price and make more money. She wants to thank all the lenders for their support and encouragement. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to process dried fruit

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group

texts.es: LA SRA SARA D. 37  AÑOS D. EDAD ,SOLTERA  CON DOS HIJOS MENORES D. 12 Y 5 AÑOS D. EDAD  EN ETAPA ESCOLAR.LA SRA SARA ES SOCIA DEL GRUPO  SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS ,LA  SRA SARA  Y TODOS LOS INTEGRANTES DEL GRUPO SEÑOR D. LOS MILAGROS PROMETEN SER PUNTUALES  EN SUS SUS CUOTAS D. LOS PROXIMOS MESES  .LA  SRA SARA ACTUALMENTE TIENE SU SALON  D. BELLEZA UBICADA EN LA  AVENIDA CIRO ALEGRIA  NUMERO  643.LA SRA SARA  SOLICITA ESTE PRESTAMO PARA PODER  COMPRAR UNA SECADORA  Y ASI PODER MEJORAR SU NEGOCIO CON MAQUINAS D. ULTIMA TECNOLOGIA .LA SRA SARA QUISIERA PARA EL FUTURO  SACAR A SUS HIJOS PROFESIONALES  Y CONTAR CON UNA SUCURSAL MAS D. SU NEGOCIO .LA SRA  SARA  SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA  A LADO IZQUIERDO  D. LA SEÑORA  QUE VISTE  UNA CHOMPA COLOR CELESTE Y TIENE EN BRAZOS A SU HIJA .LA SRA SARA ESTA SENTADA Y VISTE UNA CHOMPA COLOR NEGRO
texts.en: Sara is 37 years old. She is single and has two minor children aged 12 and 5, who go to school. Sara is a member of the Señor D. los Milagros group. Sara and all of the members of the Señor D. los Milagros promise to make their payments on time in the coming months. At present, Sara has a beauty salon located on Avenida Ciro Alegria number 643. Sara is asking for the loan to be able to buy a dryer and thus improve her business with machines with the latest technology. In the future, Sara would like to have her children learn a profession and open another branch of her business. Sara is to the left of the woman in a light blue sweater and is carrying her daughter. Sara is seated and wearing a black sweater.

loans.use: to be able to buy a dryer.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn believes that "hardships and difficulties are the stepping stones to success".  She is a mother who is now 53 years old and has six adult children. She endures hardships and difficulties in life until all her children had finished their studies. Her husband has been her only partner in managing their rice field business for almost 38 years now.  

Marilyn is also engaged in a hog-raising business to generate additional income. She wants to strengthen this business to increase her income to support their basic needs and save for future emergencies. She wants to ask for a loan of P7,000 to buy feeds and vaccines to sustain her hog-raising business.   She believes that the loan will help her make the business grow as she works hard for it. She is hoping that her patience and sacrifices will bear good fruit someday.

loans.use: buy pig feed and vaccines

loans.name: Hugo Bricenio

texts.es:
Hugo Bricenio tiene 20 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Cantón Ventanas `Provincia de los Ríos.

Los miembros de la  VCR Vencedores Unidos, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto Anchoveta vía al Recinto la Templanza, perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, esta ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz. 

Hugo se dedica  se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz, Compra y vende los  productos en el Comercial Peña.

Solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, insumos, fertilizantes, abonos para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades. Su sueño es comprar un carro para poder transportar los productos.
En los tiempos libres le gusta ver televisión.
texts.en:
Hugo is 20 years old, single with no children, and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.
