The members of the “ VCR Vencedores Unidos” located in the area of Anchoveta, on the way to Templanza, belong to the canton of Pueblo Viejo. This solidarity group works in agriculture, growing short-cycle corn and rice. 

Hugo works in agriculture growing corn and rice. He buys and sells his products in the Comercial Peña.

He is asking for a loan in order to buy seeds, supplies, and fertilizer for his crops. The loan will help him financially supply his needs. He encounters problems such as pests and diseases. 

His dream is to buy a car in order to transport his crops. In his free time he likes to watch television.

loans.use: to buy seeds, supplies, fertilizer, and manure

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is married with six children and lives in his own house in Hioma, Uganda. He has had a fishing and carpentry business for eight years. He faces the challenge of a lack of adequate equipment to catch the fish, which affects his business profits. 

With the income earned from fishing, Nicholas has been able to pay school fees for his children. His business dream is to buy a fishing boat. Nicholas needs this loan to buy a conoe for fishing.

loans.use: to buy a canoe for fishing.

loans.name: Manuel Mercedes

texts.es:
Manuel, vive en casa propia con su esposa y tres hijos, él se dedica a la fotografía, lleva 6 años dedicándose a este oficio, realiza la toma de fotografías y videos en eventos sociales, su esposa le apoya para cualquier ocasión.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de papel fotográfico, cuadros de vidrio y madera, también darle mantenimiento a su equipo, este préstamo le ayudara para comprar los materiales necesarios y darle continuidad al negocio.
La aspiración de Manuel es que su foto estudio mejore, tener todo lo necesario para atender la demanda, y en su familia pues quiere apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo posible.
texts.en:
Manuel lives in his own home with his wife and three children. He has been a photographer for six years. Manuel takes photographs and videos at social events. His wife helps him with any occasion.

He is currently requesting a loan to buy photography paper, glass and wood frames, as well as pay for maintenance of his equipment. This loan will help him buy the necessary materials so that he can continue his business.

Manuel’s aspirations are to improve his photography studio, have everything he needs to keep up with demand, and to support his children in everything as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy photography paper, glass and wood frames, as well as pay for maintenance of his equipment.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old. She is married with 5 children.
Jocelyn has a store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages and develop her mini store.
Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell like snacks, canned goods, and beverages

loans.name: Laura Betzabe

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 20 De Abril se reúne cada 15 días en el Cantón Montecristi (Portoviejo), conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí conocimos a Laura, tiene 23 años  de edad, está soltera y  estudia  el quinto semestre de Agroindustria en una Universidad de Manta. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres. 

Ella para generar sus propios recursos puso un pequeño local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de repuestos para carros, como su casa está muy cerca de un taller mecánico tiene muy buenas ventas, trabaja todos los días por las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ir a la Universidad, pero en las tardes su papá se queda en el negocio hasta la noche. Recién tiene 6 meses con su negocio y le está yendo bastante bien.

Este crédito es para  comprar repuestos y refacciones de automóviles. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos pudo empezar su negocio. 

Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser profesional.
texts.en:
The "20 de Abril" communal bank meets every 15 days in Montecristi canton in Portoviejo province, which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture, and for its handicrafts, recognized at the national and international level. This is the home of the famous toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats).

This is where we met Laura, who is 23, and single. She is in her fifth semester of Agroindustry at the University of Manta.

She doesn't have her own house, so she lives in her parents' house. To generate her own resources, she set up a small shop in her house, where she sells every kind of spare part for cars. Because her house is very close to an auto repair shop, she has very good sales. 

She works every day in the mornings, since in the afternoons she has to go to the University. But in the afternoons, her dad stays in the shop until the evening. She has only had her business for six months, and it's going quite well.

This loan is for buying spare parts for automobiles. She has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles, and she likes it because with the loans she was able to start her business. Her dream is to finish her studies and be a professional

loans.use: To buy spare parts for cars.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Candelaria tiene 49 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus cinco hijos.

Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que se dedica a la agricultura a sembrar maíz y fríjol. Para ayudar a su esposo y brindarle el estudio a sus cinco hijos. Antes Candelaria solo se ocupaba de los oficios del hogar, pero decidió ayudar a su esposo y cultivar granos y a la crianza de cerdos.

Los animales son comprados en una ciudad cercana a su vivienda, que esta a una hora en autobús, una  vez los compra los traslada a su vivienda en compañía de uno de uno de sus hijos que le ayuda.

La señora Candelaria, solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo, para comprar un cerdo y 100 pollos de engorde y  el concentrado para alimentarlos. Ella tiene experiencia en esta actividad, por lo que manifiesta que es muy rentable.

Con el préstamo Candelaria diversificara sus especies y obtendrá mayores ingresos al ofrecer variedad y mayor cantidad. Lo cual le servirá de mucho, para el sostenimiento de su familia. Ella espera contar con una granja bien establecida y proporcionar el estudio a sus hijos para que sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 49 years old.  She lives with her life partner and her five children.

Candelaria is a very hard-working woman who farms, growing corn and beans, in order to help her husband and provide her five children with an education.  In the past, she used to solely take care of her household chores but she decided to help her husband, growing grains and raising pigs.

The animals are bought in a nearby town which is one hour away by bus.  Once she has bought them, she transports them home with the help of one of her children.

Candelaria is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy a pig and 100 chickens to fatten.  She will also buy concentrate to feed them with.   She has experience in this business and she says that it is very profitable.

With her loan, Candelaria will diversify her species and obtain more income by offering a variety of animals and in larger quantities.  This will help her a lot in supporting her family.  She hopes to have a well-established farm and to provide her children with an education so that they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy a pig and 100 chickens to fatten, and to buy concentrate to feed them with

loans.name: Ayo Ayo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “AYO AYO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Luisa es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de verduras, venta de lubricantes, panadería, venta de tarjetas TIGO, venta de ganado, tienda de barrio.

La señora Luisa  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de panadería que viene trabajando hace años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de su esposo.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de harina) que adquirirá de las Ferias y posteriormente a la elaboración lo venderá en su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito ágil, la capacitación en salud y el seguro.
texts.en:
The communal association Ayo Ayo will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the focal center Patacamaya. It's made up of nine members and is led by a board whose president is Luisa. The business that the members of the communal association advance are varied. Between them there is: vegetable sales, lubricant sales, a bakery, TIGO card sales, livestock sales, and a neighborhood store.

Luisa indicates that this is the first time that she's working with Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution after being invited by a promoter. Currently she has a bakery business that she's had for years, and which she learned from her husband.

She will take out a loan to raise her capital (buying flour) which she will obtain from the market and subsequently will sell in her community after baking. This kind of work allows her to generate resources with which to support her family since she cohabits and has two children.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the loan and health trainings and the insurance.

loans.use: to buy flour.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha lives in the coastal town of Kongowea, Kenya. She is married and has two school-going children. Tabitha operates a secondhand clothes shop which has been running for the last seven years.

She was invited into Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of Ksh 40,000 to purchase a stock of secondhand clothes for her business. She looks forward to establishing a wholesale clothes shop in the future. 

The high inflation being experienced in most areas is her main challenge since it has reduced the purchasing power of most customers. The extra income obtained from this business will help her raise the standard of living of her family and provide better education.

loans.use: To purchase a stock of secondhand clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sugey Del Carmen

texts.es:
Sugey, quiere aumentar su negocio para esta temporada, por eso se acerco a solicitar un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en lociones para ofrecer a la clientela, ya que se acerca el tiempo de regalar por eso quiere mantener en el negocio variedad de lociones que pueden ser una opción para regalar.
Ella ha tenido una buena experiencia en la administración de estos préstamos, y han sido para ella y su familia una gran fortaleza para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Sugey wants to expand her business for this season which is why she approached the field partner to ask for a new loan to invest in lotions to offer her customers as the time for giving presents is approaching. This is why she wants to stock a variety of lotions which can be used for presents. She has had a good experience managing these loans and they have been for her and her famliy a great help in increasing profits.

loans.use: to buy lotions.

loans.name: Ela Carmela

texts.es:
Ela es una mujer de 27, soltera, que se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortas, bocaditos, entre otros, esta actividad la desarrolla desde hace más de 8 años, junto a su madre y a su hermana, a través del tiempo ha demostrado mucho interés en continuar mejorando el servicio en su trabajo, es por ello que actualmente también realiza decoraciones en los eventos donde vende sus tortas. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ella puede llegar a ganar hasta S/.64 diarios, lo que le permite cubrir todos los gastos que debe afrontar mensualmente, como la preparación de las tortas y gastos personales.

Ella se dedica también a atender la bodega de su madre junto a su hermana, lo que les permite un ingreso extra a ambas. “Un recuerdo que tengo es cuando prepare junto a mi hermana una torta de 3 pisos, cubierta de masa elástica, y por accidente se nos cayó, tuvimos que arreglarla en ese momento, afortunadamente todo salió bien” comenta Ela entre risas.

Gracias a los prestatarios Kiva Ela podrá tener mayor cantidad de dinero, lo que la ayudará a poder comprar algunos materiales que le son necesarios. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ella llegará a su meta, brindar el servicio de alquiler de mesas, sillas, manteles y una mejor decoración donde venda sus tortas y bocaditos, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ela is a single woman who is 27 years of age. She has been preparing and selling cakes, snacks, and other foods for more than eight years alongside her mother and sister. Over time, Ela has demonstrated great interest in improving the service she provides in her business. For this reason, she currently makes decorations for events in addition to selling cakes. Thanks to her effort and dedication, Ela has been able to earn 64 PEN each day, which enables her to cover her monthly expenses. This includes preparing cakes and her personal expenses.

Ela also manages a grocery store with her mother and sister, which enables them to earn extra income. “One memory I have is when my sister and I prepared a cake with three layers and covered it with icing. The cake fell down by accident and we had to repair it at that moment. Fortunately, everything ended well,” recalls Ela with a laugh.

Thanks to the Kiva lenders, Ela will be able to access more money to help her buy some necessary supplies. As a result of her effort and dedication, she will be able to reach her goal. Ela will provide rental services that offer tables, chairs, tablecloths, and major decorations from the same shop where she sells cakes and snacks. This will enable her have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy baking and decorating supplies.

loans.name: Estefania

texts.es:
Estefania de 39 años convive con Isaías hace más de 20 años. En todo ese tiempo vieron nacer a 3 hijos, que ahora tienen 18, 14 y 8 años. Ella vive con los 2 menores en su casa propia en la comunidad nativa de Pachacutec, Chanchamayo. Estefanía creció en el campo. Vio a sus padres trabajar la tierra y por eso aprendió a desenvolverse con facilidad en sus propios terrenos. Ahora ella cuenta con 3 parcelas de terrenos cultivables, ahí siembra café, achiote, plátanos y maíz. Cada uno de estos productos es muy bien cuidado por Estefanía e Isaías. Ambos distribuyen su tiempo para dedicarse a la limpieza, abonamiento, y cosecha de sus cultivos.
Cuando es época de cosecha el trabajo es más intenso y tiene que contratar personal para apresurarlo. Una vez cosechado, traslada sus productos hacia la ciudad de Pichanaki y los ofrece por kilos, latas o cajones. Ahí los compradores ya la conocen. Ella está contenta con los resultados y espera multiplicar su producción, para ello deberá alquilar o comprar terrenos. Esas son metas más próximas. Sería la primera vez que Estefania obtendría un préstamo de MFP, por eso manifiesta ser responsable con el pago de las cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Los Claveles de Pachacutec”, del que siente contenta y esperanzada.
Con el dinero del crédito comprará bolsas de abonos orgánicos para el café y con lo restante pagará a jornaleros para que limpien sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Estefanía, 39, has lived with Isaías for more than 20 years; they’ve had three children in that time who are now 18, 14 and 8 years old.  She lives with the two younger ones in her own house in the indigenous community of Pachacutec, Chanchamayo.  Estefanía grew up in the fields.  She watched her parents till the soil and learned how to easily work her own land.  Now, she has three parcels of farmland where she grows coffee, achiote, bananas and corn.  Each of these products is well cared for by Estefanía and Isaías.  They both divide their time between weeding, fertilizing and harvesting their crops.

When it’s harvest time and work is more intense she needs to hire staff to get it done more quickly.  Once harvested she transports her products to the city of Pichanaki and sells it by the kilo, can or case.  Buyers there already know her.  She’s happy with the results and expects to multiply her production.  To do so she must either lease or buy more land.  These are her most pressing goals.

This will be the first time Estefanía will get an MFP loan and she states that she will be responsible with her installment payments.  She’s belongs to the “Los Claveles de Pachacutec” (Pachacutec Carnations) communal bank and she feels happy and hopeful.  She will use the money from the loan to buy sacks of organic manure for the coffee and the rest of it to pay day laborers to do the weeding.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Djiguéne Bakhna 38 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de crédit Djiguène Bakhna  n°38 compte cinq membres  qui font du petit commerce .Leur activité consiste à vendre des fruits (orange, mandarine…) Elles habitent dans la même maison. 
La présidente Ndèye Ndoumbé  à une expérience de dix ans dans ce domaine .Elle participe à la dépense quotidienne  de son  foyer. Elle aimerait dans  l’avenir refinancer son bénéfice dans son activité  pour avoir une bonne assise.
texts.en:
Djiguène Bakhna n°38 Group comprises five members who are retailers. Their businesses consist in selling fruits (oranges, mandarins, etc). They live in the same house.

The group's president, Ndèye Ndoumbé, has ten years of experience in this field. She helps to cover the daily expenses of her household. In the future, she would like to reinvest her profit in her business, to give it a strong basis.

loans.use: to buy and resell fruits

loans.name: 301 Mahutin Ave Maria Group

texts.fr: 301 MAHUTIN AVE MARIA est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui des amies. Afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Médessè Mélanie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 33 ans. Médessè Mélanie n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Médessè Mélanie est mariée à un commerçant du nom de Eric. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Médessè Mélanie vend des fruits de saison et des articles de quincaillerie depuis huit ans, ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Médessè Mélanie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Médessè Mélanie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe 301 MAHUTIN AVE MARIA, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saison et des articles de quincaillerie.

loans.name: Sèvèho Remi

texts.fr: Sèvèho Remi âgé de 38 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire mais a appris la couture, activité qu'il exerce depuis dix huit ans dans son atelier. Sèvèho Remi est marié à une marchande du nom de Béatrice. Le couple a deux enfants, un scolarisé et tous à leur charge. Sèvèho Remi vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Sèvèho Remi s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de Sèvèho Remi devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Sèvèho Remi sollicite une cinquième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter une marchine à broder et un groupe électrogène.

loans.name: Iddi

texts.en: Iddi is 24 years old living in Bundibugyo Uganda. He trades in cocoa and beans mainly buying and selling and earns additional income from cocoa gardens. He started the business in 2011 mainly to get income, although challenged by increasing transport costs and limited capital. He wants to expand and sell to bigger cocoa agents in future. He has a plan of building his own family house and is now requesting for a loan to buy cement and bricks for constructing  his house.

loans.use: to buy cement and bricks for constructing  his house.

loans.name: Nezat

texts.en: Nezat H. is 39 years old. She is in retail business for 9 years. Nizat has a knitwear and ready made clothes shop on the cooperative market of Razgrad. She is running her business alone and yet alone she supplies her shop from wholesale stores in Ruse and Dimitrovgrad. She is famous as an honest and well mannered trader and thus she has a great number of customers. The loan of $ 900 she applies for is going to be used for working capital.

loans.use: For working capital

loans.name: Gulbuta

texts.en:
20 years ago, this very kind woman decided to start her own business. She is a mother of 6 children, lives in Salyan region Khaladj village.
This 58-year-old woman wants to provide her children with a better future.
Now she needs a loan of $600 to buy a pregnant cow.

loans.use: To buy a pregnant cow

loans.name: Det

texts.en: Mrs Det and her husband are 46 years old. They have three children between the ages of 10 and 17. Her two older children stopped going to school, but the third is still in school. They do not have any land for cultivation and only have a hut. Her elder son works as a daily laborer, but he cannot find work easily. The family's living depends on both Mrs Det and her husband's business of buying waste materials from door to door, and then selling it to the local recycling company. This work increased their incomes about $4/person/month. The average income is $12/person/month. However, she does not have enough capital to buy much waste material so that she can earn more. They want to borrow a loan of $75, and she promises she will repay per month.

loans.use: buying waste materials

loans.name: Selma

texts.es:
A member of the communal association Stars of the Sea of the Villa Adela center, Selma is a stylist by profession and the mother of 2 school age children. She joined Pro Mujer approximately a year and a half ago.

She used to work as an assistant in various beauty salons on the Avenida 16 de Julio, dreaming of the day when she would be able to have her own business.

Two years ago, thanks to the help of a relative, Selma succeeded in opening her own beauty salon, very modest and with barely the space necessary. Thanks to her first loan, she was able to buy hair color, creams and other products she needs for her work.

At the moment Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity to provide them. For this reason, she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials to be able to hire employees and establish herself in the industry, thereby improving her quality of her life and that of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Pertenece a la Asociación Comunal Estrellas de Mar del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, de profesión estilista, Selma R. es madre de 2 hijos en edad escolar. Ingresa a Pro Mujer hace aproximadamente 1 año y medio.

Trabajó como ayudante en varios salones de belleza de la Av. 16 de Julio, soñando siempre en el día en que podría tener su propio negocio.

Hace 2 años y gracias a la ayuda de uno de sus familiares, Selma logra la apertura de su propio salón de belleza, muy modesto y con el mobiliario apenas necesario. Gracias al primer crédito desembolsado, logra comprar tintes, cremas y otros productos para poder realizar su trabajo.

Actualmente Selma necesita de capital para poder ampliar su negocio, puesto que gracias a su buen trabajo, la demanda de su clientela rebasa su capacidad, es por eso que quiere comprar un tocador y más material de trabajo para poder tener algunos dependientes y establecerse en el rubro, mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

loans.use: Selma needs capital to be able to expand her business. Thanks to her good work, demand for her services is outpacing her capacity; she would like to buy a stylist's table and more materials which would allow her to hire employees and establish herself in the industry.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 49 years old and has six children and 14 grandchildren. She was able to send three of her children to school.She has been an Esperanza client for one year and has already successfully paid back two loans (one for 150 USD and one for 240 USD). Now she's applying for a third loan.

Valentina buys her clothes in the nearby city of La Romana and sells them out of her house. She says her business is better than the competition in the nearby cities, because the people in her community don´t have to pay money to travel in order to go shopping.

Valentina is going to use her next loan to start construction on a little store abutting her house, so she doesn´t have to keep selling her clothes from her porch.

loans.use: To build a small space next to her house where she can sell clothes

loans.name: Tudor

texts.en: Tudor V. worked abroad a period of time in order to earn more money and to give a future to his family with two little daughters. When his wife became ill, he had to return to his country. Here, in Moldova, he has 0.2 ha of peach orchard and 0.8 ha of vineyard. He would like to take a loan at Microinvest to buy orchard and vineyard supplies and hopes Kiva lenders will choose to help him.

loans.use: purchase peach trees and vineyard supplies

loans.name: Nursiti

texts.id:
Nursiti deals with garbage every day. Together with her kid, she starts patrolling with her carriage in Ubung market and Pidada area from 6am to look for second-hand goods. She arrives at home at 9am and then she cooks for the family. In the afternoon, Nursiti sorts the goods. Sometimes she buys cardboard from the shops around Ubung. In the evening, she sells the goods to second-hand collectors. Her profit is Rp 35,000 (about $3.7) per day. She uses it for the business continuation, for her saving, and sometimes for her parents in Java. She runs this business together with her kid. She uses a carriage and a motorcycle. She has to help covering the daily expense of Rp 15,000 ($about 1.6) and the rent fee.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Bergaul dengan sampah merupakan pekerjaan Nursiti setiap hari. Pukul 06.00 dia sudah berkeliling dengan gerobak bersama anaknya untuk mencari barang bekas di seputaran Pasar Ubung dan wilayah Pidada. Pukul 09.00 dia sampai di rumah dan langsung memasak untuk anak dan keluarganya. Setiap siang hari Nursiti menyortir setiap barang yang didapatinya. Kadang dia juga membeli kardus dari toko - toko di seputaran ubung. Sore ia menjual barang – barang bekas yang didapatinya kepada pengepul. Keuntungan usaha Rp 35.000,00/hari yang ia peroleh diputar untuk modal usaha, juga untuk ditabung dan dikirim ke Jawa untuk orang tuanya. Bersama dengan anaknya Nursiti menekuni usaha ini. Sarana yang digunakan adalah gerobak dan sepeda motor. Biaya hidup per hari Rp 15.000,00 dan biaya kontrak tempat tinggal mereka tanggung bersama.

loans.use: To purchase second-hand goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy more utensils, tables, chairs and food for her little restaurant

loans.name: Khamid

texts.en:
K. Khamid lives and works in Khujand. Mr. K. sells his goods for commercial use, so he has a stall in the largest food bazaar in the region. He sells macaroni, spaghetti, salt, and the plastic packages. He is also a very experienced carpenter, so he sometimes sells hand-made objects.

Mr. K. has 10 years of business experience. He is applying for a loan of $1050 to develop his business by importing more goods.

loans.use: To develop his business by importing new goods

loans.name: Victoria Pascuala

texts.es:
Victoria has belonged to the Ayni II communal bank for 9 years. In her communal bank, she has learned to have self esteem, to save money, and to manage her business well.

Victoria is separated, is 42-years-old, and has 3 children. Victoria has a chicken restaurant located in the Ayacuchana jungle. She tells us that when she started her restaurant, it was in the city of Ayacucho, but since she separated from her husband, she decided to go live with her parents. Victoria also has a transportation company with her siblings, and Victoria is in charge of its administration.

Victoria needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in a new restaurant with modern chairs.

Victoria's dreams are to buy a car and a house in the city of Ayacucho, and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Ayni II hace 9 años, en su Banco Comunal aprendió a tener autoestima, a ahorrar y administrar bien su negocio.

Victoria es separada tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Victoria tiene un restaurante pollería ubicado en la selva ayacuchana, Victoria cuenta que al inicio su restaurante estaba en la ciudad de Ayacucho pero a razón de su separación con su esposo decidió ir a vivir con sus padres. Además Victoria junto a sus hermanos tienen una empresa de transporte en la cual Victoria se encarga de la administración.

Victoria necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles dinero que será invertido en la nueva implementación de su restaurante con sillas modernas.

Los sueños de Victoria son comprar un carro, una casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho y que sus hijas sean profesionales.

loans.use: Victoria needs a loan of 2500 soles, money which will be invested in a new restaurant with modern chairs.

loans.name: Mwanahamis's Sana Tu Group

texts.en:
Mwanahamis is 45 years old and is married with 3 children, aged 30, 27 and 15. Mwanahamis owns a small shop, which she started in 2005. She works every day from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more items (shoes and clothes) for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Fatuma and Isana, who have businesses dealing in charcoal and firewood sales, and clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more items (shoes and clothes) for her shop

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith A. is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She hawks female wrappers - a trade she learnt for two years. Faith has been running the business for 5 years; she lives in Benin City, Edo state, Nigeria. Faith has borrowed from LAPO Microfinance before, and currently needs a loan of $700 to buy more female wrapper for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of female wrapper for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther B. is a 35-year-old divorced wife with a daughter who is currently in school. She assumed full responsibility of financing her daughter’s education when she was divorced by her husband. Esther has owned and operated a seamstress shop for the past seven years. She sews all forms of female wear in various styles that suit the tastes of her customers, like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes etc. Esther wants to use the loan to buy additional supplies to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise a good income to provide her daughter with a quality education. Esther is a member of the community group called Holy Trinity Trust Group. In this group, members provide guarantees for one another to access loans.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing materials like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Tamaraneh Group

texts.en: K. I. is 40 years old and married with 5 children.  He sells basic building materials such as wiremesh, nails, and few bags of cement.  With his previous loan, he diversified his business and would like to do the same to increase his income.  His future plan is to establish a large building materials  shop.  I. is the group leader with 3 other members.  Henry owns a small pharmacy that sells basic medicines, Fatmat sells rice, peanuts and palm oil and John sells plastic sandals and cotton clothes.  The group is requesting a loan of Le. 3,200,000 to expand their businesses.

loans.use: Increase stocks of bulding meterials, medicines and food items.

loans.name: Thi Hai

texts.vi:
MRs. P. Thi Hai, 48 years old, has 3 children, 1 of whom is still schooling. In 2001, she joined the TYM Fund to obtain loans and invest in raising livestock. Besides livestock, she also plants fruit trees to take advantage of her large garden. After 7 years of membership, thanks to the loans and her hard work, her family's income has increased and the quality of life has improved. This time, she would like to borrow 12,000,000VND (725USD) to continue investing in rearing pigs and planting fruit trees.

Translated from Vietnamese by P. Yen Thanh, Kiva Volunteer.

Chị Phạm Thị Hải năm nay 48 tuổi. Gia đình chị có 3 người con trong đó có 1 con đang tuổi đi học. Năm 2001 chị tham gia vàoQuỹ tình thương vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi. Ngoài chăn nuôi, tận dụng vườn rộng gia đình chị còn trồng thêm các loại cây ăn quả để tăng thêm thu nhập.Qua 7 năm, nhờ có nguồn vốn vay của Quỹ và sự cố gắng nỗ lực làm ăn kinh tế gia đình chị đã phát triển, cuộc sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện hơn. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 12.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và trồng cây ăn quả.

loans.use: Rearing pigs and planting fruit trees

loans.name: Yesenia Marisol

texts.es:
Yesenia Marisol G. Z. vive en Ciudad Arce, departamento de La Libertad, y tiene dos hijos, un niño de seis y una niña de doce. Desde hace ya cuatro años, Yesenia junto a su suegra montaron un pequeña tienda, desafortunadamente, la suegra de Yesenia no puedo continuar ayudándole en la tienda, pues tiene diabetes, condición que le provoca muchos problemas de salud.
Con mucho esfuerzo, Yesenia Marisol ha sido capaz de mantener la tienda a flote, y hace dos meses, agrego una venta de tortillas y zapatos deportivos.  El préstamo que ella solicita, es para poder comprar mercadería como tortillas y zapatos. Este préstamo le permitiría a ella generar ingresos alternativos  y estabilizar su situación económica para poder proveer una mejor vida a sus hijos y suegra enferma.
texts.en:
Yesenia Marisol G. Z. lives in Ciudad Arce, La Libertad and has two children – a six-year-old boy and a twelve-year-old girl. For four years, Yesenia, together with her mother-in-law, managed a small store. Unfortunately, Yesenia’s mother-in-law cannot continue helping her in the store because she has diabetes, which causes many health problems.

With a lot of effort, Yesenia Marisol has been able to keep the store afloat, and two months ago, she began seling tortillas and sports shoes. The loan that she is requesting will allow her to purchase merchandise like tortillas and shoes. This loan will let her generate alternative sources of income and establish her economic situation so that she can provide a better life to her children and ill mother-in-law.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise (tortillas and sports shoes)

location.town: Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sefer

texts.en:
Sefer I. is 37 years old, single, and has been in business for the past 6 years selling cell phone accessories such as chargers, earphones and cases. His business is located in the central market of Imishli city. Sefer runs his business very skillfully and has great prospects for growing it in the future. 

This year is crucial for Sefer because he plans to be married soon. To raise his income and support his new status as a husband, he is planning to expand his business and buy more accessories to sell. To make this possible, he is seeking a loan of US$1200 which he will pay back in 15 months He promises to repay the loan in a timely manner and thanks everyone for their support, which will help him tremendously and make his wedding possible.

loans.use: to buy more cell phone accessories to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: She will buy 10 loads of potatoes for $50 USD and a sack of starch for $70 USD.

loans.name: Uber

texts.es: Uber tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos. Hace 3 años implementó un  taller de cerrajería en su propia casa, antes solamente se dedicaba a la agricultura y a la crianza de animales, pero como las ganancias no eran suficientes optó por ejercer un oficio adicional, cuando era joven se capacitó como cerrajero en la ciudad, ahora con creatividad diseña y fabrica puertas, ventanas entre otras cosas de metal, su destreza han logrado que los pedidos vayan en aumento. Uber está satisfecho, porque está dedicándose a lo que le agrada realizar en la vida y a la vez sostiene a su familia. Es la primera vez que Uber solicita un préstamo en MFP y se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos. La cantidad requerida será invertida en la compra de fierro al por mayor, además de abono para sembrar papa.
texts.en:
Uber is 43 years old, he lives with his wife and their 4 children. Three years ago he set up a locksmith shop in his home. Before he spent all of his time in farming and raising livestock, but seeing that his profits were not enough he opted to take up another business. When he was young he worked as a locksmith in the city, and now with some creativity he designs and makes doors, windows and other metal items. And his skills have given him increasing orders. Uber is happy because his work is something that he likes to do in life and at the same time he is supporting his family. This is the first time Uber is requesting a loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time. The requested funds will be invested in teh purchase of wholesale steel and he will also purchase fertlizer for his potatoe fields.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase steel and fertilizer for his fields.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El señor Bernardo está casado con Wilma Fernández Melgarejo, tienen dos hijos, actualmente Bernardo tiene 32 años y Wilma tiene 37 años. El señor tiene un puesto en el microcentro de la ciudad donde vende sabanas, toallas, bermudas, camisetas deportivas, conjuntos varios, la señora Wilma tiene también su puesto de venta independiente del marido.
 Los negocios están uno al lado del otro, en la misma zona,  y cuentan que las ventas son muy buenas. Recientemente con algunos ahorros y con las ganancias del negocio han logrado construir para su casa propia, lo que además los ha dejado con un capital muy ajustado. El crédito que solicitan será para inyectar mayor capital a los negocios. 
En diciembre las ventas suelen ser mayores, por lo que ellos quieren estar bien preparados para poder abastecer con la gran demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Bernardo is married to Wilma Fernandez Melgarejo and they have two children. Bernado is 32 years old and Wilma is 37 years old. Bernardo has a stall in the city center where he sells sheets, towels, shorts, sport shirts, and similar products; Wilma also has a stall, separate from her husband's. The businesses are next to one another in the same area and they say that sales are very good. They recently used savings and earnings from their businesses to build a house but the expenditure has left them short of funds. They're applying for a loan to inject more capital into the businesses. Sales are usually highest in December so they want to be ready by stocking what their customers will most demand.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resale.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
A 33-year-old woman from Biasong, Analyn V. is coping with with the challenges of her fishing business. Mrs. Analyn V., married with 2 kids, started her business from a mere capital of Php 3,000. She joined Paglaum MPC for the chance to receive loans. Her husband who is a fisherman is very supportive in taking care of their business.

They bring their catch to the nearest market and even sell some around their barangay. The small business has been doing so well that she confidently decided to expand. She has it in mind to maintain a good credit standing, and then, whatever may happened, she can always run to the cooperative. She envisions acquiring an additional fishing boat. She also dreams of renovating their little house and saving now for education for their children.

loans.use: additional capital for fishing business

location.town: Plaridel - Biasong, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia is requesting a loan amounting to $150 (PHP 6,000.00) for the repair of their passenger tricycle which is being operated by her two children. Their children rent her tricycle and give her a daily income of PHP120.00 as their rental fee. If there is extra money after repairing their tricycle, she is planning to use it to start a vending business. Leticia is hoping the progress of her current and future business will benefit her family.

Leticia is married to Danilo, a simple farmer in the community. They have four children: Mary Ann, 30, Leonila, 28, both who are elementary school graduates; Dominador, 27, Danilo, 25, both who were high school graduates. The parents were not able to send their children to school because of their poor living conditions.

loans.use: Tricycle Repair

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is a 34 year old mother of three.  She is married to a farmer. She buys and resells bananas and vegetables to help her husband. 

She applied for a loan to buy pigs because she wants to apply the experience that she learned from her mother in raising pigs. She dreams of having a piggery in the future. She wants to help her husband send their children to school. She hopes that her three children, who are in preparatory and elementary school, will go to college. She also hopes that her family will be stable and to save money.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade is 37 years old; she sells foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks. She is married with 4 children. She lives in  Lagos State, Nigeria. She wants to satisfy the demand of her customers by requesting the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs, provisions, and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs, provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Jama Khan Group

texts.en:
Sajeyda is the group leader of Jama khan group. There are five members in this group. All of them would like to receive money for his or her business to purchase more materials for their business and make a good income for their family's future.

Maleha wants to take a loan for her son’s business of tailoring, to buy a new machine for his business. Sabara wants to take a loan for her son’s business of electricity, so he can buy the necessary materials for his business. Jama khan wants to take a loan for his business, a general store, so he can make his shop larger. Sajeda and Bibi Shafeqa want to take a loan for their fruit cart business, to expand and progress the business.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger, support their families and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: They want to expand and progress their businesses

loans.name: Rafael Antonio

texts.es:
Rafael Antonio R. H. reside en el municipio de Comasagua junto a su compañera de vida. Rafael posee una panadería la cual esta ubicada en su propio hogar, él se encarga de hacer el pan y su compañera de vida le ayuda únicamente a repartirlo.
Rafael solícita un préstamo a través del cual obtenga el dinero necesario para poder comprar una motocicleta, la cual contribuya a que pueda repartir en pan de manera más segura y más rápida. Así él espera brindar un mejor servicio por medio del cual pueda mejorar su reputación y de esta manera obtener mayor clientela, todo esto ayudara a que el pueda obtener una mejor estabilidad económica junto a su esposa y puedan forma un mejor hogar juntos.
texts.en:
Rafael Antonio R. H. lives in Comasagua with his life partner. He has a bakery business located in his own home. He is in charge of making bread while his partner helps deliver it.

Rafael is requesting a loan to have enough money to be able to purchase a motorcycle to deliver his products in a safer and faster manner. He hopes to provide his customers better service, which will improve his reputation and attract new customers. This will help him have a more stable financial situation so that he and his wife can create a better home together.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a motorcycle
